loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace dos ciclos,  su  primer préstamo fue por la suma  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir-boutique y alquiler de prendas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará vestidos para ofrecer en venta y alquiler.  La señora vende en la localidad de Ilave y trabaja sola en el  negocio.
Su sueño es agrandar el negocio y poner otro más que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo, la solidaridad y la amabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 40 years old, single and has no children.  She’s had some higher education.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her clothing sales business (boutique) and clothing rental business.

She will use this new, 400 new sol, loan to increase her working capital buying dresses to sell and rent.  She sells in Ilave and works alone.

Her dream is to enlarge the business and open another one that will allow her to improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans, the solidarity and kindness among the members.

loans.use: to buy dresses to sell and rent.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 44 years old.  He resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.  Run is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife sells fish, meat, and vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. 

Run is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson, 42, is a married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for four years. He used  to sell cooking oil, and after accumulating reasonable capital, he ventured into his current business. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is owning a boutique and educating his children. Jackson needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has six children and all her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Beatrice operates a soft-drink kiosk. She has been in business for the last five years and works seven days a week. Beatrice sells her products on a retail basis. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda and a refrigerator. 

Her major challenges include thieves and the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and a refrigerator

loans.name: Salha

texts.en: Salha is a 44-year-old woman, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Salha and her family live in the Biet Lahia area in Gaza Strip. Salha's husband owns a shop providing services of cleaning up and polishing tiles. Salha received a loan of $1,500 in order to buy two tile polishing machines to replace the old one used currently. Salha's husband wants to expand his work due to the increasing demand for providing this service in the area where he lives. Salha's husband also used the loan from FATEN to purchase polishing machine soap as well as its accessories. The new machines will secure a better income for the family and attract more customers. Salha is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in the shop.

loans.use: to buy two tile polishing machines

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, todas ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Olga, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, ella se dedica a la elaboración y posterior venta de comidas de todo tipo. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, pues cuenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a comprar los ingredientes frescos para sus comidas. Ella dice que con el correr del tiempo ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, especias, fideos, arroz, en fin, todo lo que necesitara para la elaboración de sus comidas. Ella agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank was born with the effort and support of another communal bank that was found working in the area.  The group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They established the growth of each one of them, as much social as financial, as their main objective.  All of them are recognized in the area as very hard-working women.

Olga is a very enterprising and innovative woman.  She makes and later sells all types of food.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman.  She says that every day she gets up in the very early hours of the morning in order to go buy the fresh ingredients for her food.   

She says that over time she has gotten a good customer base.  Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, spices, noodles, rice, and finally, everything she will need to make her food.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it offers her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, and noodles to make food.

loans.name: Vu's Group

texts.en:
Vu was born in 1980. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a worker. Mrs Vu grows rice, sells vegetables and raises pigs. She has had these jobs for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 6.322.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy food for the pigs. She is the leader of a five-member group loan.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Xuan is 49 years old. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

 Toan is 58 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to invest in her livestock.

 Chu is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy 100 chickens.

 Ha is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for the ducks.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTOCABLES” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Plomería, tejido de mantas y venta de tostado

La señora Martha,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tostados que viene trabajando hace 26 años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tostados) que adquirirá de los almacenes de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en la Chacaltaya, Ceja y en las paradas de minibús. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en:
The communal bank "UNTOUCHABLES" will begin it's second cycle with Pro Woman. It is a part of the Los Andes regional office, made up of nine members, directed by board members, and is lead by Mrs. Martha. The businesses the members of the communal association partake in are varied and include: Plumbing, blanket weaving, and tostada (fried maiz tortilla) sales.

Mrs. Martha mentions that she has been working with Pro Woman for six months and became a part of the institution by a friend's invitation. At the moment she has a tsotada business she has been working in for 26 years.

The loan being requested will be used to buy more materials (buy tostadas) which are acquired through the warehouses in Ceja then subsequently sold in Chacaltaya, Ceja, and at the minibus stops. This type of job helps her make money to support her family since she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Woman, she says she likes the attention they offer.

loans.use: buy tostada (fried maiz tortillas.)

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат, у него уже взрослые дети. Александр живет и работает в Каховке, Херсонская область. Он торгует женской обувью на местном городском рынке вот уже 14 лет. На данный момент у Александра в товаре – 40 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль составляет около 7 000 гривен. 

Александру необходим кредит на сумму 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент осенней обуви перед новым торговым сезоном. Ему нравится работать именно с этим товаром, потому что у него высокая оборачиваемость, что помогает бизнесу Александра удержаться на плаву в непростое экономическое время. Клиент надеется и в будущем продолжать развивать свой бизнес и благодаря этому иметь возможность содержать семью. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Alexander is married and his children are already grown. He lives and works in Kahovka, Hersonskaya region. For 14 years he has sold women's shoes on the local city market. Alexander's goods are currently valued at 40,000 grivna, his profits are around 7,000 grivna.
He's asking for a loan in order to stock up on autumn shoes before the new trade season. He enjoys working with his product; it has a high turnover value which helps his business in difficult economic times. Alexander hopes to continue expanding his business and providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase autumn shoes before the new trade season.

loans.name: Ana Edith

texts.es: Ana Edith D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia al Sur del país y cerca a la zona costera. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad se ha hecho D. mucha clientela, pues su tienda es la más surtida D. la localidad siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan con productos D. muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas D. salir adelante para ella la disciplina es el mejor secreto en el trabajo, porque te permite realizar tus metas en el futuro, se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, bebidas, pan, entre otros. Ana Edith tiene fe que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana Edith is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home located in the south of the country near the coast. She runs a store from her house where she sells basic supplies. Ana Edith has many customers as her store is the best stocked in the area. She always has what her customers need and ensures that the quality is very good, the prices are fair, and also that the service is excellent.

Ana is a hardworking woman with the desire to get ahead. In her view discipline is the secret to success  as it allows you to achieve your future goals. She has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan so she can buy basic grains, candy, instant foods, drinks, bread etc. Ana Edith doesn't doubt that with sufficient effort she will succeed in providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, instant foods, drinks etc

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga is married and has 5 adult children.  She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.  

Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her business. 

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to buy another plot of land to increase her rice production.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz  de 50 años, vive en el centro de la ciudad  y se dedica a vender dulces y mecatos. Ella tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 18 a 30 años y desde hace 19 años se dedicó a la actividad comercial,  vendiendo mercancía variada y una vez se separó de su cónyuge, se dedicó plenamente a vender dulces en su pequeña chasa y también gaseosas.  Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar la educación de sus hijos especialmente la de los dos menores, ya que los dos mayores se dedicaron a trabajar en las tiendas y graneros,  para contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Beatriz se ubica diariamente en un parque cementerio y allí trascurre todo su días vendiéndole a una concurrente clientela. En la actualidad quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo y para ello está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará en mayor volumen dulcería y refrescos y adicionará jugos naturales  de frutas tropicales, los que tienen buena demanda en el inclemente calor del Caribe Colombiano.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 50, lives downtown and sells candy and snacks.  She has five children whose ages range from 18 to 30.  She started working in commerce 19 years ago selling assorted merchandise and when she separated from her spouse decided to go into candy and soft-drink sales full-time at home.  She’s managed to educate her children thanks to the business, especially her two youngest ones, since the two oldest decided to go work in stores and granaries to contribute to household expenses.

Beatriz sets herself up daily at a cemetery and spends the day there selling to the large clientele.  She currently would like to increase working capital and that’s why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy larger amounts of candy and soft-drinks and also to add natural tropical fruit juices which are in high demand in the inclement heat of the Colombian Caribbean.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of candy and soft-drinks and to add natural juices.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, donde se dedica a la estampación textil,  en compañía de su esposo trabajan todos los días para entregar los pedidos a tiempo y prestar un servicio que se caracterice por la efectividad y la calidad del producto.

Sueña con poderle ofrecer a su hijo un mejor futuro, estabilizarse económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, actualmente ve la necesidad de comprar más pinturas con las que se estampa, pero no tiene el capital necesario para hacer esta compra por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en esas herramientas de trabajo que son indispensables para la producción, la calidad y la efectividad.
texts.en:
Diane is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business, textile printing. Together, she and her husband work every day to fill orders on time and to produce a product characterized by its effectiveness and quality.  

She dreams of being able to provide a better future for her son, establishing herself economically and thus improving her quality of life. Currently she sees the necessity of buying more of the dyes used for printing, but lacks  the capital necessary to make this purchase. Consequently, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in those tools of the trade that are indispensable for production, quality and effectiveness.

loans.use: to buy dyes for textile printing.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is married and blessed with four children. She is 42 years old. To improve her family living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She is experienced in this field since she had started when she got married. She earned P45,000 with her last crop.

At this time, she is requesting a loan PHP25,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her business. She hopes to harvest more rice, which will enables her to generate higher income to the betterment of her family and improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Buyanzi Combine Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Buyanzi Combine Group in Western Kenya! This will be the third planting season that several of these farmers have had with Kiva partner One Acre Fund.
Caleb is the facilitator of the Buyanzi Combine Group. He takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had a very good maize yield harvesting fourteen bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Caleb will invest in business assets and livestock. In 2012, the members of Buyanzi Combine Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
Caleb is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la comunidad de Pachar, ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene diez hijos.  

Eduviges desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Eduviges requiere el préstamo para comprar más jora de maíz y unas cuantas cajas de cerveza. 

Eduviges se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Eduviges pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Eduviges was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the Pachar community.  She is 43 years old and is married; she has ten children from this beautiful relationship.

Eduviges undertakes her daily activities and her economic activities in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She works selling beer and chicha de jora (a typical Peruvian drink made from fermented corn).  She has been working in the business for several years already, and it has been going very well for her due to the effort that she puts into her work.

Eduviges is requesting the loan to purchase more corn jora and several cases of beer.

Eduviges is grateful for the opportunity being provided to her by this means, and also agrees to comply with her repayments according to the schedule.  Eduviges belongs to the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa and is in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy more corn jora (a fermented drink) and several cases of beer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Vilma has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married and has two children. She is 22 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Sheryl owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stocks to sell.

Sheryl joined PMPC in 2011. In the future, Sheryl hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, es soltera vive en casa propia, ella administra una tienda en su casa de productos de granos básicos como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, leche, churros, gaseosas, gatorade, jugos; desde hace 6 años se dedica a este oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar otros productos que mas los clientes necesitan como: jabón, detergentes, champoo, chinola, pasta, cepillos, solo a si podrá tener variedad y conseguir más clientela y las ganancias serán mejores cada día.
El sueño de María es siempre mantener su negocio estable y seguir trabajando con nuestra institución mantener un buen recod crediticio y siempre tener lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María is single and lives in her own home.  She runs a store in her home where she sells basic household products such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, milk, churros, soda, Gatorade and juice.  She has been in this business for 6 years and learned it on her own initiative.  She does not work fixed hours serving her customers.

María will use her loan to buy other products that her customers need such as soap, detergents, shampoo, rollers, toothpaste and brushes.  This is the only way she can have a greater variety of merchandise available.  She will attract more customers and her profits will improve.

María's dream is to keep her business stable, to continue working with our institution, to keep her good credit history and to have everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, shampoo, rollers, toothpaste and brushes

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 42 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Province of Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with two school-aged children.  Genie sells fresh fish on the market everyday to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns PHP 2,500.00 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase freshly-caught fish from fisherman and deliver to the market. 
Genie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Genie hopes to improve their living condition.

loans.use: To purchase freshly caught fish from fisherman and deliver to the market

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is a hardworking, 44-year-old farmer from Lolkeringet village in Kenya. She is a committed wife and a mother to two girls and two boys. She has been doing mixed farming for the last 18 years. Her main income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

Lenah enjoys dairy farming. She is contented with the life she has. Her ambition is to generate more income and take better care of the people she looks after. Her main challenge is low sales volume, but she is optimistic that she can turn it around by acquiring a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. Lenah finds keeping dairy cows to be a fun experience, besides it being a means of self-sufficiency and food security. With the loan, Lenah will get surplus dairy products from the cow, which could bring her extra income to keep up with raising family expenses. She acknowledges that keeping a dairy cow is a big commitment that needs careful preparation, but she knows she is up for the task and she is going to do it big.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en: Rosebella is 45 years old, married and blessed with three children aged between 10 and 18 years old. She has been in the dairy farming business for over 15 years now and it has been profitable. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to purchase dairy feeds and pesticides for her animals and hopes this will enable her to get more milk for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to help her husband in paying school fees for their children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to add more dairy cows and become a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds and pesticides for her animals and hopes this will enable her to get more milk for sell and make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Alvaro Gregorio

texts.en:
Alvaro lives in Mérida Yucatán and started his business with the aim to cover his personal expenses and pay for his studies. Currently Alvaro is not married, nor does he have a family, however, he wants to finish college now that he finds himself in the 4th semester of the BS program in Administration. He has lots of enthusiasm and is eager to meet his goals. Alvaro needs a loan of $925 USD to buy the ingredients that will allow him to continue selling his hamburgers, hot dogs and tacos.

For Alvaro this is the only way to earn an income and continue studying. You can support him and make it possible for him to finish college. He appreciates your support and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Alvaro vive en Mérida Yucatán inició su negocio con el propósito de cubrir sus gastos personales y sus estudios, actualmente Alvaro no esta casado ni tiene una familia, sin embargo el quiere terminar la universidad ya que se encuentra cursando el 4 semestre de la Licenciatura de Administración. El tiene mucho entusiasmo y ganas de lograr sus metas, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar insumos que le permita seguir vendiendo sus hamburguesas, hot dogs y tacos.

Para Alvaro este es el único medio para obtener un ingreso y continuar estudiando, tu puedes apoyarlo y hacer que finalice la universidad, el agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana sells candies and sodas in her neighborhood park. The majority of her clients are children. She says, "I have been coming to this park 9 years now and I put everything that I sell on a little table. I think it's time now to exchange my table for a well equipped little cart so that I can offer greater variety. To do this, I need an $800 loan."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Adriana se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos sus instalaciones son el parque de la colonia donde ella vive la mayoría de sus clientes son los niños. "Tengo ya 9 años viniendo a este parque y sobre una mesita pongo todo lo que vendo creo que ya es tiempo de cambiar mi mesa por un carrito bien equipado y así poder tener mas variedad para esto necesito una ayuda de $800.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy merchadise and a cart to sell candies/sweets.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: A 48 years old, Mrs. Esther A.  specializes on sales of shoes and bags since 2000. A business she learnt for 2 years. She plans to improve her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
We are asking for a loan to start building a room because we did not have much when we got married and we are still renting. Now we would like to have our own house. Since God quickly blessed us by making us parents, we want our son to have a safe place to live. We need a loan of $1,000.00 to build a room.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Estamos solicitando un préstamo para empezar a construir un cuarto tenemos poco que nos casamos y estamos pagando renta ,ya queremos tener nuestra propia casa. Ya que dios nos dio la bendición de pronto ser padres queremos que nuestro hijo tengo un lugar seguro donde vivir. Necesitamos la cantidad de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
Don Inocencio is 53 years old and his wife is 56. They are from the city of Carapeguá. Their company is Cerro Pinto. They have one child, a 14 year old boy who studies and is a soccer player.

More than 25 years ago they began selling milk and cheese; they began with just one cow and their business would expand to managing 12 milk cows. Unfortunately, Inocencio got sick and was forced to take some time off for a while. As a result, he had to sell almost all of his animals, as the costs of his treatment and medications were pretty high.

Thankfully, today Inocencio has totally recovered, and he is eager to continue moving forward; he began recuperating his business and now has 5 cows. He wants to buy more cows so that he can satisfy the great demand for them that currently exists. To this end therefore he asks for a loan so that he can use the money to buy milk cows.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Don Inocencio tiene 53 años de edad y su esposa 56, son de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañía Cerro Pinto. Tienen un sólo hijo varón de 14 años que estudia y es futbolista.

Hace más de veinticinco años que se iniciaron en la actividad de venta de leche y queso; comenzaron con una sola vaca, luego fueron creciendo hasta llegar a tener doce vacas lecheras. Lastimosamente, Inocencio padeció una enfermedad que lo hizo reposar por un buen tiempo, razón por la cual tuvo que vender casi todos sus animales, ya que el costo del tratamiento y los medicamentos eran bastante elevados.

Hoy día se encuentra totalmente recuperado, y con muchas ganas de seguir progresando; de a poco fue recuperando el negocio y hoy día ya cuenta con cinco vacas. Desea comprar más para así poder satisfacer la demanda existente, para ello solicita el préstamo ya que desea invertirlos en la compra de vacas lecheras.

loans.use: Purchase of two milk cows

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en: Mrs. Soksan P. was married in 2004 and now has one son. In 2001 Soksan P.'s mother taught her how to weave silk, and she started her own business that same year. Her husband works as a farmer in the village, growing vegetables and raising cows. She has borrowed the money from MAXIMA twice before, and she is now asking for a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase additional silk materials and thread in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en:
Suititi is married with ten children, and she’s 45 years old. She is very interested in working on her potted plants business, which she has been doing for three years. She applied for this loan (her second) in order to buy tools and add more new plants.

Most of her clients come over to her house and buy her plants. She earns about $100 USD ($250 ST) per week from her business or more if she has many clients that week. She also wishes to grow her green plants through her loans so the plants look pretty and she can get more money for them.

loans.use: To buy new tools and plants for her potted plants business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Ms. Maria Teresa R. has been living in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood for 10 years. This is the place where she had hoped to find a better life for her 4 children, who are all adults now and assist with the household expenses. Ms. R. has a mini market that has been steadily growing over the past few years, but unfortunately she has not generated sufficient funds for building a protective wall in front of her house that will provide security for her business. Due to her neighborhood’s high crime rate, she has found the need to build this wall so as to protect her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Teresa habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación desde hace 10 años. Lugar donde esperó encontrar una mejor vida con sus cuatros hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Doña Maria Teresa tiene un pulpería la cual ha venido creciendo con el pasar de los años, pero lastimosamente el dinero no le ha dado para poder asegurar su negocio al construir el muro delantero de su casa. Debido a la situación tan peligrosa por la que pasa el barrio, se le ha vuelto una nacesidad poder construir el muro, para asegurar su negocio.

loans.use: Construction of protective brick wall in front of her house

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia K. is a businesswoman running a wholesale shop in Nakifuma, with the help of her husband. She is 28 and has two children, plus one child of her sister's whom she cares for. She has been our client from day one, and it feels great growing with her. Her husband works in Jinja, another town, and it’s from here that he gets the goods for the shop, mainly on weekends when he comes back home in their family car. With her previous loan, she was able to add soda to her stock of flour, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes, and other items; with this loan, she wants to add beer. She believes nothing can stop her from success if she gets this loan.

loans.use: To buy beer for her wholesale shop

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
The need to get funds to maintain her household led Epifania to head to Gamarra--a grand commercial district of Lima--to work as a street vendor peddling fruits to passes-by. She sold fruit until a financial crash left her with too few customers to make a living. She didn't know what to do until she realized she could draw on the skills she had developed knitting in her spare time. That day, she tried her luck selling not only handicrafts but also sweaters and scarves and, to make a long story short, it went very well. She decided to leave fruit behind to start selling what she knitted. For ten years now, she's sold wool items, handicrafts, clothing, and shoes; she also offers lessons in knitting. With this work, she has strived alone to get ahead and support her two children, 24 and 6. The only thing that she wants is to have a regular market stand so that she can stop working as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La necesidad de conseguir recursos para la mantención de su casa llevo a Epifania a salir a las calles de Gamarra -un gran centro comercial de Lima- a vender frutas como ambulante. Estuvo vendiendo frutas durante una temporada hasta que hubo una crisis en la que no vendía lo suficiente. Epifania no supo qué hacer hasta que no le nació mejor idea que sacar las manualidades de lana que ella en su tiempo libre solía tejer. Aquel día probando suerte no solo vendió manualidades sino también algunos chalecos y bufandas, en resumen, le fue muy bien. De esta manera decidió dejar las frutas para empezar a vender lo que ella tejía. Hoy en día, desde hace diez años vende lanas, manualidades, prendas de vestir, zapatos y además brinda clases de tejido a las personas que lo solicitan. Con este oficio ella sola intenta sacar adelante su hogar y también a sus dos últimos hijos de 24 y 6 años. Lo único que ella anhela es tener un puesto estable y no ambulante para poder hacer crecer su mercadería ya que si bien se mudo de mercado, continúa de ambulante.

loans.use: Rent a market stall.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Santa Rosa D. Lima communal bank, located in the San Juan Bautista settlement, Block C, Lot 18, in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 39 years old, the mother of 4 children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan Rosa received from Manuela Ramos of ~$110, she invested in a small store.

Currently, she continues running her store and it has grown significantly and is well stocked. Her children help her to attend to the store and to do the household chores.

With the $750 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy one large sack of rice, one of sugar, a box of milk, a box of vegetable oil, two packs of noodles, soda pop, and candy.

All the effort she puts forth is in order to give the best she can to her kids and to offer them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa D. Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. San Juan Bautista Mz. C Lt. 18, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre D. 4 hijos, es separada. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad continua con su bodega que ahora ha crecido y esta muy surtida con la ayuda D. sus hijos la atienD. y se reparten las tareas domesticas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 paquetes D. fideos, gaseosa, golosinas. Todo el esfuerzo que hace es para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
I've now been operating a grocery store for more than 6 years. My husband and I started the business and, when I was left widowed, I took charge of it. One of my daughters and I work there now. The business needs more inventory and the store needs airconditioning because it gets hot in Nuevo Laredo this time of year. Some merchandise will rot and we'll incur a loss for the business. I'm applying for a US$800 loan to buy merchandise and aircondition the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 6 años con el negocio de ventas de abarrotes. Este negocio lo iniciamos mi marido y yo, al quedar viuda me hice cargo del negocio en el trabajamos un de mis hijas y yo. El negocio le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía y reacondicionar el local ya que en Nuevo Laredo viene la temporada de calor y la mercancía se nos descompone y es una perdida de ingresos para el negocio. Solicito un préstamo de $800.00 dlls. Para la comprar de mercancía y reacondicionar el local.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale and install airconditioning.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run S. O. sells groceries from her house, earning approximately $3.20 per day. Her husband, Mr. Eam Chhom, is a 55-year-old soldier who farms in his free time. They have a large family of eight children, all of whom are young and attend school.

They seek a loan of $600 to buy more inventory of groceries to sell. They will use the remainder of the loan to buy vegetable seeds for her husband's farming business. The loan will allow the family to expand their businesses and thereby increase their family income. With increased income, the couple will be able to improve living conditions for their children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of groceries to sell, as well as to buy vegetable seeds for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Patricia Amalia

texts.es:
Patricia has been divorced from her husband for some time. She receives a pension, but, like many mothers in this country, she wants to give a better life to her 4 small ones. She believes that, if she is a strong and hard-working woman, her children will follow her example.

She started her business 2 years ago. First she helped another woman work, but, since a year ago, she has had her own business selling clothing and novelties.

She needs a loan of $500 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a rack to hang the clothes on and in this way to display them better and sell more. In addition she will put lighting in the place in her house where she sells the clothes; different lights from the rest of the house to give it more of the aspect of a store. With your help Patty will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia se divorcio hace ya algún tiempo de sus esposo, el le pasa una pensión pero ella ha tenido como muchas madres de este país, desea darle una mejor vida a sus 4 pequeños, ella cree que si ella es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora sus hijos lo tomaran como ejemplo.

Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años, primero le ayudaba a una señora a trabajar y desde hace un año ya tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y novedades.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar unos estantes para colgar la ropa de esta forma y poder exhibirla mejor así venderá mas, además Pondrá luz en el espacio de su casa donde vende sus ropa, la iluminara de forma diferente al resto de la casa para darle mas, aspecto de tienda. Con tu ayuda Paty saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy racks and lighting to better display the clothing that she sells.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 03040010), born in 1954, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in rearing chickens and geese. Currently, she has about 200 geese and 100 chickens. She also plants fruit trees and vegetable to sell. Her children are all grown up and working, thus earning stable income. Her family's average monthly income is 4,500,000VND (about 300USD). She will use this loan to purchase more animal feeds as well as more geese and chickens to breed. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Tong Thi Van (ID Number 03040014), born in 1980, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in raising livestock.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Lan (ID Number 03040009), born in 1969, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in her pharmaceutical store.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Phuong (ID Number 03040066), born in 1981, would like to borrow 2,204,000VND to sell construction supplies.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuy Van (ID Number 03040013), born in 1972, would like to borrow 1,908,000VND to invest in raising livestock.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Doan (ID Number 03040011), born in 1980, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to sell construction supplies.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID Number 03040012), born in 1983, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in raising livestock.
  • The total amount requested is 1,350.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Nguyễn Thị Hường, sinh năm 1954 (Ms 03040010), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư trang trại nuôi gà, ngan. Hiện trang trại của gia đình cô có khoảng 200 con ngan và 100 con gà. Ngoài ra, cô còn trồng cây ăn quả và trồng rau. Các con cô đều đã trưởng thành đi làm và có thu nhập. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 4.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Lần vay vốn này gia đình cô sẽ sử dụng vào việc mua thức ăn cho ngan, gà và mua thêm con giống. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Tống Thị Vân, sinh năm 1980 (Ms 03040014), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Lan, sinh năm 1969(Ms 03040009), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hang thuốc. Nguyễn Thị Phương, sinh năm 1981(Ms 03040066), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng. Nguyễn Thị Thúy Vân, sinh năm 1972(Ms 03040013), mức vay: 1.908.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Doan, sinh năm 1980 (Ms 03040011), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng. Nguyễn Thị Thủy, sinh năm 1983 (Ms 03040012), mức vay: 1.972.000 để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Rearing chickens and retailing

loans.name: Kidawa's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Kidawa is 26 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 2 years old. She has been a fish and bites (chapati) seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Kidawa now hopes for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, clothes sales, chips and bites sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding her current stock

loans.name: Martha Salvadora

texts.es: Desde pequeña ayudaba a su mama en la elaboración de las tortillas, cuando se caso su esposo le ayudo a comenzar con este negocio comenzó haciendo 3 medios de maíz diarios,  y trabajaba solo por la mañana  hasta el medio día, cuando recibió el primer crédito con adim, cambio su horario y trabajando todo el día ahora hace 6 medio de maíz diario, de las ganancias ha mejorado su casa y el nivel de vida, puesto que sus hijos asisten a la escuela y su esposo se dedica  a labores del campo.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Martha helped her mother make tortillas. When she married her husband, he helped her started this business. She began making tortillas from an average of 3 ears of corn daily, and she worked alone from the morning to the afternoon. With she received her first loan with ADIM, she changed her schedule, and was working all day. She now makes tortillas from an average of 6 ears of corn daily. From the earnings, she has improved her home and her level in life, since her children go to school and her husband is a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu T. and Kadiatu C.. They call their group Tamaraneh III, a Temne word that means, "Let us help each other." They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and always repay them successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 500,000 each and this helped them a lot. They were able to earn more profit after the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to add to their businesses.

Isatu (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-three and a widow with two children. One of her children is in secondary and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman for the past ten years now. She sells ground-nuts.

With this loan of Le 500,000, Isatu will now be able to buy a one and half bags of ground-nuts to add to her business. Before now she could buy only baskets of ground-nuts because of low capital. She travels to Bamoi near the neighboring country of Guinea to buy the ground-nuts. The price per bag for a ground-nut is Le 300,000.

Though the ground-nut business is a lucrative one, ground-nut dealers, like Isatu, some times encounter difficulties in running their businesses. They may discover rotten ground-nuts in the sealed bags, which could lead to a loss of profit. Again, they have to travel to villages like Bamoi to buy the ground-nuts and sometimes vehicles are difficult to find to transport the goods. Terrible weather can also hinder Isatu's ability to obtain her goods. Notwithstanding the difficulties she faces as a business woman, she believes in her business as it the only means through which she can survive. Out of the profit she makes, she is able to feed herself and children, pay their school fees, and give them medical attention when any one of them is sick.

loans.use: To purchase ground-nuts for resale.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang Thi B. is 34 years old . She lives in Gia Khanh Commune, Binh Xuyen  district, Vinh Phuc Province. She has two children. She has been a member of TYM since 2003. Her family's main income is pork trading. For the next loan, she wants to borrow 14 million VND ($825 USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Ida

texts.fr: Née vers 1976  à Lokossa dans le département du mono au Sud du Bénin, Dame T. Ida est mariée  à KOUDOSSODJI noël. elle est mère de cinq enfants. appélé communement Ahonon, elle s'est spécialisée dans la distribution des produits naturels tel que la banane , les oranges et d'autres fruits. pour renforcer d'avantage son activité et faire face à la vente des fêtes, elle sollicite son quatrième crédit avec Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs Ida T. was born about 1976 at Lokossa, in the district of Mono, in the south of Benin. She is married to Noel Koudossodji and is the mother of five children. Know to her friends as Ahonon, she has specialized the is distribution of natural products such as bananas, oranges and other fruits. To strengthen her business advantage during the upcoming holidays, she is requesting her fourth loan through Kiva.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stems of bananas and 3 baskets of oranges

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van S., 46, is married and lives with her husband and two children, one of whom is a student, in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she and her spouse have operated a grocery store, earning about $7 each day. 

Van is now requesting a loan of $1000 to expand the store by purchasing more items to meet client demand.  Her husband and daughter are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 59 años D. edad, enviudo hace 7 años, es madre D. 8 hijos, que ya tienen sus familias y viven en otras ciudades, ahora se ha quedado sin compañía, por ello se dedica mucho a su trabajo D. cocinera, en un restaurante cerca a su pueblo. En vida su esposo realizaba los trabajos D. la chacra, habiendo cultivado plantas D. piña, plátanos y  café; ahora sus plantas  requieren  D. abonos y otros cuidados dedicándole la menor parte del tiempo ya que solo se dedica a ella los sábados y domingos; D. lunes a viernes ella trabaja D. cocinera en un restaurante (en la foto), D. 4 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, explotando sus habilidades culinarias, gana 350 soles gracias a su buena sazón, en épocas D. cosecha D. café,  su sueldo aumenta a 400 soles ya que existe más clientela. Ana esta contenta con su trabajo D. cocinera, y también con sus labores agrícolas, pero a veces al observar su cosecha D. café le entra la nostalgia al recordar a su numerosa familia, ella sabe que le ofreció lo mejor que pudo a sus hijos y que ahora ellos son hombres D. bien y con ese orgullo espera seguir adelante porque sabe que aún la vida le depara muchas sorpresas. Ana pese a sus labores, separa su tiempo para cumplir sus funciones D. presidenta D. su banco comunal, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y ella es muy puntual en realizar sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes y la otra parte es para mandar a machetear su chacra D. café y cosechar sin dificultades, ella quiere invertir en su chacra ya que la ha dejado D. lado y a su esposo le habría gustado, también agradece a su banco comunal porque le ha enseñado la responsabilidad en los pagos y le da la oportunidad D. seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old, has been widowed for 7 years, and has 8 children, who already have families and live in other cities. She now lives alone, and because of this, she works very hard as a cook in a restaurant near her town. While her husband was alive, he worked on a small farm, where he cultivated pineapples, bananas, and coffee. Now his plants require fertilizer and other treatments, and Ana spends a little time on the weekends tending to them. From Monday to Friday, she works as a cook in a restaurant from 4 in the morning until 9 at night, using her culinary skills. She earns 250 soles thanks to the good flavor of her food. During the coffee harvest, her salary increases to 400 soles since she has more clients. Ana is happy with her job as a cook and with her agricultural work, but sometimes, when she sees the coffee harvest she gets nostalgic upon remembering her large family. She knows that it offered the best to her children and that now they are good people. With her priD. she hopes to continue forward because she knows that life provides many surprises. Ana, in spite of her work, sets asiD. some time to work as the president of her community bank. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very punctual in making her payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and the other part will be used to order cutting her coffee farm and to grow without difficulties. She wants to invest in her farm since it has been left to her and her husband and because her husband would have liked it. She is also thankful to the community bank because she has learned the responsibilities of repayments and it has given her the opportunity to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 23-year-old man who lives in Saida, souther Lebanon. Zaher has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2001. He sells potatoes, beans, apples, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, and other type of fruits and vegetables depending on the season.

Zaher has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase purchase merchandise and buy taxi car. The taxi car is because he wants to start a new business. This is the first time that Zaher has requested a loan.

Zaher is an active man who does his best to earn enough in order to supplement his family's income. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Zaher decided on doing his business because he likes working and he likes his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and purchasing a taxi car.

loans.use: To purchase purchase merchandise and buy a taxi car

loans.name: Adishirin

texts.en:
Adishirin F. is a family man who wants to expand his business so that he can better support his family (wife and three sons) and give them a better quality of life. After finishing university, Adishirin started selling spare parts for various types of cars and repairing cars. His business has grown little by little and now offers a variety of products.

His experience and deep knowledge in cars has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers, and support his family. Adishirin has applied to borrow 1225 USD to buy new goods for his store. He wants to expand his business and increase his income to create a better life for his family.

loans.use: purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 59 year old Martha M. from Mwanza. She is married with nine children, between the ages of 24 and 30 years old. Martha has been running a pharmacy business since 2008. Martha’s business is to sell medicine to customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Martha currently earns about 300USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase medicine to sell to customers.  In the future, she plans to renovate her house. Martha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sum

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell to customers.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Teofila es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Teofila tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo. Además Teofila venD. salchipollos sus ventas lo realiza por las noches.
Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideo.
Los sueños D. Teofila son tener mas capital y mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Golondrinas (“Swallows”) Communal Bank. Teofila is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children. Teofila has a store in her home were she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meats. She tends to her store every day with help from her husband. In addition, Teofila sells salchipollos (a Peruvian chicken dish) in the evenings. Teofila needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and noodles. Teofila’s dream is to have more capital and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor I. is 36 years old. He is married and has four children. He sells medicines. He is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia has been providing high quality child care services in her Pacifica home for 12 years. She started by caring for her granddaughter, and the business grew from there.  She has a license to serve up to 14 children, and has also emerged as a leader through her involvement in the Childcare Coordinating Council and as president of the Spanish Providers Association. The children Silvia cares for, and some of their parents, call her “abuela,” Spanish for grandma, which captures the feeling of extended family that keeps families coming to her.  

With a $10,000 loan, Silvia can build an outdoor storage shed, so that she can stop paying $200 a month to rent one.  This investment will also enable Silvia to upgrade outdoor areas to provide adequate play space for children.

loans.use: Upgrade outdoor play area

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a 36 year old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married. She and her husband have five children ages: 15, 13, 8, 7 and 3. She lives in the Muhima sector of Nyarugege in Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Beatrice does business in her neighborhood where she sells charcoal. She is requesting her first loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to buy more charcoal. Beatrice started her business in 2004 and turns a monthly profit. She has two workers who help run the business. Beatrice starts her day at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m. She will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Mohammad Karym Group

texts.en:
M. Karem is the group leader of M. Karem Group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 21,000 Afghani.

Shfeqa wants to take a loan for her bakery business. She wants to buy firewood for her business. M. Karem wants to take a loan for his vegetable-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Also, M. Naem wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit selling. He wants to expand and further his business. They want to thank all leaders in the Kiva process. And thank all leaders of AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 43 years old and the motivation to remove her family from poverty is still burning within her. She is the mother of two: a boy and a girl, and is married to Ediardo who is an electrician and is 50 years old. She lives in Jala-jala, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

In 2008, with her need for rolling capital for her business selling rice, Felicidad joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She carefully invested her previous loans in the resale of rice. People come to her to buy rice every day, every hour, since it is the staple food for Filipinos. And she is happy with the profits she receives that she knows are of great help to her family.

Now Felicidad requests a loan of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business, specifically to pay for ten sacks of rice and for transportation expenses. In the future, she hopes that she can rent a space in the market for her resale business and also send her children to school until college.

loans.use: To pay for ten sacks of rice and transportation expenses

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Шодигуль Миронова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России, и конечно же помогает семье. Сама Шодигуль более 2 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Shodigul M. lives in the Rumy district. She is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works in Russia, and obviously helps the family. Shodigul has been an entrepreneur for over 2 years. She has a retail store at the central market, where she sells food products. She is requesting a loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
"Rosalina S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Rosalina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Rosalina has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Rosalina is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD. Rosalina is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Rosalina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Maguelewa

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier d’Agoè Adjougba à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un militaire et le couple a 02 enfants. Elle a appris la coiffure ; malheureusement, elle n’a pas pu trouver les moyens pour ouvrir son atelier de coiffure. C’est pour cette raison qu’en 2004, elle a pris la ferme décision de se lancer dans la vente de charbon de bois pour aider financièrement son mari. Grâce à ce choix, ils arrivent ensemble à assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Avec ce nouveau commerce, elle arrive à vendre des sacs entiers dans la semaine ; à présent elle est bien connue de beaucoup de gens. Pour renouveler  son stock en état d’épuisement, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 09 sacs de charbon de bois ; le prêt lui servira également de s’approvisionner à Atakpamé, une localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn P. was born and lived in the best territory of Pursat province, since she was young. Thoeurn P. was married years go and has blessed with two kids who are still not enrolled in school. She and her husband own a plot of land that they were inherited from their grandparents, on which they grow different kinds of vegetable to earn a living. At the same time, Thoeurn P.’s husband is also a fisherman in the village. After Thoeurn P. has ready planted her crop, she is facing a problem with lacking fertilizer for her crop. She therefore would like a loan from Kiva to be used to purchase fertilizer to sustain her crop well growth.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to sustain her crop well growth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Umulisa

texts.en:
I. Umulisa is 45 years old and is a widow with five children aged 9 through 22. Imaculee and her family live in Ngoma district in the Kibungo province of Rwanda which is a two-hour drive from Kigali. Immaculee has become an entrepreneur by necessity and so far she is succeeding.

I. has only two years of experience in her business of selling a variety of soft drinks, fruit and cakes. Her shop requires that she be at work every day from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. She employs one person (a helper) so that her business runs well and she can have a well-deserved break now and again.

I. would like to borrow from Vision Finance Company in order to improve her inventory and offer more products to her clients. Following this strategy, she believes, will allow her to earn more profit which will allow her to grow her business and begin to set aside money for herself and her family as well as pay for immediate expenses like food and schooling.

loans.use: To buy more milk, fruit and cakes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seed, groceries, for family expenses, food and schooling.

loans.name: Dora Celina De

texts.es: Dora vive junto a sus hijos esta a cargo de los gastos de la casa sus hijos están en edad de estudio por otra parte el padre no convive con la familia pero si les pasa pensiones trabaja en una flota, Dora gracias a su esfuerzo también genera ingresos como enfermera en una clínica, Dora mantiene residencia domiciliaria con casa propia. Dora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  al por menor compra por mayor  y reparte en zona a dos pagos. Por otra parte, compra productos de temporada, a la fecha esta comprando productos de navidad. La competencia es media, sin embargo por la gran experiencia adquirida ha desarrollado habilidades y destrezas en el negocio lo cual le ayuda bastante ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Con el crédito obtenido de la institución Dora está financiando capital de trabajo ya que la temporada es alta por estar cerca de fin de año. Y esta pagando un saldo de agrocapital. Su comportamiento de pagos de Dora es bueno ya que su promedio de días  mora es de cero días.  Y se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia de créditos.
texts.en:
Dora lives with her children and is in charge of the household expenses. Her children are students. Their father doesn’t live with the family but he sends money from his work on a boat. Thanks to Dora’s efforts from her work as a nurse in a clinic, she is also able to provide income. Dora lives in her own house. She sells food retail which she buys wholesale, and delivers in the area to customers who pay on credit in two payments. She also purchases seasonal products: she is currently buying Christmas items. The competition is normal, but she has acquired a lot of experience and developed her abilities and skills in the business. This has helped her a lot and now she is very popular with her customers. With the loan that she received from the institution, Dora is putting capital into the business since the season is short- being close to the end of the year. And she is paying a balance to agrocapital. Dora’s history of payments is good and her average of late days is zero. This is her fourth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La sra. Elsa tiene su tienda desde hace mucho tiempo en su casa ubicada en  zona de Pampahasi, es una tienda muy surtida y muy conocida por la zona, ella vive con sus hijos que están estudiando y con su esposo que trabaja en una entidad pública; es una cliente muy responsable, y conoce muy bien todo lo referido a su negocio, este crédito será invertido incrementando su mercaderia con la compra de bebidas para las fiestas de fin de año y comprará abarrotes para venderlos en la tienda.
texts.en:
Elsa has had her store in her house for a long time now. She is located in the Pampahasi area. It is a well-stocked and well-known store in the area. She lives with her children, who are students, and her husband, who works for a public entity. She is a very responsible client and knows her business well. This financing will be used to buy more stock items, especially beverages for the end-of-year festivities; she will also buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, madre de 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente. Evila forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Corazones”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que invirtió en diversos productos para su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita 800 soles, que será invertido en bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral, néctar, refrescos y gelatina. También posee una copiadora que le genera otro ingreso diario. La meta de Evila es tener una fuente de soda y tener su bodega bien implementada.
texts.en:
Evila is a very respectable woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children, one who is all grown up. She sells basic supplies from a small grocery store situated in her home. Her husband, who is an independent worker, helps her. For the past 8 months, Evila has been part of the communal bank “Los Corazones” (The Hearts). The first loan she received was for 500 Soles which she used to buy a variety of products for her store. She is now in need of 800 Soles to be used to buy carbonated beverages, mineral water, nectar, soft drinks and jello. She also has a photocopier that helps her generate additional daily income. Evila’s goal is to have a soda fountain and have her store well used.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages, mineral water, nectar, soft drinks and jello.

loans.name: Ruth Mary

texts.es:
La Sra. Ruth, vive en el Municipio de la Guardia Km. 9 Barrio Monte Alto, su esposo es albañil contratista, El tiene mucho trabajo y siempre se ausenta por mucho tiempo de la ciudad, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, ambos corren con los gastos del hogar y uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos profesionales y tener su casita propia.

La actividad principal de la Sra. Ruth es la venta de ropa que la reliza en distintas zonas de la ciudad, tiene mercaderia variada y ya tiene clientes que le hacen algunos pedidos.
 
El destino del crédito solicitado fue para comprar mercadería por la época de fin de año aumento de capital.

La Sra. Ruth esta agradecidacon Emprender y Kiva por la confianza depositada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs Ruth lives in the municipality of La Guardia, at km 9 in the neighborhood of Monte Alto. Her husband is a mason contractor. He has a lot of work and is often absent from the city for long periods. They have two school-age children. Both parents pay for household expenses and one of their dreams is to see their children becoming professionals and have their own small house. Mrs Ruth's main activity is the sale of clothes in several areas of the city. She has a diversified supply of clothes and has already a few customers who make some orders. The purpose of the loan was to increase her working capital and enable her to buy merchandise for the end-of-year period. Mrs Ruth thanks Emprender and Kiva for their trust in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Marisol Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Marisol Ballestero, vive en el barrio Blas de Lezo en la ciudad de Cartagena, tiene 2 hijas de 19 y 13 años que son su máxima motivación: con su amor, dedicación y  trabajo constante, ella sola  ha logrado sacarlos adelante con su negocio de confecciones; cuando inició esta actividad lo hizo como un pasatiempo, pero al separarse  de sus esposo la necesidad la obligó a fortalecerla, empezó  buscando mercado en diferentes colegios de Cartagena, su gestión y la calidad de sus productos, la llevaron a conseguir contratos con entidades educativas, vecinas y empleadas de empresas de la ciudad a quien en la actualidad vende ropa en diversas líneas, es así como le solicitan vestidos enteros, uniformes, blusas, pantalones y elegantes  diseños.  
Marisol  le da gracias a Dios por el don maravilloso que tiene para  desarrollar este oficio, su creatividad  se hace notoria en cada diseño pues le agrega mucho amor. Inició  en la confección desde el año  2.006 con esta actividad ha proporcionado la posibilidad cubrir  las necesidades de sus hijos: alimentación,  estudios, vestidos, diversión, es decir las propias de una familia y también ha podido comprar todo lo que necesita en casa para un mejor vivir;  Este es el segundo crédito que ha recibido con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior  compro materia prima y amplió su cobertura de clientes, accediendo a nuevos mercados domésticos e institucionales  con los que tiene contrato.  Definitivamente su negocio ha cambiado su vida  pues con él tiene un trabajo, una gran satisfacción personal y puede ofrecer  a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $ 2.000.000 que será invertido en la compra de materia prima  e insumos para la elaboración de uniformes de diarios y educación física de los colegios con los cuales tiene contratos y los pedidos de los diferentes clientes que ella tiene en los barrios de la ciudad
 El sueño de Marisol es ver su negocio crecer gradualmente; mas adelante comprar maquinarias industriales, tener operarias que también generen ingresos a sus familia, ofrecer sus servicios a muchas personas   que no conocen su producto y ser reconocida en la ciudad y a mas largo plazo  ampliarse a en diversas ciudades del país representando a Colombia.  Otra de sus  metas es ver a sus hijos   profesionales por que considera que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarle  y  también sueña  con tener su casa propia.  Su mayor dificultad fue enfrentar la vida sola con sus dos hijos pero da gracias a Dios pudo salir adelante, hoy se siente feliz y realizada sabiendo que les ha brindado todo lo necesario  y   enseñado que la vida no es fácil pero que con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho amor se logran todos los propósitos. 
.
texts.en:
Marisol Ballestero lives in the Blas de Lezo neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. She has two daughters, 19 and 13 years old. They are her biggest motivation. With love, dedication, and constant work she, by herself, has gotten them ahead with her seamstress business. When she started this activity she did it as a pastime. But, upon separating from her husband, necessity obligated her to make it more than a passtime. She started looking for a market in the different schools in Cartagena. Her effort and the quality of her products helped her get contracts with different educational entities, neighbors, and business employees in the city. She currently sells a diverse line of clothes to them. They ask for complete outfits, uniforms, blouses, pants, and elegant designs. Marisol thanks God for the marvelous gift that she has to do this work. Her creativity is evident in each design; she adds lots of love. She started making clothes in 2006. This work gives her the opportunity of covering her children’s necessities; food, education, clothes, and entertainment. In addition to covering the family costs, she has been able to buy everything she needs in the house for a better life. This is the second loan that she has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the previous loan she bought raw material and increased her customers. She accessed new domestic markets and institutions, and she has contracts with them. Her business has definitely changed her life. With the business she has work, great personal satisfaction, and she is able to give her children a better standard of living. She is currently applying for a loan for 2,000,000 COP. She will buy raw material and supplies to make uniforms for everyday and for physical education for the school that she has contracts with and for orders from different customers that she has in the neighborhoods in the city. Marisol’s dream is to see her business gradually grow. Later, she would buy industrial machines and have workers operate them, which would generate income for their families. She would offer her services to a lot of people who do not know her products and be recognized in the city. In the long term she would expand into different cities in the country and represent Colombia. Another one of her goals is to see her children become professionals because she considers that to be the best legacy that she can give them. She also dreams of having her own house. The biggest difficulty that she has is facing life alone with her two children. But, she thanks God that she was able to get ahead. Now she is happy and fulfilled knowing that she has given them everything they need and taught them that life is not easy. But, with effort, dedication, and much love they can achieve all of their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material and supplies to make uniforms for everyday and for physical education and for custom orders

loans.name: Mauricio Arturo

texts.es:
el sr. Mauricio Arturo E. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el Barrio La Reforma, Mauricio se dedica a la tapiceria, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, muchas personas lo prefieren ya que el es muy detallista con sus trabajos, el acabado que les deja es muy bonito, tiene mucha habilidad para trabajar la tapiceria, en estos momentos Mauricio necesita el credito para poder comprar materiales para realizar varios trabajos en muebles.
con las ganancias que tenga el podra darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y salir adelante con su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Mauricio Arturo E., 31, lives in the La Reforma neighborhood. He operates an upholstery business, work that he has been doing for several years. There's a big demand for his services because he is very meticulous and his finished work is extremely good. The skill he exhibits is evident. Mauricio needs a loan so that he can buy materials for various furniture jobs. With the earnings that he expects to receive, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and help both his business and his household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for upholstery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase kitchen hot and cold taps, sinks and toilet bowls to resell

loans.name: Ndèye Ndienda
