texts.fr: NDèye Ndienda S. est une femme de 37 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH S. depuis 7 ans et demi, elle a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son prêt lui permettra de développer et de faire la promotion de son activité en achetant un bœuf à engraisser et revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Ndienda S. is a 37-year old lady who is married and mother to six children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DANKH S. for seven and a half years, has had 15 consecutive loans and has never had any problems with the repayments. She has a beef fattening activity.Her loan will allow her to develop and promote this activity buy buying an ox to fatten up and resell. Her profits allow her to contribute financially to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying oxen to fatten up

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline Biazon's Group

texts.en:
Evangeline M B. is from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Evangeline is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Evangeline B.'s Group.

Evangeline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $115 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
45 year old Elvira D. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has a 27 year old child. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business raising laying chickens to produce and sell eggs.  Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 28 years now.

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elvira from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es:
Mirian Susana P. A. tiene 19 años de edad. Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda, en la provincia de Bolívar.

Mirian es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo

Mirian esta trabajando en la agricultura desde muy joven, en la ganadería (vacas de leche). Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar la producción de queso y así solventar la situación económica. Espera que este crédito le ayudará a cambiar su trabajo y a haber más ganancia con más créditos de la Cooperativa San José. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios con las actividades que ella realiza al mismo tiempo, y tener una casa propia para poder vivir con su familia. 

Le gusta ver la televisión y escuchar música. Las costumbres en su comunidad son los carnavales. Dice que les realizan juntamente con sus familias en la actividad social.
texts.en:
Mirian Susana P. A. is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Mirian is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Mirian has been working in agriculture from a young age, primarily raising dairy cows. She buys and sells her products at the market in Guaranda.

She is requesting a loan to improve her production of cheese and stabilize her financial situation. Mirian hopes this loan will help transform her work and would like to receive additional loans from Cooperativa San José.

Mirian dreams of finishing her studies while engaging in her other activities. She also hopes of having her own house where she can live with her family. Mirian enjoys watching television and listening to music. The traditions in her community include the Carnival festivities. She says her family members celebrate together in this social activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her cheese production

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 24 años, es un joven padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Angélica de 18 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que se dedica Héctor, es la siembra de papa y alverja, que una vez cosechados son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, cuenta con gran número de clientes, puesto que la calidad que ofrece al público es muy buena y por ello le compran al por mayor. Disfruta mucho de la siembra y procurar que sean fértiles y productivas, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus chacras de las plagas. En adelante, espera comprar o alquilar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hector, age 24, is a young, down-to-earth and hardworking father who lives in a rented house with his wife, Angelica (age 18), and his two beloved children--the reason for all his efforts. Hector cultivates peas and potatoes for a living. Once he harvests his crops, he sells them at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. He has a large number of customers because he offers the public high quality produce, which is bought wholesale. He really likes cultivating and trying to make his fields fertile and productive. He has been in agriculture for 11 years, and he thinks that the most difficult part is having to shield his crops from pests. In the future, he hopes to purchase or rent crop fields in order to expand production. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his monthly payments on time if he wishes to request another loan in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank, and he is always concerned with his group's well-being. With the 700.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will purchase more fertilizer in order to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a citizen of a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is mother of a single son whose name is Muhammad shafiq. He is involved in a shoe selling business. He got his education till 8th standard and had to start doing work to financially support the family. 
Sakina is also a very supportive and caring lady. She shares the work burden and financial stress with her husband and son by operating a domestic-sewing. Her earning from this work helps her to run the financial expenses smoothly.  
Her husband's name is A. R.. He is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes and his son helps him in selling them to different shops and factories. In this way they both manage their shoe making & selling business.  
Sakina is applying for a loan for the third time from Asasah for her family business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy the raw material such as (leather, nails and shoe polisher) for his shoe making & selling business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for shoe making & selling business.

loans.name: Moses Sankale

texts.en:
Moses Sankale O. is 29 years old and supports four people in his family.

Moses is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last three years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET microfinance.This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to plow, 10,000 KES on harrowing,15,000 KES on seeds and 10,000 KES on planting his 5 acres of wheat.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Moses' dream is do large-scale farming, attain financial independence and buy his own farm machinery. He is hardworking and determined to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To plow, harrow, and plant with seeds 5 acres of wheat

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary O. is 35 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 18 months and seven. Three of his children attend school. Zachary has a mixed farm in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for fifteen years and employs one farmhand. His main products are eggs, milk, maize, beans and tea which he sells to both the local market and Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also operates a kiosk and a motorbike business in the same area.

Zachary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will go towards the education of his children and the expansion of his business. His biggest challenges have been competition, price fluctuations which make his income unstable and pests and diseases which affect production.

Zachary plans to open a hardware store in the future. He says that ever since he became associated with Juhudi Kilimo it has helped him grow, and he really appreciates it.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: La Gata Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Gata está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Agustina Ángela Fornos O. de 36 años  quien inicio vendiendo tortillas actualmente tiene una pequeña venta donde oferta maíz, queso, huevo, chicharron, cuajadas, leche agria etc. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sandi Salomé S. Gómez de 20 años  quien tiene una pequeña tortillería y Helsel Raquel S. Alegría comercializa productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group's name is La Gata. It is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Agustina Angela Fornos O., 36 years old. She started selling tortillas and now she has a small store from where she sells corn, cheese, eggs, pork rinds, desserts etc. The other members of the group are Sandi Salome S. G., 20 years old. She has a small tortilla making business. Helsel Raquel S. A. sells Avon brand products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, dairy products, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Irene Marie

texts.en:
Irene Marie B. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Irene Marie is married. To make a living, Irene Marie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like hotcakes, banana cubes, and halo-halo,(a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits, and served cold in a tall glass or bowl)  in the local community. Irene Marie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Irene Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene Marie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Irene Marie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es: La Sra. Marisabel Vive en la localidad de el Torno del departamento de Santa Cruz,  su actividad es la venta de productos para la belleza, hace dos año que se dedica a esta actividad, es decir  desde que nació su hijo, ya que el ingreso de su esposo no le alcanza para vivir adecuadamente ya que se trabaja como chofer asalariado y tubo que buscar ella una actividad, el destino del crédito es para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor de catalogo y que se encuentran en promoción , ya que en los meses de fin de año la demanda aumenta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Marisabel lives in the town of El Torno, in the state of Santa Cruz. Her job is selling beauty products, which she has been doing for 2 years now. She started after the birth of her son, since her husband's income from his job as a chauffeur was not enough for them to live adequately. This credit will be used to purchase beauty products wholesale by catalogue and ones that they find on sale. Since the demand for these products increases in the final months of the year, she is very thankful for the support that our institution has provided her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V., 33, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its temples. V. is a construction worker, earning an income of about U.S. $6 per day. His wife is a farmer and recycler, earning an income of about U.S. $4 per day to help cover their family expenses.

Every month, V. spends approximately  U.S. $60 on food,  U.S. $15 on electricity and water supplies, and U.S. $15 on other necessary expenses.  V. is requesting a loan of U.S. $600 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Maria Erma

texts.en:
Maria Erma C. is a single woman who lives in Purok 4, Barangay Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a furniture business. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria Erma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $95, thus raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her future and her plan of buying a multicab. Maria Erma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Judelkis Marlene

texts.es:
Judelkis tiene 18 años, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en condega, sus padres le ayudan a pagar la universidad, su Mamá es Ama de casa y su Papá es conducto, decidio estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta; actualmente recibe una ayuda economica de la Universidad.

Ella realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Este credito es muy importante para el porque le ayudara a tener experiencia en su carrera. Desea terminar la carrera y comenzar a trabajar y luego crear su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Judelkis, 18, is a second year Agronomy student.  She lives in Condega.  Her parents help her pay university costs.  Her mother is a housewife and her father is a driver.  She decided on this career because she likes it.  She currently receives some economic support from the university.

She negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

This loan is very important for her because it will help her have experience in her chosen career.  She wants to finish her studies and start to work to later create a business of her own.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Growing.

loans.name: Maira

texts.es:
Maira, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a la venta en un chalet donde ofrece lo necesario para el hogar, vive con sus hijos. Tiene como 8 años de dedicarse al negocio con el chalet.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el chalet ya que su demanda aumenta y quiere contar con un buen inventario de mercadería para ofrecer  a los clientes.
Con esta inversión ella espera fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio y atención a los clientes, con la oportunidad de mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Sueña con tener un chalet muy estable y mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos para que estos puedan estudiar y mejorar sus conocimientos.
texts.en: Maira lives in Jiquilisco in the Usulután department. She is 32 year sold and has a sales business in a chalet that offers all necessary items for the home. She lives with her children and has been working at this business with the chalet for 8 years. Maira is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise for the chalet as demand has increased and she wants to have good levels of inventory to offers her customers. With this investment Maira hopes to reinforce the business and offer a better service and attention to customers, with the opportunity of improving the earnings for her family. She dreams of having a stable chalet and improving the living conditions of her children so that they can study and improve their knowledge.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy K. is from the village of Galas. She is 42 years old and widowed, with 2 school-age children. Juvy operates a family member's sari-sari (general) store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

Juvy joined PMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. Over the years, he has gained good experience working as a home painter. He has been in this line of work for 22 years. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. He also works as a driver in a local hospital.

 In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today, the borrower is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase paint for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy his clients and build up a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase paint for a new project

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her younger two sons are attending a local school. Her husband works for the thermal power station during the winter months and operates a construction business during the summer months to supplement his family income. 

Myagmarsuren operates a meat trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006 and has become very experienced in her trade.  Her working capital has decreased due to the rise in the price of meat. Therefore, she plans to use this loan to purchase a large amount of meat at cheap prices and resell them during the spring months when prices for such products are higher. 

Myagmarsuren is a hardworking and modest person and says, "I plan to build my own house for my family in my fence by next year". She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase three cows at a cheap price for her meat trading business.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
Aristides se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, él elabora moldes de todo tipo para hacer sus cerámicas entres las cosas que más realiza son moldes de animales, plantas y todo lo que la imaginación le permita. 
Aristides nos cuenta con mucha pena que no tiene un lugar donde elaborar sus artesanías pero su hermana muy amablemente le cedió una parte de su taller. 

El socio Aristides es hombre muy inteligente pues actualmente está exportando sus productos a los Estados Unidos donde se encuentra su hermana Luisa, él requiere el préstamo para seguir con el negocio y desea invertir el dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo arcilla, esmaltes, pintura, moldes y otras cosas más. 
          
Aristides pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Aristides lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, department of Cusco. He makes artisan crafts, elaborating molds of all types to produce ceramics. Among the things  most often produced are molds of animals, plants, and all that the imagination permits.

Aristides tells us with much dismay that he lacks a place to elaborate his artisan crafts, but his sister very kindly lets him use a part of her workshop.

Our member Aristides is a very intelligent man, since he is presently exporting his products to the U.S., where his sister Luisa is located. He needs this loan to continue with his business and wishes to invest the money in buying materials such as, for example, clay, enamel, paint, molds, and other things.

Aristides belongs to the “Hijas de Maria” (Daughters of Mary) Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association of Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is in its 3rd year and things are going well for all the members.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS SUCH AS CLAY, ENAMEL, PAINT, MOLDS, AND OTHER THINGS FOR HIS ARTISAN CERAMICS BUSINESS

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en:
Anna Mary M. lives in the Kyebanda Central neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  six children. She also takes care of her grandchildren. 

Anna Mary has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Anna Mary sells her product door-to-door, wholesale. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She also generates additional income through renting out houses. 

The main business challenges for Anna Mary include seasonality, thieves, and transportation.  Anna Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: more charcoal

loans.name: María Dalila

texts.es: María Dalila R. D. A. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. sola en el municipio D. San Martín, en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual es D. mucha ayuda para su propio sostenimiento, debido a que es la única fuente D. ingresos fijos que posee. En su lugar D. residencia es muy conocida ya que desD. hace 15 años que posee esta tienda, misma razón por la que cuenta con una cantidad bastante amplia D. clientes. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad D. poder comprar granos básicos, verduras, pan. Golosinas y otros productos más los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza D. que este sea un año diferente en el cual pueda mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera  poder contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna y estable.
texts.en: María Dalila R. D. A. is 53-years-old. She lives in the municipality of San Martín in the department of San Salvador. She owns a food store which helps her support herself because it's the only source of income she has. She's well-known in her place of residence because she's had this store for 15 years, which is also why she has a large number of customers. María is requesting this loan for the means by which to be able to buy basic grains, vegetables, bread, candy, and other high-demand products. She cherishes the hope that this will be the year in which she's able to increase her income and have everything necessary to live a dignified and stable life.

loans.use: Purchase of essential items

loans.name: Firdos Wilayat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Firdos W. A. is 44 years old, married and has a son and three daughters, all of whom are getting their education in a nearby school. Firdos is a housewife who stays at home and performs household chores. She is a very caring mother and is bringing up her children well.

Firdos’ husband, W. A., is a retired air force employee. He now works in the fields growing different seasonal crops and earning income for the family. He also receives a pension every month. The family has lived in a three-room brick house for the past 22 years in Jaranwala, a small city located in Pakistan’s Punjab province and known for its agriculture.

Firdos has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business, and this is her first loan application with them. With the loan, Firdos’ husband will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides that will enable him to raise better crops. He has been farming for the past ten years, and Firdos is confident that an investment will bring more profit to her family and improve her family’s lifestyle.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) is Firdos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a married woman with two children aged 19 and 26. Rosemarie is engaged in farming. She grows rice to sell to the community. She also raises goats and sells them as well. Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She will use this loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Helga

texts.es:
La señora Helga y su esposo el señor Emigdio tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, pero tiene un problema en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar la colegiatura y comprar los libros que le están solicitando en la escuela. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de limpieza de una casa particular, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos de la casa con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una  fabrico en el aria de producción. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y los estudios necesario para su futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Helga and her husband, Emigdio, have two school-aged children, but they currently do not have the necessary funds to pay for their education and buy the books they require.

She is planning to pay back the loan from the income she receives for her work as a cleaning lady, since her husband pays for the household expenses out of the salary he earns from his job working in the production area of a factory.

They want their children to get an education so they will have a better future.

loans.use: To pay for school registration and supplies

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven emprendedora  de 21 años de edad, que tiene el negocio de vender gafas, relojes y accesorios, entre otras mercancías, desde hace 5 años;  su negocio nació de la necesidad de obtener ingresos para autosotenerse  y descargar  de los gastos personales  a su madre,  pues desde que su padre falleció   correa con todos los gastos de la familia.
 Claudia como  estudiante de diseño de modas sueña con tener una marca propia y bien posicionada y confía en que esta experiencia emprendedora de vender mercancías, la lleve a terminar sus estudios  para lanzarse al mercado con una gran empresa, por eso se prepara comercialmente y aplica  su vocación de servicio, con la cual  muy seguramente   lograra su gran desafío. Mientras esto ocurre ella quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, para generar mayores ingresos y mayores oportunidades de negocio, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para aplicar a su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará  ropa accesorios, calzado pues se acerca el día de las madres y ella debe estar provisionada de toda esta mercancía para atraer a la clientela , muchas de las cuales ya han hecho sus pedidos y Claudia debe responder  para seguir fidelizándolas y despertando su atención interés y decisión de comprarle por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Claudia is an enterprising young woman of 21.  She has owned a business selling sunglasses, watches, accessories and other merchandise for five years.  She started her business because she needed to make income to support herself and unburden her expenses from her mother.  Since her father died her mother had been covering all of their family expenses.

As a fashion design student, Claudia dreams of owning her own brand that is well positioned in the market and she is confident that this entrepreneurial experience selling merchandise will help her to finish her studies and launch herself on the market with a large company.  For this reason, she is preparing herself commercially and applying her dedication to service through which she will certainly meet her great challenge.  Meanwhile, she would like to increase her working capital so that she can make more income and create more business opportunities.  For this reason, she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first loan which she will use to buy clothes, accessories and footwear as Mother's Day is approaching and she would like her business to be well stocked with merchandise in order to attract customers, many of whom have already placed orders with her.  Claudia must fill these orders so that she can continue to gain customer loyalty and continue to awaken her customers' attention, interest and decision to buy from her for a long time to come.

loans.use: to buy clothes, accessories and footwear as Mother's Day is approaching

loans.name: Jandan

texts.en:
Jandan, 29, is married and lives with her husband and only son in a house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a public organization. Her son hasn't reached school age, so he stays home. 

Jandan manages a clothing and hat business in her town. She started her business in 2000. Since then she has managed to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. Now she sells all kinds of women's and men's wear for all ages. She plans to continue her business in the future. 

Jandan is a hardworking and open-minded lady who says, "I want to have my own apartment in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hats and clothing for her business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is 40 years old.  She resides in Prey Veng province, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Yem is a housewife.  Her husband makes wooden furniture to sell, earning an income of USD 2.5 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

Yem is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase wood to improve her husband’s business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es: Eddy Antonio es tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de granos básicos. El  es una persona muy conocida en su barrio por ser una persona alegre, honrada y muy trabajadora. Además el se dedica a brindar el servicio de guarda de seguridad, son los fines de semana que se encarga de visitar a sus clientes para enviarles los pedidos que le realizan. Siempre piensa en ampliar cada día más su negocio y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, concentrado y azúcar.
texts.en: Eddy Antonio is 36 years old.  His business is selling basic grains.  He is a very well-known person in his neighborhood as he is a cheerful, honest and very hard-working person.  He also works as a security guard.  On weekends he visits his customers to deliver the orders that they have made with him.  Eddy Antonio is always thinking of expanding his business every day and, at the same time, increasing his inventory.  He will use this loan to buy corn, beans, rice, oil, concentrate and sugar.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, oil, concentrate and sugar

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41-year-old, married man and father of 2 children. He has been working in transportation since 2008. He is working hard to generate money to cover all the family and life costs. His customers are all community members.

Ahmad  is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to do necessary maintenance to his car and to buy a bedroom for his home.

Ahmad is a man with a good reputation. He enjoys his work, since he likes communicating with others. He gets introduced to different cultures through his business, which is joyful to him. Ahmad hopes to open a transportation company that prepares tourist visits all over Lebanon.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en:
Juvelin is 30 years old and married. She has 2 young children, aged 8 and 7.  Her husband works as a farmer and palm oil harvester.

Juvelin is also a farmer. She has been growing rice with her husband for 8 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.  Juvelin hopes to save for her children's education. She also hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesus

texts.es: Nicolás De Jesús tiene 42 años, el negocio lo inicio por sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar por cuenta propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, a diario vende cierta cantidad de productos, porque la mayoría de sus clientes ya conocen la buena calidad de ropa que ofrece, también la manera acogedora de atender al público. Por eso, quiere incrementar más su negocio, con productos mejor calidad es por eso que recurre a este crédito con el que comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y otras cosas. Además le agrada esta actividad que tiene pues es por medio de su negocio que ha sacado adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolás De Jesús is 42 years old.   He started the business thanks to his parents who taught him how to work on his own.  His activity is the sale of clothes and cosmetics.  He sells certain amounts of products every day because most of his customers already know the good quality of clothes he offers as well as the welcoming way he tends to the public.  

Because of this he’d like to increase business with better quality products so he is resorting to this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses and others.  Besides, he enjoys the work he does because through the business he’s been able to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jenny Ruth

texts.en:
Jenny Ruth is 43 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with 2 children. She has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her store. Jenny Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia se dedica a la venta de chompas y trabaja en una empresa de seguros; su esposo se encuentra trabajando fuera del país. El crédito lo requiere para pagar un curso especial para vender seguros. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pura Pura en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un  hijo. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la primera que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: María Eugenia sells sweaters and also works at an insurance company.  Her husband is working abroad.  She needs the loan to pay for a special course in insurance sales.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Pura Pura zone.  She’s married and has a son.  This is the third loan request to IMPRO and the first time it’s channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an insurance sales course.

loans.name: Paula Eleodora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula. Tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solo uno de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadas, hornado (plato típico), corviches, jugos de frutas, sodas entre otras cosas. Además a veces también prepara almuerzos y meriendas pero solo para entregar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00. Nos cuenta que los días que más vende son los sábados y domingos. Lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Primero de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.

Paula lives here. She is 62 years old, and she and her husband have three adult children. Only one of the children still lives with them. Her husband works for the town government of Montecristi.

She is a very good housewife who also prepares and sells sandwiches and fast food, including empanadas, hornado (a regional roasted pork dish), corviche (whitefish wrapped in dough and fried), fruit juices, sodas, and so on. She also prepares lunches and snacks and delivers them to customers. She works every day from 8 a.m. till 3 p.m. She tells us she sells the most on Saturdays and Sundays. She's been selling food for more than 7 years and it's going well.

She will use this loan to purchase oil, bananas, peanuts, and other ingredients for her meals. She's been a member of the village bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans have given her.

Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oil, peanuts, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Vilma Melida

texts.es: Vilma Melida D. 49 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 16 y 8 años los cuales gracias al trabajo D. Vilma junto con su esposo se encuentran estudiando. Vilma es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Para Vilma no hay obstáculo que le impida realizar sus tareas diarias. Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y D. D. mas prendas atractivas para los clientes.  Esta actividad la realiza D. manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas del lugar donD. ella habita. Además ha adecuado su casa para realizar las ventas D. sus artículos cuando ella se encuentra en casa. Vilma es una mujer ejemplar que con su arduo trabajo y dedicación se ha ganado la confianza D. todos  clientes los cuales cada día la prefieren más. Vilma ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. diferentes prendas D. vestir como: pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas, vestidos y D. mas prendas al por mayor que permitan a traer a mas clientes y que genere mayores ganancias. Todo esto con el objetivo D. mejorar sus niveles D. venta y D. ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
49-year-old Vilma Melida lives in her own home together with her family group which consists of her husband and her two children aged 16 and 8.  Thanks to the work of Vilma and her husband, the chiildren are in school.

Vilma is a tenacious, hard-working and, above all, entrepreneurial woman.  There is no obstacle that will stop Vilma carrying out her daily tasks.  Her business is selling clothes such as skirts, pants, blouses, dresses and other garments that appeal to her customers.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in the different areas around her home.  She has also set up her house so that she can sell her goods while she is at home.  Vilma is an exemplary woman who, through her hard work and commitment, has gained the trust of all her customers who are increasingly loyal to her business.

Vilma has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, buying different clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, dresses and other items wholesale.  This will allow her to attract more customers and make more profits.  She does all this with the aim of improving her sales levels and her income.  This will enable her to aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Abdel Rida

texts.en:
This borrower is Abdel Rida. He is from Iraq. Abdel Rida is 57 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children, both of whom work. Since 2005, Abdel Rida has owned a workshop where he repairs and paints autos and also works as a blacksmith. He repairs and fixes all types of cars. Abdel Rida has a great deal of experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well-known in his surroundings.

Abdel Rida  is requesting a 3,000 USD loan purchase automobile equipment and tools for his workshop. His aim is to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase automobile equipment and tools

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés posee su propio negocio de pulpería ubicado en la bella ciudad de Masaya. Con ayuda de su familia ha salido adelante y  actualmente está necesitando un nuevo financiamiento por lo que se acerca a Ceprodel para poder introducir más productos a su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Entre los productos que comprará se encuentran azúcar, arroz, frijoles entre otros. Considera que esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar ingresos, y darle mayor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en: Inés owns her own small grocery store located in the beautiful city of Masaya.  With the help of her family she has gotten ahead. She is coming to Ceprodel because she needs a new loan in order to be able to bring more products into her business and satisfy her customers.  Among the products she will buy are sugar, rice, and beans among others.  She believes that this will help her to increase sales and improve earnings, and provide more stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods such as sugar, rice, and beans among other products.

loans.name: Hosana Group

texts.en:
Loice is a  37 year old married mother of three . Her children are aged 15,13 and 10. They live in Gweru. Loice sells clothes at a Flea market in Gweru and she has been doing this business for one year.

She is facing some capital challenges at the moment even though she get a bit of help from her husband's salary. Loice is therefore applying a loan of $400.00 to fund some orders she has to supply. With additional income she gets, Loice will be in a position to develop her residential stand in Gweru.

In the future, she would like to  have a shopping Mall in her neighborhood in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Don Orlando tiene 50 años y vive en San Juan Bosco, una aldea de Cofradía. Orlando tiene 23 años de casado con su esposa Gloria. Él tiene dos pulperías en la zona y Gloria le ayuda atender a la clientela en los locales. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. 

Orlando ha dedicado los últimos 16 años a las pulperías. Los puso con el motivo de tener un trabajo propio y de mejorar su nivel de vida. Sus pulperías venden productos básicos como golosinas, lácteos, verduras y otros productos alimenticios.  Además de eso, venden bolígrafos, cuadernos, linternas, jabón y cuerda, entre otros productos.

Las pulperías están ubicadas en un lugar central con buen movimiento, lo cual ha aumentado el rendimiento. Orlando extiende lineas de crédito a su clientela con la anticipación que ellos le van pagando poco a poco. Él nota que a veces, el cobro es un aspecto difícil de su trabajo. 

El señor Orlando ha sacado 12 prestamos anteriores con ODEF. Con este préstamo actual de L20,000, Don Orlando va a aumentar su inventario con la compra de productos de comida y otros artículos. Espera surtir más a las pulperías para poder educar bien a sus hijos. Espera que ellos se gradúen y un día, aprendan a manejar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Orlando, age 50, lives in San Juan Bosco, a village in Cofradía.  Orlando has been married to his wife, Gloria, for 23 years.  He has two grocery stores in the area, and Gloria helps him tend to the customers at those sites.  The pair has two children, ages 18 and 16.  The children attend school.

Orlando has devoted the past 16 years to the grocery stores.  He established them in order to have his own work and to improve their standard of living.  His grocery stores sell basic products like sweets, dairy products, vegetables, and other food products.  In addition to this, they sell pens, notebooks, flashlights, soap, and string, among other products.

The grocery stores are in a central place with good movement.  This has increased their performance.  Orlando extends lines of credit to his customers with the expectation that they will be paying him little by little.  He notes that sometimes collecting is a difficult aspect of his work.

Orlando has had 12 previous loans with ODEF.  With this current loan for 20,000 lempiras Orlando will increase his inventory with the purchase of food products and other items.  He hopes to stock the grocery stores more in order to be able to educate his children well.  He hopes that they will graduate and one day learn to manage their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food products and other items.

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Meet 55-years-old Posseh from Grassfield, in the eastern part of Freetown. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 21 and 35. In 2001, Posseh established her building materials store. She began her business because she needed a permanent source of income. She also earns income renting out a house and receives income from her children who work in different organizations. She says that the main challenge to her business is that some customers do not pay her the full amount for their purchases.

Posseh requires a loan in order to buy more building materials such as paint, pipes, plumbing tools and paintbrushes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to extend her business to some family members and help improve her family's welfare. In the future, Posseh plans to extend her business to the provinces. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paints, pipes, plumbing tools and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Jorge  Rudi

texts.es: El  señor  Jorge  se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, nacido en la localidad de el Torno, hace 18 años  que vive en la zona  de  Santa  Rita, es casado con la señora Petrona  tienen tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  el trabaja con su vagoneta entre semana entre alimentar a los cerdos  y los fines de semana vende los cerdos que el cría  en la feria de El Torno, el Señor Jorge es cliente antiguo  que ya se encuentran pasando la tercera secuencia,  el crédito lo utilizara  para poder comprar alimento balanceado para la alimentación y engorde de cerdos y vender en estas fiesta de fin de año, su esposa trabaja como encargada de ama de llaves y haciendo limpieza recibiendo un sueldo, el se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Jorge's business is raising and selling pigs.  He was born in the town of El Torno and has lived in Santa Rita for 18 years.  He is married to Petrona and they have three school-age children.  Jorge works with his truck during the week and also feeds his pigs.  On the weekends, he sells the pigs that he raises in the market in El Torno.

Jorge is a long-standing client who is on his third loan cycle.  He will use his loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for feeding and fattening his pigs which he will sell during the end-of-year holiday season.  Jorge's wife works as a housekeeping manager and doing cleaning work, for which she receives a salary.  Jorge is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for raising pigs

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y vive en la comunidad de Pachar , él tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero aun no tiene hijos.

Ernesto desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, él se dedica a la construcción de obras y casas, él también se dedica a la venta animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Ernesto requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes. 

Ernesto se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Ernesto pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Ernesto was born in the city of Urubamba and lives in the community of Pachar, he is 23 years old, single and has no children.

Ernesto perform his daily and economic activities in the city of Ollantaytambo, he works in the construction of houses and other projects, he also sells small animals like cuyes and chickens.  It's been a few years since he started this business and he does well thanks to the effort he puts in his work.

Ernesto needs the loan to buy more small animals like cuyes.

Ernesto is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and commits to make the repayments according to schedule.  Ernesto belongs to the community bank "Immaculate Conception of Pachar" from the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy small animals like cuyes.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Flordeliza has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 24, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..).

Sokhom is a fish vendor. Her husband is a fisherman and a rice farmer. Sokhom is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish which her husband catches so she may sell them. In the future, she would like to purchase a new engine boat for her husband to go fishing and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe de 49 años convive con Aurora de 40 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa a base de mateerial rustico, ubicado en la comunidad de Sivia. Felipe es un agricultor de buena trayectoria, él cultiva productos como el cacao, café en su propia parcela agrícola. Al inicio todo fue muy difícil hasta el día en que empezó a cosechar, pues los productos que obtenian eran bueno, con ello logró mantenerse en el mercado. Por tanto continuo invirtiendo el poco capital que tenía para ampliar la siembra de en otras parcelas. Felipe está orgulloso con sus productos que cultiva, porque en la actualidad están teniendo mayor acogida por los comercializadores y por ende mejores precios para los productos de los agricultores. En un futuro desea abrir un negocio en la venta de productos de primera necesidad para lo cual necesita un establecimiento adecuado y seguro. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que Felipe se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles comprará calaminas para techar su nueva vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipe who is 49 years old lives with Aurora who is 40 years old and from this relationship they have 3 children, who live in their cottage located in the community of Sivia.

Felipe is a farmer with a good record cultivating products such as cocoa and coffee on his own farming land. Everything was difficult in the beginning until the day he began to harvest; well, the crops that he grew were good, and with them he was successful at the market.

So he continued investing the little money that he had to expand the planting of other fields. Felipe is proud of what he grows, because currently he is having a better reception from the traders and hence better prices for his agricultural crops.

In the future he wants to open a business selling staple products for which he needs a suitable and safe facility. 

This will be his first loan with MFP, and Felipe promises to make his payments on time in accordance with the schedule. With the 3000 soles he will buy corrugated iron to put a roof on his new home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron to put a roof on his home

loans.name: Madre De Familia 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Berthe is a Haitian citizen. She is one of the members of the Group Madre de Familia (Mother of a Family), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. They live in one of the rural areas called "batey", populated by Haitian immigrants who came to the country to work in the sugar field plantations. Most of the members in this group are Haitian citizens.

Berthe is running a fried food stall in front of her house, where she sells fried chicken, plantains, empanadas and other popular Dominican fried food, specially for dinner. This loan will be invested to purchase goods to prepare the food to sell. This is Berthe's first loan with Esperanza, and she is excited to invest all the money in her business, which she started two years ago with some savings after she became a single mother of three.

She joined the group because she was needing capital to invest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantains, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en: Ayesh is a 30-year-old married woman who supports 1 family member. She is from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for household products to sell. In the future, she would like to open a shop to sell her products in general.

loans.use: to pay for household products to sell.

loans.name: Kalondu

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Kalondu. She is forty three years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 
She is a maize and beans farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She hopes this will enable her boost her proceeds hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to provide better health care and food for her family.
She is grateful to kiva and their lenders for the financial help and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds hence increased income to provide better healthcare and food for her family.

loans.name: Nshingia

texts.en: Nshingia is 40 years old,married with three children.Two are in primary school ,one in secondary school. She has only primary education because her parents could not meet her education costs.Nshingia is an achievement oriented kind of person.After being married,she could not stand being a mere housewife.She joined some credit associations and with the help of her husband she managed to open a shop.The shop sells different consumable items,especially cold drinks.Cold drinks in her shop has higher turnover,the shop is located near a recreation center.Her shop location provides her with high demand,especially during working hours.She is in a plan to increase the size of stock of cold drinks so as to prevent against stockouts.Stockouts are not desirable in business.She also want to add another fridge to keep these drinks cold.The expansion strategy requires addition funding of USD 750.

loans.use: buying a fridge,add stock of cold drinks,

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.en:
Rosa Margarita is originally from Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, and has a little boy. Recently, she and her family moved to the city looking for better opportunities, and found a land in Juarez, where they currently live. Her husband is a self-employed construction worker, so he does not have a steady income. Since they are paying off their home, sometimes his income is not enough to cover the family’s expenses. For this reason, Rosa decided to open her business of selling snacks, with which she can help to cover household’s expenses.

Rosa needs a loan in the amount of US$200, which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to grow her business, and improve the way her store looks. Rosa needs your help. She is willing to work hard, and commits to paying back the loan in a 3 to 6 months term. You can help Rosa, don’t hesitate. She and her family sincerely thank you for any support you can offer.

La señora Rosa Margarita es originaria de Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, y tiene un pequeño hijo. Recientemente ella y su familia, en busca de mejores oportunidades, llegaron a vivir a la zona metropolitana y consiguieron un terreno en Juárez, donde es su actual domicilio. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja por su cuenta, esto le impide tener un ingreso fijo y como están pagando su terreno, en ocasiones no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. Ante esta situación, Rosa se decidió por abrir su negocio de venta de snack, con lo que puede contribuir a los gastos del hogar.

En estos momentos, Rosa necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara en la compra de mercancía para hace creer su negocio y darle una mejor imagen a su establecimiento. Ella necesita de tu colaboración, esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho y se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Rosa, no lo dudes, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Mr. Samuel I. hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria. He specializes in making shoes for the public. He is 25 years old, married with two (2) children. He is requesting the above amount for business expansion

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda R. R., 45, is a mother of 5 children. One of her children is married and the other four still live with her and are also working. She started her store four years ago selling a variety of merchandise at her store that includes edible items, drinks, and household items. She also owns farm animals, in particular has five pigs and one cow. Currently she is not selling any of the milk from her cow, but plans to sell the milk in the future.

Before she started her store four years ago at her house, she used to sell products such as herbs in the streets. Now, when her children are not helping her at her store, they go out around the city selling herbs in the streets. With the loan that she receives from Fundacion Paraguaya, Hermelinda gives part of it to her children to invest in their own business. They use it as capital to purchase merchandise to sell on the streets.

Hermelinda uses the loan to purchase her merchandise from the markets in San Lorenzo, Itagúa, and Itá (different cities of Paraguay). She is in need of a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as beer and snacks, for her store and also to take care of her farm animals that she recently bought.

loans.use: Purchase beer, snacks, and to invest in her farm animals.

loans.name: Umi Farida

texts.id:
Umi Farida is an exceptional mother; she operates a motorcycle repair shop assisted by her husband, a member of the professional motorcycle mechanic. Her diligent efforts enable her family to live together including educating her 2 daughters. However her efforts frequently encounter funding problems as the cost of stocking spare parts are not inexpensive. Her family’s daily expenses are Rp 25.000 (USD3), monthly Rp 750.000, before the cost of education and house lease. Umi and her husband did not lose hope and continue to work hard with the funding provided by DINARI.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Umi Farida adalah seorang ibu yang sangat luar biasa, dia membuka usaha bengkel sepeda motor yang dibantu oleh suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai ahli mekanik sepeda motor. Usaha yang ditekuninya ini mampu menghidupi kehidupan mereka sebagai satu keluarga termasuk menyekolahkan kedua putrinya. Namun usaha Umi Farida sering berbenturan dengan masalah permodalan yang membutuhkan biaya yang bukan sedikit, karena Umi harus menyiapkan sparepart motor dibengkelnya. Biaya hidup keluarga adalah 25.000 rupiah/hari yang kalau di total adalah 750.000 rupiah/bulan belum termasuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya dan kontrak rumah, namun Umi bersama suaminya tidak pernah putus asa mereka terus bekerja dengan tekun, apalagi mereka merasa terbantu dengan pinjaman dana yang diberikan oleh DINARI.

loans.use: Purchase Spare Parts (mebeli Sparepart Sepeda Motor)

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Navy was married in 1988 and has four children, one son and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor after she got married in 1980. She started her silk production in the same year. She has trained her eldest daughter to weave silk and embroider as well. Her daughter is currently assisting her to embroider silk products at home. Her husband is a farmer and a wood construction worker, which he learned from his father in 1990. His oldest son helps him in farming and the construction business. Their other two daughters are still studying at the primary school in the village. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Uesa

texts.en: Uesa is on her second loan cycle. She grows taro, taamu and bananas on her plantation. Her husband is the one who really helps her with the work. She and her husband work on the plantation six days of the week, and on Fridays and Saturdays she has to go to the market to sell her stuff. She sells about twenty five taro for $20 WST ($8 USD), and she can manage to bring about $150-$200 WST ($60-80 USD) a day. Her gross sale for the week is $400-$500 WST ($160-200 USD) a week. She wants to continue in the future and she is aiming to extend her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Filena

texts.es:
Mrs. Filena G. is a 51-year-old married mother of 4 grown-up children who no longer live with her. She lives with her husband in the 14 de Febrero neighborhood of Managua. Mrs. G. sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics both as a street vendor and from her own home. She started this business years ago because she needed the money in order to provide an education for her four children, since her husband did not generate enough income to cover the household expenses. She would like to invest in her business by building a protective wall in front of her house because the wall is not yet complete. Mrs. G. would like to feel safe in her home and ensure the security of the merchandise she keeps there.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Filena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, con 4 hijos mayores de edad, que ya no viven con ella. Vive con su esposo en el barrio 14 de Febrero de Managua. Doña Filena es vendedora de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, en su casa de habitación y también ambulante. Empezó en este negocio hace mucho tiempo porque necesitaba el dinero para poder darles eduación a sus cuatro hijos, ya que lo que ganaba su esposo era muy poco para toda la familia. Quiere invertir en su negocio para poder construir el muro de su vivenda, ya que este no se encuentra terminado completamente. Doña Filena quiere sentirse segura en su casa y asegurar también la amercadería que ahí tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of cinder blocks, cement, and iron for construction of protective wall in front of her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand and boost poultry business

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
C. Angeline, who married, with one child, is a retailer who sells clothing materials and slippers. Her business is doing very well and she hopes to expand her business, but lacks sufficient funds to meet her target.

She is asking for $525 to buy more clothing materials in order to increase her sales. She plans to expand her consumer base to both dressmakers and other individuals who use it for a variety of purposes.

loans.use: To buy clothing material

loans.name: Las Peritas Group

texts.es:
The association known as “Las Peritas” has been a part of the Pro-Mujer family for a year and is a group consisting of 17 members who work very responsibly. The majority of the group works selling used clothing, something that is not very lucrative, which is what led them to look for other types of activities. Now they plan to work making different items like school uniforms, backpacks, shoes and baby clothes to be sold in different markets around the city. Those sales will be made with the help of their children who will work the stands selling until late at night.

They affirm that they need the capital to be able to buy raw materials and special machinery to make their products and thereby achieve a better quality. That way their businesses will be prosperous for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación “Las Peritas" pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace 1 año, grupo formado por 17 miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. El grupo en gran parte se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que actualmente ya no es muy rentable lo que les llevo a buscar otro tipo de actividad. Ahora intentan dedicarse a la confección de distintos productos, como ser la confección en uniformes de escuela, mochilas, zapatos, y ropa de bebes, todos estos productos comercializados en las distintas feria de la ciudad, dichas ventas las realizan con la ayuda de sus hijos que deben quedarse en los puestos de venta hasta muy noche. Afirman que necesitan capital para poder comprar materia prima y maquinaria especial para la fabricación de sus productos de esta manera lograr una mejor calidad de estos y así sus negocios prosperen para el bien de ellos y sus familias..

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (fabric, leather, thread, etc.) and special machinery

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María is married. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they have three children: 25 year old José Luis, a university student; 21 year old Nancy Beatriz, an employee; and 14 year old David Alejandro, a secondary school student. All the children live with their parents. María began her business and has always been dedicated to business because she likes to make sales, and she sells very diverse products. Also this is a way for her to be occupied and active, and also permits her to meet people and establish friendships. She began in the world of sales approximately 22 years ago, selling furniture and later cosmetics by catalog. For the past 6 years she has sold natural products, and thanks to loans from Admic she has increased her sales and clients.

Now she needs a loan of $950 that she will repay in 6 months in order to purchase more natural products that will permit her to meet the needs of her current clients, and also in order to gain new customers. With your help, María will continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada su esposo es taxista y tienen 3 hijos José Luis D. 25 años, estudiante universitario, Nancy Beatriz D. 21 años, empleada, David Alejandro D. 14 años, estudiante D. secundaria, todos viven en casa. Inició el negocio ya que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio porqué le gustan mucho las ventas y ha vendido muy diversos productos, además D. que es una manera D. estar ocupada y activa, también le permite conocer gente y entablar amistades. Comenzó en el mundo D. las ventas aproximadamente hace como 22 años, inicio vendiendo muebles, después productos cosméticos por catalogo y hace como 6 años vendo productos naturistas, y gracias a los créditos D. Admic ha podido acrecentar sus ventas y sus clientes.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mas productos naturistas que le permitan cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes actuales y también para poder captar clientes nuevos. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat A. is a client who finished paying of her first loan without any problems. After this her inventory of thermoses increased noticeably. She will use her next loan to purchase clay dishes and china. She is grateful to KIVA for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абидова Мухаббат ,это клиентка которая без проблем закончила свой первый займ.После которого у нее заметно увеличился товарооборот, ассортимент термосов.Следующий займ она хочет получить для приобретения глиняной и фарфоровой посуды.Она благодарна KIVA за оказанную финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: Purchase dishes for sale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi N., 47 years old, has joined TYM for 9 years now. Most of her previous loans had been invested in breeding cattle but the profit was not as high as she expected. Therefore, recently she has borrowed more money to open a small store selling salt. Every morning, her husband would purchase salt from the seaside and she would resell it to other stores and customers in the area, earning roughly 3 million VND monthly. Apart from this business, her family is still raising cattle and work on the field (but less than before). Due to a stable source of income, she has been able to repay all the loans on time and still able to pay for her children education and living expenses. Currently, the price of salt is low so she would like to borrow money to buy more and put in reserve to sell later. This cycle she would like to borrow 6 million VND. Her family income monthly is about 3.5 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị N. năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia . Chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 9 năm. Trước đây gia đình chị vay ốn đầu tư chủ yếu vào dự án chăn nuôi song nhân thấy hiệu quả của dự án chăn nuôi không cao vì vậy những vòng vốn gần đây gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy muối từ vùng biển về cho chị bán buôn và bán lê tại địa phương, công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển rất thuận lợi cho thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ công việc kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Nhờ có thu nhập ổn định kinh tế gia đình chị N. đã phát triển hơn các con của chị đều được ăn học đầy đủ. Hiện nay muối đang vào vụ nên giá thành rẻ hơn nên anh chị mong muốn được vay vốn để đầu tư mua muối trong vụ mùa về dự trữ để bán dần. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000 đ, thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Klang

texts.en: Klang S., 62, is a widow who sells a traditional Khmer noodle soup dish out of her home food stand in Siem Reap. She lives with her one child who is a construction worker, and she has been serving soup to her community making US$5 per day. She has seen the demand for her dish grow and has asked for a loan of US$500 to expand and improve her business. She needs more eating utensils to satisfy all of her customers and would also like to expand her stand. There is room for her to add more seating and she feels that the customer demand is high enough to increase her income and account for this investment.

loans.use: Purchase more eating utensils and improve her stand

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mrs. Nou H., 37, is a widow with two sons, and lives in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. One of her sons is a garment factory worker and other one is a construction worker.

Mrs. Nou has been a garment factory worker for ten years. She works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. Nou and her son travel to work by motor taxi and the costs are a bit high, so she needs to buy a motorbike to cut down on costs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Nuevo Progreso is a community bank located in the Andean Mountains in the community of Viracochan, located 2,600 meters above sea level. This area is principally known for the breeding of animals such as cows and small animals including guinea pigs. In addition, corn, onion and wheat are grown here.

Julia A. D. C., a member of the Nuevo Progreso community bank in Ayacucho, Perú, lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 12 and 9. She runs a grocery store in the area, sells meat, and operates a small restaurant patronized by many professionals and teachers visiting the area. When Julia first opened her store she did not have many patrons because she was still unknown, but since then the customers have increased. Since joining FINCA Perú she has been participating in training programs that help her improve her business. With the loan she is requesting, Julia will invest in her business by purchasing more products for her store and for her restaurant. She is saving for her dream of owning a car and helping her children continue their studies and becoming professionals.

Aida R. R., also a member of the community bank, lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children aged 10 and 7. She runs her own grocery store where there is a kiosk available to buy refreshments.
