When Aida opened her store, there was political unrest which caused some problems, but since then the area has become more tranquil. FINCA Perú, which Aida recently joined, has helped her improve her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more products for her store. FINCA Perú emphasizes savings, and with her savings Aida dreams of her children continuing their education and being financially independent.

loans.use: The 19 members need different amounts of money, ranging from $35 to $200, totaling $2300.

loans.name: Qurbat

texts.en:
Qurbat K. is 45 years old. He is married and has five children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life have made him recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 20 years, he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. Qurbat is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Qurbat wakes up early every morning to feed his cows and calves, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. 

Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy four calves to expand his business. Let's support Qurbat who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 43 years old. She has six children, four of whom are grown. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. Now, her main sources of income are raising poultry and growing rice. She makes about 4 million VND per month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow  9 million VND to invest in raising ducks.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Mrs. Kon N., who lives in An Loung Tnout Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a Khmer cake seller while her husband, Mr. Bruk Khorn, is a farmer who owns one hectare of land upon which he cultivates rice. Because his field is far from an irrigation system, Kon is requesting a loan to buy a water pump for the field. She hopes to make the crop more productive, which will help to better support the family.

Kon is 47 years old and the mother of six children, one employed in a garment factory while another four are attending the local school and the youngest is yet too young to begin studying.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for the rice field.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun L., who is pictured with her daughter, is 52 years old. She is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She purchases and sells rice and makes about US $5.00 per day. The family is aided by one of her daughters, who has a business selling various kinds of desserts from home and is able to make US$ 10.00 each day in revenue. Her other two children are students. 

Mrs. Chun L. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to expand her rice stock.She will purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. runs a community store in the village of Alibagu Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old and married to Espedito, an elementary teacher. They are blessed with two children: Ria Eden – 25 years old, a college graduate and Ron Eduardo – 21 years old, a college student. Josephine is hoping that her son will also finish his studies and have a better future.

She has been running her business for almost two years. She came up with this idea so she could help her husband in providing not only the needs of their family but also in sending their children to school. Josephine wants to borrow an additional capital of PHP 6, 000 that she can use for her store. She hopes that with this loan and with hard work, her business will grow. Since her husband is already a retiree, they can have an alternative source of income that they can use. She believes that time is gold and it needs to be treasured to make the best out of it.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a married, 38-year-old mother of 7 children. She sells second-hand clothes in Kisumu, Kenya, and hopes to purchase more clothing to sell with her loan. She says she is challenged by school fees and transportation costs when it comes to getting her clothes. She would like to thank the people that fund her loan.

loans.use: More used clothing

loans.name: Teodora Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Teodora A. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 4to año de educación secundaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Teodora se dedica a la venta de golosinas y menú los cuales los ofrece al los pescadores en el muelle, trabaja con pedidos los cuales son hechos para las personas que laboran en el muelle de Salaverry, su negocio lo desarrolla entre su casa y el negocio ambulatorio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para la preparación de menú.
Con el crédito de 300 soles , que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá todo en su negocio 
Teodora tiene como sueño, ampliar sus momentos de recreación con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora A. is 35 years old. She lives in the Salaverry district in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad. She studied up to the 4th year of her secondary education. She has 3 children who are economically dependent upon her. Teodora sells meals and sweets to the fishermen on the wharf. She works on orders for the people who work on the Salaverry wharf. Her business takes places between her house and her street sales. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her bank, “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverrry II”, she bought supplies for meal preparation. She will put this entire loan of 300 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, into her business. Teodora’s dream is to spend more recreational time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying the necessary supplies for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Agnes M. from Mwanza is 45 years old and married with four children between the ages of 18 and 24. Agnes has been running a business selling charcoal since 2005. Charcoal is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light it.

As there is such a high demand across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! Agnes works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days a week, and is assisted by one employee. She currently earns about $150 USD from her business, and is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more charcoal and resell it. In the future, she plans to open another business. Agnes thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and lease-back microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 46 años y está casado hace 5 meses con Remigia que tiene 46 años de edad, a quien conoció durante su juventud.  No tienen hijos.  Ambos pudieron terminar solamente la secundaria y quedaron sin posibilidades de estudiar ninguna carrera universitaria debido a que provenían de familias de escasos recursos.

Andrés tiene su propio taller en donde realiza diversos trabajos de chapería y pintura mientras que su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar.  Él comenta que se inició en la actividad hace más de un año ya que anteriormente realizaba trabajos de albañilería hasta que un día decidió cambiar de rubro debido a que se dió cuenta que su trabajo actual es menos sacrificado que el anterior. Además tiene la ventaja de que puede realizar los trabajos en su propio taller que funciona en su mismo hogar.

Utilizó el dinero que ahorró durante varios años trabajando como albañil y pintor en la capital del vecino país, Argentina, además de un pequeño capital que su esposa le entregó y que provenía de una herencia que ésta recibió. Con lo juntado pudo comprar todas las herramientas que hoy día utiliza para realizar sus trabajos.

Hoy día cuenta con su clientela bien formada y afirma que le va muy bien. Solicita un crédito para la compra de una herramienta más que está necesitando.
texts.en:
Andrés is 46 years old and is married to 46-year-old Remigia. They have only been married for 5 months, but knew each other when they were children; they don’t have any children of their own. Both of them finished high school but didn’t have the opportunity to go to university because they came from families of modest means. Andrés has his own shop where he does auto body repair and painting while his wife does housework. He says that he went into this line of work more than a year ago. He previously worked as a bricklayer but decided to change jobs when he realized that his present job would be less difficult than bricklaying. Moreover, he has the advantage of being able to work in his own shop, which he operates out of his home. Andrés started his business with money he saved during several years of working as a bricklayer and painter in the capital of the neighboring country, Argentina, along with some money his wife gave him that she had received as an inheritance. By putting that together he was able to purchase all of the tools that he uses for his work. Now Andrés has a well-established clientele and says that his business is going well. He is requesting a loan so he can purchase an additional tool that he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a tool for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi G. is divorced and has 6 dependents. She received an education through the primary school level. Maame Esi sells banku, a local meal made from maize. It is a very popular food that is eaten by most Ghanaians. Since 1998, she has been preparing this food and selling it at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. Maame Esi is solely responsible for the upkeep of her house. She uses her income to fulfill her responsibilities.

Maame Esi will use the loan to purchase maize for making banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Esi plans to take care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize for making banku.

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Cultivating a rice crop is a part of 60-year-old Mrs. Peng L.'s daily routine. On the other hand, she also buys natural produce at the cheapest price from people who live in the rural areas, and then sells that produce in the market to gain income.

Peng L. is a widowed mother since her husband died of senility a long time ago. She has six children: four are married and have already started new family homes, while the others are single and work with her on the farm.

Peng L. has been facing difficulty with transportation because she doesn’t own a vehicle for her driving needs. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva's partner HKL. She will use this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to meet her business transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to meet business needs

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells foodstuffs at retail to her customers. Bola is 40 years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Afissétou

texts.fr:
Cette dame vit dans le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique très animé de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce depuis 2007 l’activité de vente de bois de chauffage dans le marché local de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans les villages de sokodé, ainsi elle réalise plus de marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. Elle veut acheter plus de bois de chauffage pour agrandir son stock c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages son premier crédit.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady lives in Kégué, a very busy outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2007, she has been in the business of selling firewood at the local market in her district. She acquires her supplies inland, from the villages of Sokodé, and she thus realizes a larger profit margin on her sales. She wants to buy more firewood to expand her stock. This is why she's requesting her first loan from WAGES. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
To break the wall of poverty that hinders her and her family's way to success is the greatest aspiration of Fe. She is married to Perfecto, who is a vendor and is 60 years old. She has five children to take good care of. She lives in Pililia, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

In 2008, Fe joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to have access to capital for her business operating a sari-sari store (general store). Since then, her business brings her enough proceeds for her family needs. It's her neighbors who are her avid customers.

Now she seeks a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her store. The amount will be used to pay for sacks of sugar, beverages, cooking oil and groceries.

She hopes that with the support of ASHI and Kiva, little by little, she can reach her dreams in life: to send her children to school until college and to expand her business into a bigger grocery store.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of sugar, beverages, cooking oil and groceries

loans.name: Ann Antonette

texts.en:
Ann Antonette R. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 22 years old. Ann Antonette is single. To make a living, Ann Antonette owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dairy products like chocolates in the local community. Ann Antonette is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ann Antonette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann Antonette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ann Antonette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
Fabiana T. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old. Fabiana is widowed and has 5 grown-up children. To make a living, Fabiana runs a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Fabiana has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Fabiana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fabiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fabiana is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fabiana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria Soledad L. S. tiene 40 años. Es una Señora muy responsable y trabajadora ella tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de roa usada. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, sale todos los días de sol a sol a buscar nuevos clientes y a promocionar su ropa, a pesar de las dificultades que atravesó como fue el problema de su artritis ya que no podía caminar grandes distancias, pero esto era un sacrificio que ella tenía que hacer por sus 3 hijos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y ropa para niños por lo que es la más solicitada por sus clientes. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y con un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad L. S. is 40. She is a very responsible, hard-working woman with a great entrepreneurial spirit. She sells used clothes. She has been doing this for over five years. She leaves everyday from sunup to sundown looking for new customers and promoting her clothes. She does this in spite of difficulties she has encountered, like her arthritis and not being able to walk long distances. This was the sacrifice she had to make for her three children. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and children’s clothes, which are the items her customers ask for the most. Her wish is that her children finish their education and that they become successful people with a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en: W. Agnes is 24 years old and married with two children as she takes care of two dependants. Agnes is a beautician with a salon in Kitega that has been in operation for 3 years and it is able to make profits of 30,000/= a week. She specializes in plaiting, treatments and haircuts and her major challenge is the power cuts and the expensive chemicals that limit her profits. She has a dream of expanding and having her own salon since the one she has is owned by her husband and has many employees. She also vies to educate all her children to attain the best education so that they can have a better future. Agnes needs a loan to help buy more hair oils and weaves so that she can be able to boost up her business. She is such a friendly young lady and this will help her succeed.

loans.use: Buying more hair oils and weaves for expansion.

loans.name: Silvia Group

texts.es:
Liliam del Socorro B. F., Marvin José B. L. y Zoila María F. conforman el grupo Silvia. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Liliam B. quien comenzó hace tres años vendiendo meneítos, luego introdujo gaseosas, helados y fresco. Actualmente con el préstamo lo invertirá en granos básicos y aceite para así ir surtiendo la venta. 

Marvin B. tiene seis años de vender verduras y  Zoila F. distribuye  prendas de oro y plata en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
The Silvia group is made up of the following members: Liliam del Socorro, Marvin José and Zoila María. Liliam is the group leader. She began three years ago selling meneítos (a puffed-cheese snack), then introduced soft drinks and frozen treats. Currently she will use the loan to buy basic grains and oil to stock her sales. Marvin has been selling vegetables for the past six years and Zoila distributes gold and silver items in Costa Rica.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Mary trades in utensils. She sells at the local market and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Mary buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of utensils to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils to sell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger R. is from the village of Liloan Bonifacio Misamis Occ.. He is 38 years old and is married. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roger joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roger from GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family and save for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying meal for the preparation of porridge

loans.name: Laurianne Inès

texts.fr: L. Laurianne Inès est née le 22 Juin 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUETO Mathieu, un employé au Port du Bénin, Laurianne Inès est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a deux ans environs que la famille vit à Cococodji à Abomey Calavi (non loin de Cotonou). Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Laurianne Inès a été à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 7 ans, Laurianne Inès s’est mise à vendre des tissus et des sacs, par le système de distribution. Laurianne Inès mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de glacières. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Laurianne Inès s’approvisionne. Laurianne Inès a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. C’est pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire la demande de ses clients, que Laurianne Inès sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Laurianne Inès L. was born on 22 Juin 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mathieu HOUETO, an employer at the Port of Benin, and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The family has been living in Cococodji at Aborney Calavi (near Cotonou) for approximately two years. The couple both contribute financially to support the family. Laurianne Inès attended school until secondary school. For the last seven years, she has been selling cloth/fabric and bags, via a business system comprised of purchasing, receiving, storing and distributing. As her second commercial activity, she sells ice boxes. It is in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Laurianne Inès stocks up on supplies. She previous had one loan from Alidé which she reimbursed. It is in order to expand her business and better satisfy the demands of her clients that Laurianne Inès is asking for this second credit from Alidé.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four large pieces of cloth and 15 bags for women

loans.name: Bernardina Delia

texts.es:
Bernardina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Bernardina es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Bernardina tiene una panadería en donde elabora panes típicos, el horno es rustico a leña, además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y también tiene locutorios, actividades que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Bernardina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Bernardina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 56, is a member of the Amor Divino communal bank. She has three children. Bernardina has a bakery where she makes traditional breads; she uses a rustic, wood-burning oven. In addition, she has a grocery store in her home and public phone booths. Her children occasionally help her with her daily chores. She needs a 2000 sol loan to buy flour. Bernardina's dreams are that her children become professionals and to continue working to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola M. C., tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos.Ella vive con su madre. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado de cría, y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su madre a salir adelante y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es la primera vez que Paola se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. 
Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Paola M. C. is 18 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her mother. The loan she requests would help her to purchase breeding animals, enabling her to raise livestock and earn money for herself by selling the animals once they have grown to a sufficient size. Paola's earnings from raising livestock will help her and her mother to achieve greater success and enjoy a better quality of life. This is the first time that Paola has worked with FUDECOSUR to finance herself, and her new opportunity to work with livestock demonstrates how the credit committee has been able to help her and facilitate opportunities for her to improve her life. Paola hopes that through this project she will grow and achieve her objectives, and that through her success she will some day be able to offer a better quality of life and greater economic stability to her mother. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Ganado

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carmen R. R., es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de colchones y camas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en ciudad Sandino.
Ella vende ambulante junto con su esposo en los departamentos del norte del país.  
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de hilaza y tela  para la elaboración de los colchones.
Es casada, con tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 3 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Carmen R. R. is an enterprising woman who owns a store that sells mattresses and beds. She started this store with an initial investment of 10,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas that she obtained through a loan 10 years ago. This business is located in the city of Sandino. She also travels with her husband to sell her products in the northern departments of the country. The loan requested is to be used for working capital to buy heavy duty thread and fabric to make the mattresses. She is married with 3 children in her care, 2 of whom are school-aged. She says that before having this business she worked as a domestic. She has had 7 loans with CEPRODEL over the period of 3 years, which she invested in her business. These financings granted by CEPRODEL helped her to grow, diversifying her products so that she could compete in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy heavy-duty thread and fabric for the production of mattresses

loans.name: Karina Evelyn

texts.es:
La Señora Karina López tiene 32 años ella es de la ciudad de Oruro se vino a Cochabamba por que la madre  se encontraba muy enferma de salud y es por eso que tuvo que dejar su trabajo y toda sus actividades ella y sus hijos ella es  madre soltera de dos niños los cuales tiene que velar por la educación y salud de la madre, ella vive en una pequeña casa ubicada en Quintanilla es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Karina trabaja como secretaria en el Colegio Señor de Mayo y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de mercaderías (carteras, edredones, zapatos etc.) lo que pueda vender para poder ayudar a sus hijos y a su madre que aun se encuentra enferma de diabetes que es una enfermedad de cuidado en nuestro país ella es la única hija que la apoya a su madre de 85 años de edad, sus demás hermanos se olvidaron de ella, Karina paga los gastos de la enfermedad de su madre y también de la educación de sus hijos que el menor va a kínder y el otro a tercero de primaria.
Karina es la menor de su familia y desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar y ayudar a la madre, porque el padre murió cuando trabajaba en la mina en la ciudad de Oruro y ellos tuvieron que salir adelante  y trabajar desde entonces Karina soñaba con estudiar una carrera pero no lo pudo, es por eso que ella lucha y trabaja el doble para que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y estudiar una carrera y ver que tengan un futuro mejor que el de ella darles una vida cómoda y segura ella trata de ser la mejor madre y dedicarles el poco tiempo que le queda.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar un auto para ponerlo a trabajar y pueda obtener más ingresos y darles más tiempo a sus hijos y cuidarle a su madre que siempre esta enfermita.
texts.en:
Señora Karina López is 32 years old. She is from the city of Oruro and she came to Cochabamba because of her mother who fell ill and this is why Karina had to leave her work and all of her activities. She is a single mother of two children for whom she has to ensure an education as well as the health of her mother. Karina lives in a small house located in Quintanilla a cantón of the city of Cochabamba. Karina works as a secretary in the Señor de Mayo high school and in the afternoons she sells merchandise (folders, quilts, shoes etc) whatever she can sell to be able to help her children and her mother who is sick with diabetes, which is a disease of care in our country. Karina is the only daughter that supports her 85 year old mother, her other siblings have forgotten her. Karina pays the costs of her mother's illness and also for the education of her children who are in kindergarten and third grade. Karina is the youngest of her family and has had to work since she was very young to help her mother because her father died while he was working in a mine in the city of Oruro and the family has had to get ahead and work since then. Karina dreamed of studying a career but she couldn't, and this is why she struggles and works double so that her children can finish high school and study a career, so that they can have a more comfortable and secure future. She tries to be the best mother and devotes what little time she has to them. She is seeking this credit to buy a car to use for work and earn more income, and to give her more time with her children and to care for her mother who is always sick.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 61 years old, married to Jane Njoki, and they have two grown-up children who already have their own families. He has run his agro-vet shop in Naivasha town for the last year.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. He has applied for a loan which he will use to increase capital for his operations, since he plans to add stock of maize seedlings and pesticide for sale in his shop.

He plans to enlarge his agro-vet shop and supply and sell his products both wholesale and retail.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings in bulk and pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 49 años, tiene cuatro hijos (Marlene, Edgar, Laura y Daniela), ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Victoria se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos cuenta que los días lunes,  miércoles y sábados viaja a la ciudad del Cusco llevando sus productos para venderlos en el mercado de Huancaro. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas como por ejemplo de flor, repollo, lechuga, sapallo, etc.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Reyna de los Ángeles Communal Bank. She is a native of Urubamba. She is 49, and she has four children (Marlene, Edgar, Laura, and Daniela). She is a responsible mother who is every moment looking for opportunities to get ahead. She looks to give her children a better future through her daily effort. Victoria sells vegetables. She sells on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays. She travels to the city of Cusco, and she takes her products to sell in the Huancaro market. She has been in the business for 30 years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into the business. Victoria needs the loan to buy seeds for things like flowers, cabbage, lettuce, and squash, etc. She is very grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for flowers, cabbage, lettuce, and squash, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Hulmester

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Progresiva La Ciudad, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida en el norte por su movimiento comercial.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años al comercio de verduras, actualmente realiza su actividad en el mercado Los Pathos, un mercado relativamente nuevo: con tres años de antigüedad, ocupado por comerciantes que originalmente ofrecían sus productos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad) y que luego adquirieron el terreno que actualmente ocupan. El mercado es conocido por la venta de verduras en variedad a bajos precios, lo cual es apreciado por los comerciantes minoristas de verduras que recurren a este centro de abasto para realizar sus compras.

Wilmer desea realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su puesto ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado debido a las lluvias que se han presentado durante los meses de verano, para ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Wilmer es una persona que ha trabajado desde muy joven para salir adelante, su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresario para seguir progresando y ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 23 years old; he is single and lives in his parents’ house located in the Progresiva La Ciudad area, an urban area, close to the city of Chiclayo, a city well-known in the north for its business industry.

Wilmer has worked for over 6 years selling vegetables and now sells in the Los Pathos market, a relatively new market 3 years old, used by merchants that originally sold their products in the Moshoqueque market (a wholesale market in the city) and later each got grounds that now use to sell their products. The market is known for its variety of vegetables available for sale at low prices, which is valued by the vegetable retailers that go to the market to buy their goods.

Wilmer wishes to improve the infrastructure of his stall since it has deteriorated because of the rain that has occurred during the summer months. He is in need of a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva's field partner) that will help him achieve his goal.

Wilmer has worked from a very young age to get ahead; his dream is to keep growing as a businessman to keep making progress and to help his family to have a better quality of life. He has already worked with our institution and has shown to be punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his stall due to the damages caused by the rainfall.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama L. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) and dried fish. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Mama is 28 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for beans, pulses and maize flour in order to expand her business .

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena C. is from the village of Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is 36 years old. Gena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gena owns and operates a food vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a viand or variety food in the local community. Gena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Gena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jovic

texts.en:
Jovic B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jovic owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jovic has been engaged in his business for over two years.
Jovic joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovic is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be his fourth from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Yamileth Argentina

texts.es:
la sra. Yamileth Argentina R. B. se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de juguetes que opera bajo el nombre de ALFA Y OMEGA actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años, esta 
casada es madre de familia. tiene un hijo.
con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permiten suplir algunos personales y estudios universitarios ya que es pasante de la carrera de psicologia en la Universidad de Nicaragua.

el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio ya que se aproxima la feria juniana de su municipio en ocacion de celebrar el festival nacional del Café que es bien concurrida por propios y extranjeros, el cafe es el rubro de esta region Oriental de Honduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamileth Argentina R. B. works as a merchant. She has a small toy store that operates under the name of ALFA Y OMEGA. She has been doing this activity for more than 6 years. She is married and a mother of one child. The income that this business generates allows her to pay for some personal expenses and some university classes since she is a psycology major at the University of Nicaragua. She will use the loan to invest in her business, since the June holiday of her town is coming up and is the occasion to celebrate the national Coffee festival, which is well attended by the locals and by foreigners. Coffee is the main product of this eastern region of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui.
Américo, tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. 

Yo nací y vivo en la comunidad de Yungaqui provincia de Anta y me dedico a la  compra de palos de eucalipto para elaborar leña y palos de construcción de casas para lo cual a un inicio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar y así mejorar mi negocio. En esta oportunidad necesito el préstamo para comprar más palos de eucalipto.
texts.en:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui. Américo is 44 years old, married and has five children. I was born in the community of Yungaqui, province of Anta. I buy eucalyptus wood and make firewood and construction rods for houses. At first, it was a little hard for me since I didn't have a lot of capital. It was then that I was presented with the opportunity to join the communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa, which provided me with support in money loans and in this way I was able to improve my business. At this time, I need the loan to buy more eucalyptus wood.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more eucalyptus wood.

loans.name: Osinasio Omongini

texts.en:
Osinasio Omongini O. is a married man with seven children and he is 68 years of age. Initially, he was a farmer, which he realized could not meet the needs of his family effectively. After retiring from his employment in 2002, he started a poultry farming business in Malanga to generate income in order to sustain his family. He often travels after every six months to Nambale for additional stocks. 

He would wish to expand his business to generate more income. He has since applied for a loan worth Ksh.10,000, that he will use to boost his farming business and fulfill his dream of affording a quality education for his children in the future.

loans.use: To boost his poultry farming business

loans.name: Tiampati Ole

texts.en:
Tiampati has practiced livestock farming for the last four years and finds the venture very profitable. He is 25 years old, is married to Sisian Ene Nisa, and they have three children.

Tiampati was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy more cattle which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

Tiampati hopes to expand his business,and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Loice is 47 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to change to another type of business like selling foodstuffs at a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jose A. T. Z. es casado vive con su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor José  trabaja como programador de computadoras en una entidad privada y su esposa es administradora de un edificio, ambos  tienen un negocio donde venden material de escritorio, de esta forma  obtienen ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar capital de trabajo para su negocio y asÍ mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es su primer crédito en IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. José A. T. Z. is married and lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter in his in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Achachicala neighborhood. José works as a Computer Programmer in a private firm and his wife is a building supervisor. Both own a business where they sell office supplies thereby earning extra income for the home. The loan will be used to increase working capital for their business in order to improve income and quality of life. It’s his first loan with IMPRO; the socio-economic evaluation undertaken indicates that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper goods.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose C. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 48 years old. Jose is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jose runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jose has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jose is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Jose from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica C. es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta con su negocio de abarrotes llamado “Angélica” desde hace 15 años y para tener más ingresos es gerente de productos por catálogo. Sus hijos ya son grandes de edad los cuales formaron su propia familia, pero ella se esta haciendo cargo de un nieto al que desea ofrecer una mejora calidad de vida. Para seguir manteniendo su negocio requiere de su apoyo para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en: Angélica C. is a very hardworking person. She has had her grocery store, called "Angelica," for 15 years, and in order to make more revenues is a catalog representative. Her children are already grown and have started their own families, but she is taking care of a grandson because she wants to give him better quality of life. In order to continue maintaining her store, she needs your help to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen L. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old and widowed with three school-aged children. To make a living, Aileen owns a business making and selling snacks and other Filipino delicacies like puto cheese and cassava cakes. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aileen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Aileen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and working capital

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Becerrra es socia del banco comunal Las Estrellitas, vive por un hermoso sector como es Totoracocha en la ciudad de de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza cultural de su gente y sus tradiciones, cuenta con grandes paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos  de 25, 19 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo estudia,Trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es fotógrafo profesional. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana es comerciante, se dedica a vender limpiones de cocina, actividad que la realiza hace dos años, vende su producto de domingo a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 3 años y ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de limpiones para la venta. Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana Becerra is a member of the “Las Estrellitas” communal bank and lives in the lovely sector of Totoracocha within the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its people’s cultural beauty and traditions.  It includes beautiful landscapes that are admired and enjoyed and has a beautiful historic downtown area that has been called “the fatherland of humanity.”

Ana is 45 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children, ages 25, 19, and 10.  Her oldest daughter is married and on her own.  Her next oldest son attends school, works, and helps the family financially and her youngest son attends school in town.  Her husband is a professional photographer and they live in a rented home.

Ana has been selling kitchen cleaning products for two years.  She works seven days a week from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for three years and is good friends with all of the other members.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more cleaning products.  She dreams of having her own home.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Srun Prach's Group

texts.en:
These five people make up a group loan located in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. Each of them will use their portion of the loan in a way that can improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Srun P., who is 46 years old, is the group leader selected by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sray Chhorn, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a cow middleman. 

Since her husband’s business is going well at this time, she would like to expand this business, so she is seeking a loan to add more money to buy a cow for resale. 

This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old single and ambitious man, having specialized in Arabic desserts and sweets for 5 years. He started his own business 3 years ago and is very thankful with the level he’s achieved untill now. Hussein is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary machines, such as an oven, a blender and a pastry mixer, to improve his business. Hussein’s clients are from all over and they are assured of his best tasting items. Hussein insists on expanding his business by opening other branches soon.

loans.use: to buy necessary machines to improve his business

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
This is Melita D., 56. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Melanio D.. Together they have three children, all of whom live at home, managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Melita has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melita operates a beauty parlor where she also sells beauty supplies. People who work hard and desire pampering but despise the pricey treatment in spas are welcome to come to these little parlors to get haircuts, beautification treatments, manicures, pedicures, and much more for a fraction of their prices in spas.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Melita is requesting a Php 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more beauty products and supplies for her parlor like hair crèmes, oils, nail polish, and the like. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Melita hopes to have more extra capital for her business so she can start expanding soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and supplies for salon

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-three members who are located in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. This village bank selected Mrs. Pen P., 39 years old and a married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pen P. is a farmer who rents 2 hectares of land which she uses to cultivate lotuses to sell to support the family. She would like to ask for a loan to buy lotus seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for cultivating lotuses. Her husband, Mr. Pum Ly, 48 years old, has a job as a construction worker where he can receive a little salary to support his family.

This couple has five children: Two of them are seamstresses in a garment factory and two are attending the local school while the youngest one is only 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy lotus seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to grow lotuses

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 64 years old, married, and has one adult child. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In May 2009, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. 

This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for any future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches to rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet tiene  30 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Janet es la venta de muebles y colchones, ella tiene su propio local en la plaza principal del distrito de Santiago, Cusco.  Ya son 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar muebles como por ejemplo roperos, sillas y otras cosas más. El sueño de la socia es abrir otras tiendas. 
 
Janet pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business activity is selling furniture and mattresses. She has her own shop in the main plaza in the District of Santiago in Cusco. Janet has been in this business for four years and has done very well. She needs a loan to buy furniture such as wardrobes, chairs, and other pieces. Her dream is to open other stores.

Janet belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase wardrobes, chairs, and other furniture pieces

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus dos hijas Grisell de 26 y Linsey de 11 años, a quienes desea dar una buena calidad de vida. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Tarma, Esmeralda lleva una variedad de cosméticos, pues es una vendedora muy convincente y siempre esta en constante actividad, visitando a sus amigas y clientes que ha logrado captar. Por tanto ella siempre procura renovar y abastecerse de productos novedosos. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede brindarles a sus hijos los estudios que se merecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que debería instalar una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos de belleza. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el crédito en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los  setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de cosméticos.
texts.en:
45 year-old Esmeralda is a very hard-working and cheerful woman.  She lives in a rented room together with her two daughters, 26 year-old Grisell and 11 year-old Linsey, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Walking the streets of the city of Tarma, Esmeralda carries with her a range of cosmetics.  She is a very persuasive saleswoman who is constantly active, visiting her friends and the customers that she has managed to attract.  She is always trying to renew her stock and stock up with the latest products.  She feels that her work is very profitable since it has enabled her to provide her children with the education that they deserve.  What she most likes about her work is advising her customers on which products they should use.  She has been in this business for 7 years and she believes that she should set up a store where she could sell her beauty products more comfortably.

This is Esmeralda's tenth loan with MFP and she is very happy to be receiving it.  She tells us that she will invest all the loan money in her business since she wants to improve her life.  Esmeralda is a very cheerful member of her community bank.  She will use her 700 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products so that she can offer her customers a larger variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: To stock up with cosmetics to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ricardina; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercadería y así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, la socia es una persona bien alegre y lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ricardina is a member of the "MOSOQ ALLPA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ricardina is 58 years old, separated, and has 4 children.  Her business is buying and selling clothes.  She travels to the city of Lima to buy her merchandise so that she can have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.  Ricardina is a very cheerful person and she has been in her business for some time.

Ricardina is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren is 26 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  They live together in a small house on their plot of land. His two sons are attending a local kindergarten. 

Baasansuren has operated a vegetable retail business for the last ten years and has gained a lot of experience. Since 2006 he has been renting a stall at “Kharkhorin” market. His wife helps his business during the day. As his business has grown, he has increased his inventory including fish, onions and fruit. Baasansuren is very hard-working person who is providing for his children’s future education and teaching them morals. 

He lives a little far from the market; therefore he is planning to purchase a car, using his savings. Baasansuren is requesting a loan to build an extension to his house entryway and will use part of the loan  to increase his working capital so he can buy more products for resale.

loans.use: to build an extension to his house entryway.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman who lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She has eight children.

Tessie is a farmer. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest to the market. She has been engaged in rice farming for 25 years. Tessie works hard to improve her business and support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 22 años es una mujer dichosa, pues convive desde hace 7 años con Edner, con quien tiene 2 pequeños hijos: Wilian y Franco; a los cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Casacoto. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y habas, los cuales siembra en sus terrenos propios en la localidad de Ñawin, pero en campañas agrícolas alquila algunas tierras para poder tener mayor producción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar sus cosechas a la capital del país donde consigue mejores compradores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus sembríos, ya que es un augurio de buena cosecha. Dentro de pocos meses comenzará la recolección de arveja que sembró, por lo que está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “única y yungay”, donde pueda obtener cosechas consecutivas para cada temporada agrícola. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sembradoras de Casacoto”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues le enseñaron a ahorrar e invertir correctamente su dinero. Nancy, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en su terreno agrícola para la temporada de cosecha del mes de julio.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 22, is a woman who is blessed.  She has lived with Edner for seven years, and they have two young childen, Wilian and Franco.  She takes care of them with much love in her own house in Casacoto, a rural community.

She has devoted herself to farming for five years.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes, and beans.  She plants her crops on her own land in Ñawin.  However, during the harvest season she rents some land to be able to have greater production.  What she likes most about her work is being able to sell her harvest in the country’s capital, where she gets better buyers.  She also likes to be able to see her crops grow because that is a sign of a good harvest.

Within a few months she will start harvesting the peas that she planted.  Therefore she is thinking of planting “única” and “yungay” (types of potatoes).  That way she will be able to have consecutive harvests for each harvest season.

She belongs to the “Sembradoras de Casacoto” (Casacoto Farmers) Communal Bank.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She feels fulfilled; they taught her to save and to invest her money wisely.  Nancy will use the requested money to buy a bag of pea seeds.  She will scatter the seeds on her fields for the harvest season in July.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur is 36 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He manages a leather-goods manufacturing business with the help of his wife. 

He started his business in 2008 based on experience he gained at Montulga, a manufacturer of leather goods. Since then he has been able to employ two more workers who are specialized in the production of leather souvenirs and gifts intended for foreign tourists. Enhtur himself is responsible for taking orders and introducing his goods to his customers, and his wife is responsible for designing and making goods. 

His wife graduated from the University of Culture and Art with Bachelor of Design. Enhtur is a hardworking man who possesses good managerial skills. He says, "By renewing my equipments and techniques, I want to produce more qualified and fine goods which eventually occupy 10% of the market demand."

He is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase new equipment and some materials in order to produce an increased amount of products.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and some materials.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Улчаев Абдували проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдували зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает несколько голов бычков, откармливает и продает по более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности Абдували занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычка и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduvali U. lives in the Yavan district.  He is 45 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abduvali earns a living by raising cattle. He buys several heads of cattle, fattens them up and sells them at more profitable prices.  Abduvali has been involved in this type of business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to buy a bull and small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and small livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four young children who are still attending school.  She has been running a successful bakery since 2001. She produces tasty Lebanese food. She cooperates with her husband who works in security in a local school to be able to pay the heavy living expenses, especially their children's schooling. This will be her second Kiva loan. She has had a very good repayment history and always repaid on time. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her purchases of food in order to increase her productivity, her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to increase her purchases of food (ingredients) for her bakery

loans.name: Yader

texts.en:
Yader started his business in 2004. Yader’s business consists of buying plastic bags at a wholesale store and selling them to his local supermarket. Unfortunately, a violent robbery two years ago put a pause on his business success, taking him almost a year to recuperate. Yader’s first loan with ACCION USA allowed him to go back to his business with enough working capital to help him rebuild and cultivate business relationships.

Although Yader has a loyal client base, he would like to reach more clients and lower his cost of goods sold. With this second loan from ACCION USA, Yader will advertise his business and purchase more materials to continue its growth.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and advertise his business.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is a poultry farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for four years now and employs three farmhands. He is 31 years old and single.

Jesse has made his third loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 100,000 Kes in order to purchase additional chickens and chicken feed. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to expand his farming activities. He says that his biggest challenge has been the expenses incurred in raising the chicks from the time they are hatched to the time they are sold and diseases which cause a massive death of chickens.

He currently owns two dairy cows and would like to venture into dairy farming as well and be the sole supplier of milk in his division.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 24 year-old single mother of one child.  She runs a beauty salon in Mshomoroni, Mombasa.  Her business has been in operation for the last two years.
 
She  has been a KADET client and this marks her second  loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of cosmetics and hair products. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her  dream is to relocate her beauty salon into bigger business premises.

loans.use: to add  more stock of cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 38 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 de sus 7 hijos en casa de su suegra Gregoria y su esposo heredaron tierras, de las cuales lo está utilizando para sus actividades agrarias. Es así que en dichos terrenos siembra maíz, siendo un producto muy importante, pues la desgranarlo y secarlo se convierte granos que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado de su localidad. Siempre ha procurado vender lo que produce de manera directa ya que esto le genera mayores ganancias. Su esposo y sus hijos también la poyan en estas tareas porque es una actividad familiar que los fortalece y consolida. Sin embargo su esposo también tiene otro trabajo como maestro de obra, pero de manera paralela tiene su granja de cuyes  que también vende de manera periódica. De esta manera es como siguen adelante, ya que su fin es terminar de construir su casa para acondicionar un espacio granja donde pueda  tener su granja de cuyes tener más extensiones de terreno. Son varias ocasiones en las que viene trabajando con MFP, considera que los créditos grupales son una  oportunidad de desarrollo y  pude probarlo con su propia experiencia  por la cual siempre recomienda a otras personas. Con el dinero que solicita,  le servirá para comprar sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 38 years old and lives with her husband, and four of her seven children, in her mother-in-law's house.

Gregoria and her husband inherited land which they are farming.  On the land, Gregoria grows corn which is a very important product.  She removes the kernels and dries them.  In this state they are very much in demand her town market.  Gregoria has always tried to sell what she produces directly as this makes her more profits.  Her husband and children support her in her work because it is a family activity which strengthens their family unit.  However, her husband also has another job as a master builder.  In addition, they have a guinea pig farm and they also periodically sell their guinea pigs.  In this way, the family gets ahead.  Gregoria's goal is to finish building her home so that she can set aside a large space so that she can expand her guinea pig farm.  

Gregoria has worked with MFP on several occasions.  She considers group loans to be an opportunity to develop.  She has experienced this for herself and always recommends it to other people.  She will use the money she has requested to buy sacks of organic manure for growing her corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Wend Pa Welgde Group

texts.fr:
Mme Evelyne est la responsable du groupe WEND PA WELGDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits, des pagnes, des mèches et des pommades depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et aussi des hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 14complets pagnes.

Mme épargne ses économies et ambitionne voyager pour amener les habits et veut s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Evelyne is the leader of the group WEND PA WELGDE. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 8 and the youngest is 2 years old. Two of her children attend school and she takes care of four people.

She has been selling clothes, fabric skirts, hair extensions and lotions for nine years. She buys her inventory at the market in sector 10. Her clients are both men and women.

She wants to purchase 14 complete fabric skirts.

She saves her money and strives to travel to sell clothes and wants to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 14 complete fabric skirts.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen trabaja en un Centro de servio de Internet medio tiempo y ayuda a su mama vendiendo en el mercado  vendiendo verduras la otra mitad de su tiempo. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir una computadora portátil para su uso personal y ayudar a su mamá con el registro de ingresos y gastos del puesto de ventas.
