Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Tembladerani de  la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera  y no  tiene hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Carmen works part-time at an Internet café and spends the rest of her time helping her mother sell vegetables at the market.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a laptop computer for personal use.  She will also use it to help her mother track her business income and expenses.  Carmen lives at her parents’ house in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has no children.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for personal use and for tracking her mother's business expenses.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Tumenbayar is a 43-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has double higher education in accounting and the nutrition technology field.
 
Regardless of her profession, she had six years of experience in her own grocery and home furnishings store until she went to South Korea for a higher paying job for five years. After she came back from S. Korea in 2010, she continued her small grocery store business. 

Tumenbayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store. Her goal is to improve her business with this loan and live with her two daughters happily.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La señora Inés, se dedica a la venta de productos de Herbalife y también a la venta de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para abrir una tienda en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, que es una zona de alto tráfico de clientes. Inés trabaja muy fuerte para conseguir que estas dos actividades sean la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Villa San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Inés tiene unas ganas de superación admirables.
texts.en: Inés sell Herbalife products and also clothes.  She needs the loan to buy large amounts of clothing to open a store in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio area which is an area with high customer traffic.  Inés works very hard so that both these activities will be sources of income to cover her expenses.  She lives in her parents’ house which is located in the city of La Paz’s Villa San Antonio zone.  She’s single and has no children.  Inés has an admirable drive to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in quantity in order to open a store in the business district of the city of El Alto.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with five children, four girls and one boy. Two of her children attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past seven years she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. Sauda dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase building materials to expand her premises. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to expand her premises

loans.name: Ray Rosario

texts.es:
Ray es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Ray se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo para los mismos, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Ray es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hija salga adelante y tenga una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Ray is a 40 year old mother.  She lives with her daughter in her own house, which does not have basic services.  The house is in a rural zone in the Chepén district in the La Libertad department.  The zone is known for its agriculture, its livestock, and its tourism.

Ray has been raising and selling pigs for a few years.  Their pen is located behind her house.  She feeds them balanced feed, and once they have reached their optimum growth she is able to offer them to her customers.  She is able to pay the household expenses with the income that she gets.

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more animals of different species and their respective feed.  Once they are fattened she will sell them at the different markets in the zone.  Her objective is to get more income in order to have a better quality of life.

Ray is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that she wants is for her daughter to get ahead and to have a better education.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different species and their respective feed.

loans.name: Reyna Lizzette

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es casada y dueña D. una venta D. ropa, dicho negocio surgió gracias a su propia iniciativa, este negocio lo atienD. D. 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. todos los días.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para su negocio como ropa para damas blusas, vestidos, licras,para caballeros camisetas y camisas formales y para niños niños ya que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a surtir su negocio y a mejorara ingresos económicos.
Su mayor sueño es crecer en el negocio y sus ganancias para pagar sus deudas y trabajar con dinero propio.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her husband and three children. She is married and the owner of a clothing shop. This business was established through her own initiative. She operates her business from 7am to 5pm, every day.

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business such as women’s blouses, dresses, spandex, men’s t-shirts, formal shirts, and children’s clothes. There is already demand from her customers, so this purchase will help restock her business and improve her financial earnings.

Her greatest wish is to grow her business, use her profits to pay her debts, and work with her own money.

loans.use: to buy women’s blouses, dresses, spandex, men’s t-shirts, formal shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: La familia del Sr. Jose Luis se dedica al comercio informal, el se encuentra casado desde hace diez años, ellos viven al  nor- este de la ciudad, y en relación de la ubicación de sus puesto de mercado donde venden ellos,  es al otro lado de la ciudad ellos no tienen hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, ya que son mayores de edad, debido a que el señor tuvo un accidente el señor Jose Luis tuvo cerrar  el negocio durante un buen tiempo ya que la esposa lo atendía a su esposo internado en el hospital y la mercadería que ellos tenían se fue deteriorando ya que ellos venden champuses y otros productos de limpieza, asi perdieron su capital de trabajo es por este motivo que ellos necesitan el préstamo para poder reactivar su negocio y así poder volver a trabajar ya que ellos son mayores y no pueden trabajar en otras cosas hasta que el señor Jose Luis se recupere del todo de su accidente.
texts.en:
José Luis' family work in the 'informal business' sector.  José has been married for ten years and lives in the north-east of the city.  The market stall from which he sells his products is located on the other side of the city.  He does not have any dependent children as his children are all grown up. 

José Luis suffered an accident and so he had to close his business for a long period of time.  His wife cared for him while he was in the hospital and the merchandise that the couple had became spoiled as they sell shampoo and other personal care products.  This meant that they lost their working capital.  They need this loan so that they can restart their business and go back to work because they are getting on in years and can't work on anything new until José Luis recovers completely from his accident.

loans.use: to have working capital for his business selling personal care products

loans.name: Massabong Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Massobong” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of 800,000 SLL for each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the right is Mohamed, who is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Magburaka. He is married to a trader and the couple has six children – three in primary school and three in secondary school.

Mohamed sells cigarettes, batteries, soft drinks, etc. and has been doing business for fifteen years now. With his share of the loan, he will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, batteries, soft drinks, etc. in large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Jose Carmen

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 39 años de edad y vive en La Puerta, una aldea del municipio de Belen. Tiene 12 años de casado con su esposa Maria, la cual es ama de casa. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años, los cuales están estudiando. 

Jose era agricultor y cultivaba granos básicos como frijol. Hace dos años, con esfuerzos propios, Jose empezó un negocio para la elaboración de teja y ladrillo de barro y arcilla. Decidió cambiar oficio porque veía que este tipo de negocio era muy rentable. Hoy en día Jose tiene dos empleados en el negocio que le ayuden en la extracción de material y en la elaboración del producto. Los empleados tienen un año de estar trabajando con él. 

Solicitó este crédito (su cuarto con ODEF) para pagar los salarios de sus dos empleados. Así, podrá retener su equipo y juntos, elaborar más producto para la venta y así aumentar los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in La Puerta, a village in the town of Belén.  He’s been married to María who is a housewife for 12 years.  The couple has two children who are 12 and 9 years old and going to school.

José used to be a farmer;  he grew basic grains like beans.  Two years ago with his own efforts he started a business manufacturing roofing tiles and mud and clay bricks.  He decided to change occupations because he saw that this type of business was very profitable.  Today, José has two employees in the business that help him extract the material and manufacture the product.  The employees have been working for him for a year.

He requested this loan (his fourth with ODEF) to pay his two employees’ salaries so that he can keep his team together, manufacture more product to sell and increase the business’  income.

loans.use: to pay two employees' salaries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal, gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 50 years old with nine children.  Two of them attend school.  She is a widow.  She has had a business selling food from a food stall in Yei South Sudan for seven years.
Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase greens, oranges and tomatoes.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stand.

loans.name: Gaudioso

texts.en:
Gaudioso is 55 years old and married with six adult children. He lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor, Siquijor. For the past 10 years, Gaudioso has been working as a farmer. He grows corn to earn a living. Gaudioso has been a member of Paglaum Mulit Purpose Cooperative for just one month.  

Gaudioso is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn. In the future, he hopes to have a big harvest of corn for his family's consumption and to be able to deliver corn to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Aida Edelmira

texts.es:
La Señora Aída es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña. Aída tiene 38 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Aída labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como ganado, cuyes y pollos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y materiales de construcción para construir un galpón para los pollos.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the "Corazones de Turi" ["Hearts of Turi"] communal bank. She lives in a community belonging to the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This place is known as the scenic overlook of the city of Cuenca, since from there one can observe most of the city. Its people work in trade, raise animals or work in agriculture. They are known for being friendly and charismatic people.

Aída is 38 years old. She is married, and with her husband she has 4 children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 12. Her two oldest children are married and live independently. Her third child is in secondary school, and her youngest daughter goes to a small school in their community. Her husband works as a mason. They own the house where they live.

Aída works as a domestic employee. She has done this work for 5 years, working half a day from Monday through Friday. At home, she also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and larger livestock. 

This will be her second loan, and she will invest it in buying chickens as well as construction materials to build a shed for her chickens. 
 
Her dream is to have no debt.

loans.use: to buy chickens and construction materials.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 37 years old, married, and blessed with six children.  He has been practicing dairy farming for eight years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his farm by buying a water pump.  He has also grown his profit and has educated his children.

Pius hopes to expand his business further in the future.  He has requested a loan of 65,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Monsieur Alassane vit au Sénégal. Il est employé comme agent administratif dans une maison de la place. Il est célibataire et son salaire lui permet de se prendre en charge. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa localité. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour la réfection du plafond de sa maison. Il compte améliorer son cadre vie . Il souhaite avoir un terrain dans le futur.

loans.use: réfectionner le plafond de sa maison

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 44 years of age, is married and blessed with 4 children. 

He has had a  motorcycle transportation business for 11 years. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to educate his children.

He will use the anticipated profits to improve his housing structure, educate his children and to repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his business, make more income and live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.en:
Cristóbal has a workshop where he does metal work and refrigeration repair. He makes metal doors, gates and windows that are very popular in the community because they provide safety. He also works on refrigerator, automobiles and air conditioner repair. He learned the trades from his father and uncles who were in similar lines of business. He will use the loan in order to buy raw materials for his business. He runs the business out of his home in the backyard. Cristobal has six children he must try to support. His current wife helps him at the business and also has a small business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He will use the loan in order to buy metal and refrigeration fluid

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Three years ago, Julia used to work as a nurse in a medical center. Then she became pregnant, and her husband left her. With the help of her mother and some money she had saved, she decided to start a small business selling office and school supplies. She works there every day of the week from 9 AM to 8 PM. When she has to leave to make deliveries, she leaves her mother in charge of waiting on the customers at the shop.

Julia wants this loan in order to increase her working capital so that she can include more items in her inventory, such as clothes and electric items.

Julia is 21 years old. She is a single mother with one daughter. At present, she has her business in her mother's home. She also has her own small house made of cane, and she hopes that, with this investment, she can create a business that will let her remodel her little house.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To diversify her inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: I am proud to be LAPO Client say Mrs. Victoria O., a 50-year-old woman, is from the semi-urban area of Jattu, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks to people in her environment and is married with six (6) children. She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
Elizabet is single and does not have children. She lives in a house with her parents, and pays the bills for light, water and gas. She has a business selling women's clothing, which she brings from the town of Desaguadero to sell in the city of Cochabamba where she owns a small stand on Avenue Ayacucho. She was able to secure this stand thanks to steps taken by the unions in the city. When Elizabet joined Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), she had 300 bolivianos (the local currency) invested in some token items. In her first disbursement, she was able to grow her inventory and go to the city of Cochabamba in search of an opening in the market. Right now, she needs capital to continue to make her trips to Desaguadero and primarily to establish a shop specializing in clothing for children and women. In this way, she will be able help her parents more with their bills, and gain more of her own independence.

Soltera, sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, y se hace cargo de los gastos de luz, agua y gas domiciliario, Elizabet M., es comerciante de ropa femenina, misma que trae de la localidad de Desaguadero y la lleva para la venta a la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde es dueña de un puesto en la Av. Ayacucho. Este puesto fue conseguido gracias a las gestiones con el sindicato de gremiales de esa ciudad. Cuando Elizabet ingresa a Pro Mujer contaba con un capital de 300 bolivianos invertidos en algunas prendas. Ya en su primer desembolso, logra incrementar su mercadería y se va a la ciudad de Cochabamba en busca de la apertura de un mercado. En la actualidad Elizabet necesita de capital para seguir realizando viajes a Desaguadero y principalmente para el establecimiento de una tienda especializada en la venta de ropa para niños y ropa para mujeres, de esta forma lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan colaborar a sus padres en sus gastos, e independizarse del todo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Grow her clothing business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Aziza M., 26 sells underwear. She is married. Aziza has a high school education. She learned the business by helping her mother. Five years ago, Aziza opened her own business with sales volume of $100. When Aziza learned about and applied for a MicroInvest loan, she used the money to increase her sales. The $100 loan that Aziza received in 2003 helped her to purchase a new sales location and increase the variety of goods sold. While expanding her business, Aziza acquired many new clients. In the future, she plans to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махсудова Азиза занимается торговлей нижнего белья. Азизе 26лет, замужем, образование среднее. Набрала опыт, в торговле помогая своей матери в. Свою деятельность начала пять лет назад, в то время её товарооборот составлял 100$. Через некоторое время узнав о программе она решила получить займ и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. В 2003году Азиза получила кредит в размере 100$. После получения кредита и целевого использования она увеличила наименование товара, приобрела новое место для торговли и приобрела много клиентов. В дельнейшем планирует приобрести ещё одну точку торговли.

loans.use: To open another sales location

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is an artisan that works with Alpaca wool. She lives in the Andes zone of El Alto with her two children, the older of which has a job transporting cargo. The family covers expenses with the earnings from these two jobs.

Rosa requires the loan for the conversion of her small car which her son uses from gasoline to natural gas. Seeing that natural gas is cheaper than gasoline, this conversion will help her to reduce fuel expenses by 50%.

This will be Rosa’s third loan from Impro. The most recent loan was obtained through Kiva, so this will be the second loan that Rosa has applied for from Kiva lenders. This last loan has been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es artesana en tejidos de lana de alpaca, vive con sus dos hijos el mayor trabaja como transportista de carga; estos son los ingresos con lo que cubren la manutención familiar; vive en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la conversión de gasolina a Gas Natural Comprimido del carro pequeño que trabaja el hijo de doña Rosa. Esta conversión ayudará a reducir en un 50% de costo en combustible, en vista de que el Gas es más barato que la Gasolina.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario. El crédito anterior fue conseguido a través de Kiva, así que este nuevo crédito será el segundo que solicita a los financiadores de Kiva. El anterior crédito ha sido pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Conversion from gasoline to natural gas in her car.

loans.name: Fofana

texts.en:
Fofana S. lives with her cohabitant and their 4 children in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Cote d'Ivoire. She is 42 years old and sells various plastic utensils in the Sassandra market.

Ms. S.'s cohabitant is a fisherman. Except their elder son who is also a fisherman, all Ms. S.'s children go to school and she says that she will do her best to let her kids have access to university as well. She says that she regrets not having been able to pursue her own education as she was forced to stop at the end of elementary school because her parents were not able to pay her education expenses.

Ms. S. has been in our microcredit program for 3 years and she performs very well.

loans.use: to purchase goods for re-sale in her market stall

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Her husband has been driving a taxi for a few years. (Her husband is pictured). His name is Ibadet. He needs a loan in amount of $600, he plans to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair car

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long N., 39, is a vendor of Khmer natural medicines and she makes on average around $2 a day of profit. To sustain the standard of living her husband Mr. Vanty, 40, works as a motor-taxi driver everyday and he earns on average about $2 a day. This couple has six children, two of whom are working as garment workers and who receive a salary of $80 each month total. Their other four children are students. They are now currently requesting a loan from Kiva of about $700 to purchase a motor-bike for their daughters' commute.

loans.use: Long would like to use her loan to purchase a motor-bike for her daughters' commute.

loans.name: Raquel's Group

texts.es:
Raquel and Ercilia have been members of the Fe Communal Bank for 4 months and 8 months, respectively. As members of the bank, they have learned how to save and invest money.

Raquel is 25 years of age, married and has two children ages 3 and 6. She sells poultry, which initially she distributed to grocery stores with the help of her husband. Currently, she only distributes chicken giblets because her husband is traveling, and she has no one to support her. Additionally, Raquel sells cosmetics through catalog.

Ercilia is 24 years of age, and is a single mom of two children ages 1 and 7. She sells prepared food in the MiraF. market. Additionally, during vacation months, Ercilia travels to the Ayacuchan jungle to work as a cook. In her free time, she also does other people’s laundry.

Raquel and Ercilia need loans of 400 and 200 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of cologne, jewelry, pots, plates, and also in the improvement of their homes.

Raquel’s and Ercilia’s dream is to purchase a plot of land and a car, that their business grows and they improve their home, and that their children have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel y Ercilia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Fe hace 4 meses, 8 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y como invertir el dinero.

Raquel es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos de 6, 3 años, Raquel vende carne de pollo, al inicio repartía a las tiendas con la ayuda de su esposo, actualmente solo reparte menudencias de pollo, porque su esposo esta de viaje y no tiene quien la apoye. Además Raquel vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Ercilia es soltera, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos de 7, 1 años, Ercilia vende comida en el mercado MiraF.. Además Ercilia en los meses de vacaciones viaja a la selva ayacuchana a trabajar como cocinera. También en sus ratos libres lava ropa ajena.

Raquel y Ercilia necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de colonias, joyas, ollas, platos y para mejorar su casa.

Los sueños de Raquel y Ercilia son comprar un terreno, carro, que su negocio crezca, mejorar su casa y que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of cologne, jewelry, pots, plates, and also in the improvement of their homes.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nen N., a 58-year-old widow, makes about $4 as a seamstress from her home in Kork Chrobok Village, Phnom Penh City. N. has one married daughter, whose her husband is a security guard in a garment factory.

N. requests a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle so her son-in-law can commute to work more easily.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle so her son-in-law can commute to work more easily.

loans.name: Martha Eloisa

texts.es:
Martha is married and has four children ages 38, 35, 33 and 29. She started her business in order to help pay the family expenses as they frequently had money problems. She began six years ago by undertaking the sale of cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, and today she buys in bulk and sells much more.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid over 6 months, in order to remodel her store and be able to show more merchandise. By showing more merchandise, she will be able to get more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es casada y tiene 4 hijos 38, 35, 33, y 29 años. Inició el negocio para solventar los gastos familiares pues las carencias económicas eran muchas. Comenzó hace seis años, emprendió la venta de cosméticos y perfumería por catalogo, hoy ya compra por paquetes y vende mucho mas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses, para poder remodelar el local y poder exhibir más mercancía pues compro para exhibir y de ahí saco mis pedidos.

loans.use: Remodel store

loans.name: Nutepe Group

texts.fr:
The NUTEPE group was created in 2006 in Lomé’s Agoè neighborhood. It specializes in small businesses. It has three dynamic members who are working to improve their living conditions through money-making initiatives and the creation of income-generating businesses. This group has had one previous loan through WAGES and diligently repaid it. This second loan the group is requesting will enable it to buy 12 pieces of mid-quality pagne (colorful African cloth) and 9 bags of charcoal. The group’s treasurer does not wish to be part of this loan cycle but will remain in the group to undertake any tasks required of her as treasurer.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le groupement NUTEPE est crée en 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il est spécialisé dans le petit commerce. Il est composé de trois membres dynamiques qui œuvrent pour l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie à travers des initiatives porteuses de revenus et de création d’activités génératrices de revenus. Ce groupement a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement du crédit. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite leur permettra d’acheter 12 pièces de pagne de qualité intermédiaire et 9 sacs de charbons de bois. Pour ce cycle de crédit la trésorière ne souhaite plus en prendre mais demeure toujours dans le groupement pour exercer les tâches qui lui incombent en tant de que trésorière.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (African cloth) and charcoal

loans.name: Dung

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Dung is 42 years old. She has 4 children, and 3 are of school age. Her family sells bamboo for a living. She and her husband usually buy the bamboo wholesale and resell them to the local community. Because they live near the river, the family business has done very well. In 2008 she joined TYM fund to borrow money for additional investment in the business to increase their income. She is asking for a loan of 300USD. Her average income is approximately 180USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Dung năm nay 42 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 3 người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Gia đình chị làm nghề buôn bán nứa. Anh chị thường đi mua nứa từ các đại lý về bán lẻ cho người dân địa phương Do sống ở gần sông nên công việc của gia đình gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Năm 2008 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay thêm vốn đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập của gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 5.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ashura's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Ashura is a married woman with 4 children, aged 13, 9, 6 and 1. She is an oil seller. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 9.30 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Ashura now hopes for a loan to buy more oil for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling porridge, fish, and snacks.

loans.use: To purchase oil for resale

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Mr. Sarim S., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sarem Khim, 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. In addition to their children, the couple also has one sister who is a silk weaver and their elderly mother living with them.

Mr. Sarim has been selling cows for eight years. His wife has been raising pigs for three years. Besides selling cows and raising pigs, the couple also farms. Sarim is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise; to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice; and also to buy silk materials for his sister's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise, buy supplies for growing rice, and buy silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladys Q. D. L. C. is a member of the community bank, Virgén D. Cocharcas at FINCA Perú. Gladys, a widow living in Ayacucho with her three children aged 21, 19 and 4, sells vegetables at a local market to support her family and herself.

The loan that she has requested will cover the purchase of lettuce, tomatoes, eggplant, mushrooms, carrots and cabbage. With the income and savings she gains from her business she hopes to ensure that her children continue their educations and become professionals. She also would love to own her own house and her own store where she could sell her vegetables and perhaps increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase lettuce, tomatoes, eggplant, mushrooms, carrots and cabbage.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Señor Luis O.,  de 41 años de edad, vive acompañado con la Sra. Apolinaria Candia, viven en casa propia y  tienen 2 hijos menores en edad escolar.nEl tiene montado un copetín ya hace mas de 3 años, con la venta de comidas frías, tales como empanadas, milanesas, sándwiches y bebidas en  general, cuentas con clientelas bien formadas, ya que el copetín  esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico y bien poblado de la ciudad, gracias a su esfuerzo, y con el ingresos de sus ventas, pueden solventar los gastos de la casa, el estudios de sus hijos y así  elevar su nivel de vida económica.nEl  préstamo solicitado es para la compra de carne, pan, verduras etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis O., 41 years old, lives with Mrs. Apolinaria Candia. They live in their own house and have two young school-aged children. Three years ago he built a deli selling cold meals such as pies, milanesas (breaded meat fillets), sandwiches and drinks in general. He counts on his loyal customers, his shop's strategic location and a well-populated city for his success. Thanks to his hard work and the income from his business they are able to afford their household expenses, their children's studies and improve their economic standing. The loan request is to purchase meat, bread, vegetables and other such items.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram A. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Previously, Mukaram's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as a traffic cop didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her children. This was the reason that Mukaram decided to start her own business four years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by allowing her clients to pay in installments she's seeing her orders get bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering her household so that her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) that she will pay back in four months. With this money, Mukaram will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses and grow her business. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fabrics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Hakiba

texts.en:
Hakiba has a small business selling office supplies at the Farovon market in Gafurov, Tajikistan. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers. Hakiba has been in business for about 18 years. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Currently Hakiba has requested a loan of $600 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for supporting her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Kubra Rasheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kubra baji is a 27 year old married lady who has resided in a city named Arifwala, Paksitan, for the past 7 years. Her husband, R. A., runs a Punjabi food business, with 10 years experience. He has a good reputation in the community. She has two daughters. Both of her daughters help her in her clothes sewing business. Kubra baji taught them to sew clothes and now they are independent at sewing. She is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, flour and spices) to expand the Punjabi food selling business of her husband. 

She is a group leader of some other women of her locality. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to resell. Saleem baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy food items for a Punjabi food business

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis L. operates a passenger tricycle in their village, while his wife Sherill is working as a high school teacher. They do not have children since they just get married. As a husband, Dennis does not want to depend on the income of his wife, this is the reason why he keeps on striving hard to help his wife in their household expenses and save something for their future children.

Dennis would like to engage in the hog-raising business. For this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that he can use to purchase at least three piglets to start the new business. He is planning to use his income from his tricycle operation to buy feeds for his piglets. Dennis is hoping that his income from his tricycle will increase and his plan for his hog-raising business will succeed and generate additional income. Dennis is working hard and tries to be patient to overcome the obstacles in the business for him to become successful.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets

loans.name: Colaboradores 3 Group

texts.en:
Colaboradores 3 is made up of five people trying to receive their third loan with Kiva's partner, Esperanza International. Each member has already started their very own small business, and has started to experience some sort of success.

This group is from an extremely poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic, and most have lived in this area their entire lives. Before receiving their first loans, each member was having a hard time providing for their families, let alone themselves. Hopefully this next loan will enable each member to increase the size of their small business, and to improve their standard of living.

Dilcia G. is the representative of this group, and was more than happy to talk to us about her situation and life. Dilcia lives with her husband and her six young children (all under the age of 17). Each day has been a struggle for Dilcia and her husband to feed her six children, and also make sure they are getting to school. She knows that going to school and receiving an education is the only way for her children to break the cycle of poverty, and for that reason she does whatever she can to get them to school.

Before receiving her first loan, Dilcia was not bringing in an income, and just relied on her husband's job. She felt useless, and felt that she was not an important piece of the family. Dilcia took out her first loan and started a small business making and selling food in her area. Since she is an excellent cook and a hard worker, her business did well and she was able to pay back all her loans and save some money.

Now she is going on her third loan, and hopes with this next loan she can expand her business even more. She said she finally feels like a contributer to the family, and feels like she is going to be able to provide her children with everything they could need! She is so happy about having her own small business, and is excited for the future for the first time in her life.

She wants to thank everyone for the help they have provided her! Thanks for all your support and for enabling people like Dilcia to change their future!

loans.use: To buy more products for her food stand

loans.name: Abduvakhob

texts.ru: Абдувахоб занимается двумя видами деятельности – куплей продажей сухофруктов по базарным дням и по будним дням занимается частным извозом на своей машине. Ему 32 года, женат, двое детей. Жена нигде не работает, помогает мужу в его бизнесе – она сортирует сухофрукты дома. Прибыль Абдувахоба от купли продажи сухофруктов составляет в среднем 20 -30 процентов от вложенного и достигает максимума, если сухофрукты отсортированы. Абдувахоб подал заявку на займ и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abduvakhob works two jobs: buying and selling dried fruit on market days and, on week days, making deliveries in his car. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. His wife does not work, but she helps her husband with his business. She sorts dried fruit at home. Abduvakhob’s profit on buying and selling dried fruit averages 20-30 percent on his investment and is maximized when the fruit is sorted. Abduvakhob has applied for a loan and is going to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 hairdryers and hair extensions

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Danaya de l’association Gnogondeme sont  en majorité  des mariées (une seule veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe, le premier s’est  dénoué sans aucune difficulté. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habits  pour enfants, du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe, des beignets et des savons.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent, acheter 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants, 60 sacs de charbon de bois, 250 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni),  2 sacs de 100 kg de mil et une vingtaine de kg de beurre de karité (pour faire les beignets). Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille (en épargne) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The six women of the Danaya group of the Gnogondeme association are for the most part married (one is widowed) and are on average 41 years old with 4 children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Ouayerma, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their clientele and are on their second group loan, with the first repaid with no problems. They run diverse businesses, including selling children’s clothes, charcoal, firewood, donuts, and soaps. With this new loan, they plan to buy a vanload of firewood, two dozen children’s outfits, 60 bags of charcoal, 250 pieces of traditional soaps (farakourouni), 2 bags of 100 kg of millet, and about 20 kg of shea butter (for making donuts). They stock up at the big market in Sikasso and neighboring cities. The products are sold in different markets in Sikasso and in the neighborhoods to a clientele composed of men and women and mostly for cash. They foresee earning on average 17,500 CFA francs each per month of which a portion will be used to take care of the family (in the form of savings) and another portion will be invested in the businesses. The women of the Danaya group aspire to increase their sales in order to better satisfy their clientele.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy misc. items

loans.name: Eger Oswaldo

texts.es: El señor Eger Oswaldo M. tiene 31 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Hialeah con dos hijos que su esposa dio, ambos jóvenes estudian, el es cocinero de un restaurante desde hace tres años, anteriormente era mesero con su buen comportamiento lo ascendieron en la cocina. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y reparación del techo de su vivienda, da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzado que han sido de muchos beneficios para su familia. Sus planes es poder llegar hacer supervisor del restaurante para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eger Oswaldo M. is 31 years old and married. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and has two children with his wife. His two children are in school. He has been a cook in a restaurant for three years. Before, he was a waiter, but because of his good performance he was promoted to work in the kitchen. He is in his fourth cycle with Afodenic. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to build a room in his house and repair the roof. He thanks Afodenic for helping him achieve goals that have benefitted his family a lot. His plan is to be able to move up to become supervisor of the restaurant and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room and repair the roof

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Shafee Group

texts.en:
"My name is Razia and I come from a city named Lahore, Pakistan and have lived here for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. I am an independent lady; I operate my own clothes-sewing business and earn income. I save my income in a "committee" and I have plans to renovate my house with the committee amount when it's my turn to receive it.

My husband's name is M. S. and he runs an electric shop in the community. He sells electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) to his customers. I am applying for a loan to buy electrical supplies to expand my husband’s electrical supplies business."

Razia is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Bano baji wants a loan to buy repair tools for her vehicle repair business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her meat-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Maria O. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya estan graduados de la educacion secundaria, 2 de ellos trabajan y le ayudan con algunos gastos del hogar, la hija de ella estudia psicologia en la universidad nacional autonoma de Honduras.
Maria se separo de su esposo hace 20 años atras dejandola sola con sus hijos, pero ella nos comento que gracias a Dios logro salir adelante sola y poder darles estudio, alimentacion y hogar.
luego a ella la despidieron de su trabajo y decicio poner su propio negocio para poder pagar los estudios de su hija menor.
ella en este momento necesita comprar mas mercaderia para abastecer su negocio, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria O. is 40 years old, a single mother, and has three children who have already graduated from high school. Two of the children work and help out with household expenses. The other daughter is studying psychology at the national university of Honduras. Maria separated from her husband 20 years ago leaving her alone with the children, but thanks to God she succeeded to continue moving forward in life independently and provide for school, food, and the household. Later, she left her job and decided to start her own business to be able to pay for the studies of her youngest daughter. Now she needs to purchase more merchandise to supply her business, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, coffee, bread, cookies, drinks, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Wedelyn

texts.en:
Wedelyn L. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Wedelyn is married to Janero Ramboo L. and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wedelyn operates a family member's scrap buying business in the local community. Wedelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Wedelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wedelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wedelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her pig and poultry business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 31-year-old single man living with his family. He has been working in the flooring sector since 1999. Today, Ali is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools for his work to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: buy new tools for his work

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Mr. Chheun V., age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Mom, age 37, have been married since 1995. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. His mother also lives with the family. Their home is approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chheun and his wife have been farming for 12 years. They sell their products to a middleman who comes to buy at their house. Chheun doesn’t have enough capital for farming, so he is requesting a loan of $300 to help his farming business.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Chorro Para Arriba Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chorro para arriba es originario del barrio Roberto Lara, que está ubicado frente al centro de la ciudad de Nindiri, divididos por la carretera principal que lleva de Managua a Masaya.

La coordinadora del grupo es doña Alejandra G. de 45 años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración de Bolis y Gelatinas (Refresco congelado embolsados en forma de rollo o rectángulo). Que distribuyen en las diferentes pulperías del departamento.

Alejandra trabaja con el apoyo de sus dos hijos mayores y su esposo quien es el que aprendió el oficio de unos amigos que le enseñaron el proceso de elaboración.  Trabajan según temporada, “Ésta es la temporada de mayor venta y por eso invertiremos en mayor cantidad” nos dice Alejandra.

Miriam R. vende golosinas y productos perecederos en las afueras de la Zona Franca ubicada en la carretera a Tipitapa; Sonia al igual que Miriam vende productos perecederos en la Zona Franca y Juana F. vende tortillas y comida en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Compra de Materia Prima

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling bread and phaste and is requesting a loan to open up a backery.  Roda is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel at the nearby market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a backery

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a la venta de fosforos y curitas (banditas)por mayor, ella distribuye estos productos en diferentes ferias y farmacias de la ciudad de El Alto y la ciudad de La Paz, el trabajo de la señora Julia es sacrificado por que ella tiene que caminar todos los dias  para realizar la distribucion de sus productos, ella actualmente esta tratando de obtener un puesto fijo en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, para no caminar tanto como lo hace ahora,  su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad  en  las diferentes ferias, la señora tiene un medio dia de descanso en la semana que es el dia domingo que lo dedica a pasar un momento en familia, el destino del credito es la compra de curitas por cajas.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a wholesale vendor of matches and bandages. She sells her products at different fairs and to pharmacies in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. The job requires much sacrifice because Julia has to walk all day in order to make her sales. At the moment, she is trying to obtain a permanent location at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto so that she doesn’t have to walk as much. Her husband engages in the same business, but travels to different fairs. Julia dedicates a half day on Sunday to rest and spend time with her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bandages by the case.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bandages

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia C. lives in Negros Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has one child, who is 25 years old. Because of her strong determination to help her husband improve their living conditions, she saved their family from penury at a very critical point in it its past.

Many years ago, Delia and her family lived a comfortable life. In addition to the stable salary that she and her husband earned from working at the biggest sugar mill in the island, Delia also owned and managed a restaurant that catered to and was patronized by the employees in the sugar mill. Then, because of many factors, including a sugar crisis and other economic downturns, the sugar mill closed down and let the majority of its employees go. Delia lost her business as a result.

Fortunately, severance pay from the company allowed Delia to start a small general store, from which she earned her daily income. With her hard work and diligence, Delia was able to recover from their financial downturn and in 2002, joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access additional capital. With help from this organization, her business continues to grow, and now earns a monthly profit which is a big help in defraying their household expenses.

Delia has taken out and repaid a dozen loans from NWTF-PD. She plans to use this new loan to keep her general store well stocked at all times and continue to earn a good income for her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her general store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. raises fruits and vegetables on her small farm and then sells them. The fruits bring her more income than the vegetables. Estrella is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables and some supplies that she needs for her vegetable farm. She hopes that her loan will be approved so she can maintain and improve her business.

Estrella is 55 years old. She is married to Jose, who is a barangay (village) policeman in Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela, where their family lives. Estrella and her husband have four children. Two of them are in school, one in elementary and one in high school. Her two other children have already finish their studies. She hopes that her children will find a good future some day.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fruit and vegetable farm

loans.name: Ronadel's Group

texts.en:
Ronadel R. is from the village of Tungel Baggao, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Ronadel is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ronadel is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronadel owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Ronadel has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ronadel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ronadel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the products offered

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan”, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos. No pudo concluir sus estudios primarios.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años y su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para incrementar su capital y comprar más productos.
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà cereales como: tunta, chuño, habas y cebada.
Su deseo para el futuro es que todos sus hijos tengan su casa propia.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 45, is a member of the "San Juan" communal bank. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno department. She is a single mother of 7 children. She never finished elementary school. She is a cereals merchant. She has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy merchandise. She now needs 2000 new soles to buy tunta (freeze-dried white potato), chuño (freeze-dried potato), broad beans and barley. Her dream for the future is that all her children have their own homes. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tunta (free-dried white potato), chuño (freeze-dried potato), broad beans, barley.

loans.name: Salvith

texts.es:
Salvith, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, está separada.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene una bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Salvith forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Corazones”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de repuestos de motocarro.
Ahora ella necesita 800 soles que será invertido en su bodega, comprará varios productos de primera necesidad. La meta de Salvith es tener una tienda bien surtida y seguir trabajando para Salir adelante.
texts.en:
Salvith, 38, is a dynamic woman who lives in the Manantay district, Ucayali region. She has three, minor children and is separated. She sells basic needs items in a small grocery store she has set up in her home. Salvith has been a member of the "Los Corazones" communal bank for 8 months. Her first, 500 sol, loan was used to buy vehicle replacement parts. She now needs 800 soles to invest in stock items for her store. Salvith's goal is to have a sell-stocked store and to continue to work to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Sanjaadorj

texts.en:
Sanjaadorj, 34, lives with his wife and four children in Zavkhan province, in western Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent.  Their oldest two daughters, 10 and 12, are secondary school students.  His wife babysits their two infants. 

He operates a wooden product making business. He produces wooden items used in ger construction and traditional ger furniture.  He makes all of the parts of a ger in under three months and sells each ger for between 2,500,000-3,500,000 tugrugs (1760-2460 USD). His business is very popular and his customer base includes people from inside and outside his province. 

Sanjaadorj started his business in 1990 and has made much progress over the years. He is a savvy businessman and always looks for ways to improve his operations. He says, "I began to build a house for my family and hope to finish it in near future."  Sanjaadorj is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: Purchase wood and materials.

loans.name: Nory Edith

texts.es:
Nory R. G. tiene 44 años, vive en el municipio de San Jacinto Bolívar, con su esposo que realiza labores del campo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 20 y 17 años, su trabajo es  producir hamacas y bolsos, oficio que heredó de su mamá y lo realiza desde la edad de los 12 años, pues terminó su bachillerato haciendo hamacas de día y estudiando en horario nocturno.  En la actualidad Nory tiene un taller donde trabajan ella, su madre y su cuñada, las cuales  se dedican al tejido de estos productos artesanales hecho en telar de madera donde se realiza la traba de la hilaza y luego el tejido. Su mercado se encuentra en su misma localidad, pero algunas veces  envía  sus productos a la ciudad de Cartagena.  
Desde su ingreso al programa de grupos solidarios Nory ha recibido 5 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en montos que oscilan desde $100.000, con el que inició hasta el que ahora requiere por valor de $ 1.500.000 que usará para comprar hilazas para elaborar  hamacas y bolsos. Todos sus créditos han sido cancelados oportunamente y le han servido para complementar el sostenimiento de su hogar pues gracias a los ingresos de ella y de su esposo, su entorno familiar ha mejorado y tienen casa propia.
Su meta es ayudar que sus dos hijos terminen en la universidad las carreras tanto de Química como de Farmacia y Medicina. Sus desafíos más notorios hacen referencia a  los grandes esfuerzos  creativos que debe hacer  épocas en que bajan las ventas  pues ella siempre le inventa un nuevo producto o un nuevo diseño que le da valor e impulsa la comercialización.
texts.en:
Nory R. G., 44, lives in San Jacinto Bolívar with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children, who are 20 and 17 years old. She manufactures hammocks and bags. She inherited these skills from her mother and she has done this kind of work since she was 12 years old. She finished high-school at night because she would spend days making hammocks and bags. Currently, Nory has a workshop where she, her mother and her sister-in-law work. They weave these artesanal items on a wood loom where the thread is hooked and woven. Her customers are in her same town but she sometimes sends her items to Cartagena. Since her incorporation into the communal bank, Nory has received 5 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in amounts that vary from $100.000 that she began with to the one she is requesting now for $1.500.000, which she will use to buy cordage to make her hammocks and bags. She has repaid all her previous loans on time. She has used them to add to her family income. Thanks to her and her husband's earnings, the living conditions of her family have improved; they own their own home now. Her goal is to see that her sons finish their college education in Chemistry, Pharmacy and Medicine. Her most notable challenge is the great effort entailed in calling upon all her creative energy to create new and attractive designs for her products in order to ride out times of lowered sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cord to make hammocks and bags.

loans.name: Fiel

texts.en:
Fiel T. is from the village of Baybay Liloy. She is 24 years old. Fiel is married. To make a living, Fiel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of rice in the local community. Fiel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fiel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fiel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to for the retail store. Fiel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used in the retail store. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fiel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital to purchase bags of rice

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es: Carlos Martin tiene 37años, por lo que este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita, ya que las experiencias que he tenido le han sido de mucho provecho  por lo que su actividad económica es brindar los servicios de alquiler de molino. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicio por cuenta propia, en estos momentos es un hombre que se preocupa por cumplir sus funciones como padre y esposo al cuidado de sus hijos. Es por ese motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la proporcionarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino ya que es muy solicitado por sus clientes que llegan a moler maíz, carne, pinol y pozol. Su mayor deseo obtener otro medio de ingreso para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Martin is 37 years old, and thus this is not the first loan he has applied for, since the experiences he has had have been of much benefit. His business is offering the use of a mill for hire. He began this business more than 7 years ago, on his own initiative. At this time he is a man who worries about fulfilling his duties as a father and husband for the care of his children. For this reason he is applying for this loan for working capital to provide the necessary maintenance of his mill, since it is requested by his customers who arrive to grind corn, meat, grains, and pozol. His greatest desire is to obtain another means of income to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouma est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux dans le village de Sido, préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’améliorer leur capacité d’achat enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe,  et tous les six précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau  prêt elles comptent acheter, 700kg de fonio, 1tonne de petit mil et 500kg de maïs. Les produits sont achetés dans le marché de Sido et environnants pour être  revendus ensuite en détail ou au comptant aux grossistes de Bougouni. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA par mois qui sera réutilisé dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Dembagnouma is composed of married women who average 32 years of age and four children each.  The women live in nuclear families with their children and husbands in the village of Sido, Prefecture of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through business. Intending to improve their purchasing capacity, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, the women decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do commerce in grains.  They are now on their seventh group loan.  The previous six loans were all properly repaid.  With this new loan, they intend to buy 700 kg of fonio (a local grain), a tonne of pearl millet, and 500 kg of corn.  The goods are purchased at the Sido market and from surrounding areas and are then sold, cash or credit accepted, to the wholesalers of Bougouni.  Their customer base is composed of men and women.  With this loan, the women hope to obtain a profit of 40,000 francs per month that will be reused in their work. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly T. N. is 26 years old. She lives in the village of N. Xa. She is married and has three children. She grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. Her family also has a mechanic shop. She and her husband usually work with each other. They have a monthly income of about 4,300,000 VND. Ly is the leader of a six–member group loan. Ly joined SEDA in 2009, and since joining she has re-payed all of her loans on time. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy iron for her shop.

About the other members in the group:

  • Binh T. N. is 34 years old. She is a carpenter and wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood.
  • Lan T. N. is 55 years old, and she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to breed pigs and chickens.
  • Thuy T. N. is 31 years old, and she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to breed pigs as well.
  • Lan T. D. is 27 years old, and she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy wood.
  • Chanh T. N. is 28 years old, and she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To buy iron.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia N. sells bread and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell.  Fozia is 31 years-old and is married with a husband that is a farmer. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nakinyuguzi 2 Namale Prossy Group

texts.en: Prossy N.  is a twenty-two year old hardworking businesswoman. She is single and owns a beauty salon which she has been running for one year. She will use the her loan funds to purchase hair chemicals like relaxers, shampoo, gel, and other hair products of quality for her customers. Prossy is an ambitious businesswoman whose dream is to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase quality hair products for her customers.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 20 years old, is single, and has a 1-year-old child. Jenelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jenelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
