Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es separada, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, para ello posee terrenos de cultivo, asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales, donde diariamente sale al campo para que pasten sus ovejas y vacas que posee. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su hija en donde la apoya en la venta de animales, también en la venta de los productos que cosecha, como es el cado: de papa y  maíz.  Pero el trabajo en el que más se intensifica es la crianza de animales, puesto que le genera más rentas. Por tal motivo seguirá  trabajando, con el fin de incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP y asegura será muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más animales para aumentar la cantidad que tiene ensu establo.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a hard-working woman. She’s separated and lives with her daughter in her own home. She has been a farmer for over 30 years. She owns farmlands and also raises animals. She goes out daily to take her sheep and cows to pasture. Usually, her daughter helps her where animal and crop (potato and corn) sales are concerned. However, it’s the raising of animals that she stresses because this is where profits are higher. This is why she intends to continue working to increase her herd size. This is her 14th loan with MFP and she assures that she will be very responsible with her repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy more animals in order to increase her herd size.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy: corn, propane gas, wood, lime, pork, cheese

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet has been enjoying spending the profits from her fish-selling business. Because of this, she has able to sustain the needs of her four children and has been able to make their lives quite a bit improved. With that, Juliet is encouraged to work harder and aim further for her business and family because she has her own business to support their financial needs and loans she can access to support her business. Therefore, Juliet wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting another loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders for additional business capital. Juliet wants to buy more fish to sell and attract more clients.

Her long-term goals are to have a successful fish-selling business, funding the college education of her four siblings and supporting her family financially.  With the support of Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor. Juliet’s wish to give her children a better life fuels her commitment to her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and attract more clients

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGUEYE est créé depuis plus de 12 ans. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA.

Astou S. en troisième position à partir de la droite sur la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 07 enfants et tutrice de deux autres enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus et de vaisselles. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus d’une décennie. 

Son crédit lui permet d’acheter plus de pièces de tissus et des vaisselles pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire 
Elle a pu à partir de ses bénéfices acheter une parcelle à titre d’habitation et son objectif à long terme est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggueye solidarity group was created over 12 years ago. It consists of eight women from the same village. They came together through personal affinities and as neighbours. The group is part of the Sanghe Douka “Banc Villageois” loan association. Astou S. –the group leader- is third from the right in the picture and is portrayed in the medallion. She is 55 years old, married, the mother of seven children and tutor of two other children. She has been running a small business retailing clothing fabric and tableware for over a decade. Her credit loan enabled her to buy more pieces of fabric and tableware to increase her turnover. Her earnings enabled her to buy a plot of land where she intends to build a home in the long term.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUy clothing fabric and tableware

loans.name: Kibyamirizi Tukole, Mubende Group

texts.en:
T. Norah is a hard working and an ever optimistic 55 year old married mother of 6 children, aged between 28 and 12 years. She operates a growing produce business in Kibyamirizi Trading Centre, Mubende, dealing in buying and selling of cereals like maize, beans, millet and more. 
With a business experience of 15 years, Norah has managed to significantly sustain and improve on her family’s welfare status through paying the school fees for her children and general family welfare. To all appearances, her future business prospects look promising with close to 212,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly out of her business. She envisions an even greater profit margin as she gets this loan, being in position to buy more stock for the business. This will enable her to expand business, educate her children and also be able to earn more revenue and live a self sustaining life.

loans.use: purchase more stock of food produce for the business

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila, de 53 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Walter de 52 años y su querida hija Pamela de 16 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Priscila es el cultivo de arvejas, espinacas y zanahoria, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Walter, who is 52 years old, and her dear daughter Pamela, 16. They are the reason for all her efforts. Priscila grows peas, spinach and carrots for a living. This she does with her husband who also works very hard to earn an income for their family. For convenience sake she brings her products to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. It is here that she can obtain the best price. What she likes most about her job is protecting her crops from the pests that can threaten her production. She has been doing this for 30 years and considers transporting her products the most difficult since the trip is long and exhausting. In time, she hopes to buy mO. land to increase her crop production and increase her income with the sales. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her communal bank where she is well-liked. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy mO. fertilizer to increase her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en: Fallah T., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United We Stand. He is 48 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of 30 and 16. He was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 20 years, he has sold door locks, hinges, cutlasses, knives, nails etc. in West point Market, down town Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 27,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 72,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to increase his inventory. He describes himself as a determine man whose dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 36 years old and a mother of two.  She runs Joy Medical Clinic to earn a living.  The business is located in a very competitive and crowded area with most of her customers being low-income earners.  She was previously employed before she went into her own business.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy syrups.  She hopes to own rental houses in the future.  In five years, she wants to own the business premises instead of renting them.

loans.use: To buy syrups

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem N. is a 50-year-old married man, who resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. N. and his wife are farmers. Their three children are employed at factories, where they earn an income of approximately $4 per day to help cover the family's living expenses.

Kem explains that he has to spend $50 on food and $16 on other necessary living expenses every month. Kem is now requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a cow to raise for its offspring. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits generated as a result of the requested loan to repair his family's house.

loans.use: To improve his standard of living by purchasing a cow

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with one child and lives in his own house. John has been dealing in already-made clothes, a business which he has been operating for the last 10 years. He believes that it will grow in the near future. John intends to use the loan to purchase shirts, trousers and shoes for selling in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers and shoes for selling in his shop.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 20 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en El Jicaro.

Escogio esta carrear porque tiene la influencia de sus padres, quienes se dedican al cultivo de Frijoles.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos. Es importante para compartir experiencia, ideas, conocimientos... etc.

Quiere terminar su carrera y tambien independizarse.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 20 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Jicaro.  He chose to study this career because of his parents' influence.  They grow beans.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  It is important to share experiences, ideas, and knowledge…etc.  

He wants to finish his career education and become independent.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Perlin

texts.en:
Perlin B. is from the town of Conat, Aloran. She is 30 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlin sells a variety of daily products in the local community.  Perlin has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Perlin joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlin is requesting her first loan, for 45000 PHP, to be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Samuel Kabutha

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last five years.  He is 26 years old, married to Ann Wanjiru and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Samuel hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina S. is from the village of Gango, city of Ozamiz. She is 52 years old, married and has three adult and two school-aged children. To make a living, Melina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Melina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Melina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan that Melina has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: David Gaudencio

texts.es:
David vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. David se dedica a la venta de bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, él y su esposa Lidia venden de forma ambulatoria en sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ellos trabajan con cinco empleados quienes atienden las carretas. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. David requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, miel y muchas cosas más.   

David pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
David lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  He sells special snacks called 'churros'.  He and his wife Lidia sell their products as itinerant street vendors from small carts which are adapted for this business.  They work with five employees who serve from the carts.  They have been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to their hard work.

David needs this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey and many other products.

David is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey, and many other products

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 50 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 51 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Sarita es el cultivo de zanahorias, papa y arveja, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el país de Bolivia, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y que su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará un jornalero para que le ayude a sembrar.
texts.en: Sarita, age 50, is a woman who has always worked very hard to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own home along with her husband, Hugo, age 51, and their 4 children, who are the motive for all her efforts. The work that Sarita does is the cultivation of carrots, potatoes and peas.  She carries out this work along with her husband, who also works arduously to offer a good education to their children.  She has found it convenient to carry her products to the country of Bolivia, since she states, that is where she obtains better profits.  What she likes most about her work is to protect her crops from the pests that can threaten their productivity.  She has carried out this activity for 16 years and considers the most difficult aspect of the work is to transport her products, since the road is very long and exhausting.  With time, she hopes that her cultivations will improve and that her sales can improve their economic circumstances.  This it is her eleventh loan with MFP.  She understands the obligation to make all her payments promptly, since she does not want to cause problems to the associates of her communal bank, where she is very well liked.  With the two thousand five hundred new soles she requests, she will buy more fertilizer for her cultivations and will hire a workman to help her to sow.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and to hire a workman to help her with the sowing.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: El Sr O.   labora como Higienista es Casado, es el Sextos crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  le ha dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales de construcción como  cemento, bloque, hierro y útiles escolares, y mano de obra  de su vivienda
texts.en: Mr. O. works as a janitor and he is married. This is the sixth loan that Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) has granted him. He is thankful for the support that this organization has provided him through this loan. He has purchased construction materials such as cement, construction blocks, steel, and school supplies, and he has also paid labor costs for the renovations to his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita A. is from the village of Lam-an, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Lolita is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, she owns and operates a cake baking business. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $160 a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Lolita joined PMPC under the Pension Loan Program to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 25,000 PHP.

Lolita is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock and ingredients for her cake baking business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayment and the education of her child.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and stock for cake baking

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en: Enosi is a 55-year-old businessman who operates a retail shop.  He also runs a cafeteria.  He started the store business twelve years ago.  He has been able to finance his business with loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has managed to see his children through school, thanks to Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to add to his stock of sugar, tea leaves, salt, soda, maize flour and bread.

loans.use: to add to his stock of sugar, tea leaves, salt, soda, maize flour and bread.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro  tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Vallecito, una localidad rural de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura que se encuentra a  más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Teodoro siembra arroz dos veces por año y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El ya cuenta con más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Teodoro desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo de arroz, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Teodoro es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 57 years old and married. He and his wife live with their three children in Vallecito, a rural community of humble and hardworking people. Vallecito is in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region more than four hours from Chiclayo city.

Teodoro lives on his farm. He harvests two seasons of rice each year and uses the income to support his family. Teodoro has farmed for more than ten years and is very experienced. He wants to buy fertilizer to insure a good rice yield this season, and for this reason he has requested a 2,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Teodoro is a family man and well respected by community members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old and is a married woman with three young children. She is a fish seller. Her husband is a fisherman. Irene sells his catch to the market. She also makes and sells dried fish. Irene earns about 2,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this business. She works hard to earn better and save for her cihldren’s future.

Irene’s loan will be used to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Kennedy Odhiambo

texts.en: Kennedy has been selling movie and music DVDS in Naivasha town for the past 10 years.  He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to add a new collection of music and movie CDs and DVDs. In the future, Kennedy hopes to expand his shop and stock more movies and music DVDS.

loans.use: To add a new collection of music and movie CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley grew up in a small village in Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. Now, she is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has three children. Her eldest child is 25 years old while her youngest child is 12. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 10 years now.

Aside from rice, she also raises swine to supplement their family income. Her average income for her businesses is PHP 10,000 per month.

Shirley needs a loan to support her livelihood. The loan will help her buy fertilizers and pig feed.

In the future, Shirley hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married and has six dependents. She sells gari and maize in both small and large quantities in Elmina. She has done this for 10 years. Victoria uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more bags of gari and maize to sell. With her expanded business, Victoria plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari and maize to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo trabaja como empleado de mantenimiento en un edificio además que realiza trabajos de instalación de radio en la compañía HANSA, además en el transcurso de la semana trabaja como voceador de minibús. El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de una computadora. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto, es soltero y tiene un hijo. Leonardo es cliente de IMPRO desde el año  2008.
texts.en:
Leonardo works as a janitor in a building.  He also carries out radio installations for the company HANSA.  In addition, during the week, he works as a minibus stop announcer.

Leonardo needs this loan to buy a computer.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in Rio Seco district, in the city of El Alto.  He is single and has one son.  Leonardo has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his personal use

loans.name: Cena

texts.en:
Cena is 59 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 4 children. She runs a food stall in her village and has been in this business for almost 5 years. She sells different kinds of dishes and cooked snacks. Her net income monthly is 5,000 PHP.  

Cena is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients to cook more food to sell. She hopes to continue to have access to loans and achieve her dreams for her children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: purchase raw ingredients to cook food for sale

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia tiene 45 años, es natural de Pancan distrito de Jauja y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en la venta de animales, específicamente de toros y vacas. Ella mantiene contacto con la mayoría de los ganaderos de su ciudad, ellos le venden los animales muy jóvenes y del que Mencia los alimenta y engorda para luego ofertarlos a mayor precio en la feria ganadera de su ciudad, durante los días miércoles y sábados. Su esposo siempre esta la apoya en estas tareas, pues es un negocio que le da rentabilidad y que requiere mucho esfuerzo. De manera paralela se dedica en  vender los productos que siembra, en este caso: papa, maíz y alfalfa. Considera que este negocio le ha traído grandes satisfacciones razón por la cual desea tener más terrenos de cultivo así como capital de trabajo. Es una de las socias fundadoras de su grupo solidario a la que siempre  ha dado sus esfuerzos, considera que su  tiempo de permanencia con MFP  en los créditos es beneficioso para el logro de sus objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de becerros y de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mencia is 45 years old and a native of Pancan in the Jauja district.  She lives with her husband and three children in a home of her own.  She has five years’ experience selling livestock, specifically bulls and cows.  She stays in touch with most of the livestock farmers in town, and they sell her young animals which Mencia fattens up and sells for a profit in the livestock fair in town on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  Her husband always supports her in these activities.  It’s a profitable business and it requires a lot of effort.  She also sells crops, in this case potatoes, corn, and alfalfa.  She believes that this business has brought her great satisfaction.  Because of this she wants to have more farmland and working capital.

She is one of the founding members of the group, to which she has always given her effort.  She considers her time and loans through MFP to be beneficial in reaching her objectives.  She will use the money she is requesting to buy calves and in this way increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 32 years old and married to David. They are blessed with three school-going children. She has been a vegetable vendor for two years and gets a monthly profit of about KES 7,000. She has been loaned KES 20,000 which she plans to use to purchase more vegetables for resale.

With the anticipated profit she plans to expand her business, and in the near future she hopes to set up a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Haja Sunna

texts.en:
Sunnah, age 56, is a rice vendor. She began her rice sales business because it was more profitable than her previous business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Sunnah earns about 1,000,000 LE a month. She and her husband have five grown children, ages 27, 30, 34, 37, and 40.
 
Sunnah requires a loan in order to buy more rice. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Sunnah plans to own a larger shop and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Huot is a resident of the Siem Riep Province. Agriculture is the main business activity that occurs in this area. Most of the residents of this region are both rice growers and livestock breeders. Huot is a pig raiser. She has been in this business for three years. From this business, she earns about $7 each day. She is married and has four children, three of them living with her and another child who has already married and lives in a separate house. 

To earn a living, Huot would like to request a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. She will use this loan to purchase piglets and feed. She said that this loan is very useful for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILAGROSA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pascuala. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, producción de sombreros, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, vendedor de productos delicia, tejido de enaguas.

La señora Pascuala, indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías (tejido de chompas) que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás aprendiendo el mismo en un centro de aprendizaje.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de Julio y que posteriormente lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The Milagrosa Communal Bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of its focus on the Andes.  It is made up of 9 members and it is led by a board of directors that is headed by Pascuala.  The communal bank members have many different businesses, such as knitting sweaters, making hats, selling clothing, running corner stores, selling Delicia brand products, and knitting skirts.

Pascuala has worked for Pro Mujer for two years and she joined the institution because she was invited to by a friend.  She currently has a handicrafts business knitting sweaters that she has been working at for five years.  She learned how to run this business at a training center.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her working capital to buy wool that she will get at the Festival of La Paz on July 16 and that she will later sell on request.  This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married with seven children.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the training area.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en:
Crispus is a married man with five children, four boys and one girl. His wife is a businesswoman operating a vegetable stall business which contributes to the family's source of livelihood. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year he has operated a plumbing business. He operates from home where his neighbours and passersby are the potential customers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other plumbers in the area. He dreams of establishing a vegetable stall business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase stock for his wife’s business, sacks of vegetables from greengrocers in the area. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables from greengrocers in the area

loans.name: Amancia Isabel

texts.es:
Amancia de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que quiere incrementar en su negocio.

Con el préstamo anterior ha podido iniciar su negocio, con la ayuda de Dios ella quiere  solicitar un nuevo préstamo para agrandar y surtir su negocio.

El sueño de es incrementar en su negocio y abrir nuevos locales de farmacia en otros sectores de la urbe.

El fin de ella es que sus hijos tengan un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Amancia is a 55 year working woman who wants to increase her business. With her last loan she was able to begin her business. 

With the help of God, she is asking for a new loan in order to enlarge her business and supply it. 

Her dream is to grow her business and open new pharmacies in other areas of the city. All of this is for her children, so they will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy medicines to supply her pharmacy

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 65 años, es madre D. 4 hijos.
Paulina tiene una carpintería y empezó con muy poco capital, a medida que fue creciendo su negocio pudo comprar sus maquinarias, con Finca pudo ahorrar mas dinero y logró comprar mas maquinarias, se siente muy orgullosa D. pertenecer a la familia D. Finca y cada vez que tiene oportunidad comparte sus éxitos e invita a otras mujeres a ser socias D. Finca, con el préstamo que solicita comprará madera y triplay.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 65 years old and the mother of four children.

Paulina has a carpentry business and started out with very little capital. By growing her business, she was able to buy machines. FINCA helped her to save more money so that she could buy more machines. She is proud to be part of the FINCA family and takes every opportunity to share her successes and invite other women to become members of FINCA. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wood and particle board.

loans.use: to buy wood and particle board.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with 5 children. She was born on December 27, 1981. She is now 30 years old and resides in Tinotongan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a service-based business specialized in operating a motorcycle transport locally known as "habal-habal". 

To earn a living Alma provides a motorcycle transport services in the local community. Alma has had this business for more than 5 years and earns 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of activity.

Alma has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She has been a member of GDMPC for more than 3 years. She plan to buy another motorcycle for transport to earn more for the education of her children

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old, and is married with five children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. Her business is well organized, she sell eggs. Agnes has ten years of experience in this business and works from 6AM until 8PM every day.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more large quantities of eggs. With profits from this loan, Agnes will become wholesale, and pay medical insurance for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Reymundo

texts.es: Francisco casada, sus hijos estudiantes, trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo como guardia de seguridad un trabajo honesto,su esposa vende tiene venta de tortilla, nacatamales y otros productos siendo un ingreso mas al hogar, su planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado deteriorándose por completo, su objetivo preparar a sus hijos como profesionales así tendrá mejores oportunidades de trabajo en un futuro. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, láminas de zinc corrugado, perlines, golosos, bloques, entre otros para entechar la casa. Esta en mal estado y se le pasa toda el agua en tiempo de lluvia. Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad de este crédito el cual obtendrá grandes beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is married and his children are in school. He’s been working for some time for a private company as a guard. It’s honest work. His wife sells tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, and other products for income to be more at home. His plans are to improve the infrastructure of their home since it’s already in a poor state, deteriorating completely. His goal is to prepare his children to work as professions so that they may have better work opportunities in the future. The loan he’s asking for will be invested in the purchase of construction materials: cement, corrugated zinc sheets, purlins, bolts, blocks, etc. for roofing the house. It’s in poor condition and leaks water during the rainy season. He thanks the lenders for the opportunity of this loan which will be a great benefit to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Yasmin Eugenia

texts.es:
Yasmin es una joven emprendedora que a sus 25 años de edad se dedica a la venta de chance en las afueras de una tienda, venta de postres y de peluches que exhibe en la tienda en la que trabaja. 

Actualmente, necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de peluches para la temporada navideña y así obtener mayores ingresos con sus ventas y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a young entrepreneurial woman who at age 25 sells desserts and stuffed animals in the store where she works.

She needs this loan to buy stuffed animals in quantity for the Christmas season.  In this way she can increase her income with her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un negocio de panadería muy conocido por la localidad donde reside pues prepara el pan mas delicioso pastelitos, peperechas, quesadillas, entre otros, todo hecho con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, las personas que visitan el negocio siempre quedan satisfechas; Juana es una mujer dedicada al trabajo siempre está a activa y dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten, para ella el éxito es el premio del esfuerzo si se sigue siempre adelante te espera un mejor futuro y es con ese ánimo que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comparar materia prima como harina, azúcar, levadura, bandejas, etc. Juana tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana, who is 39 years old, lives with her life partner and their children. She has a bakery business well known in the area where she lives since she makes the most delicious bread, cakes, "peperechas," "quesadillas" among other items. Everything is made with the best quality ingredients and at accessible prices. The people who visit the business always are satisfied. Juana is a woman who is dedicated to work, always active and disposed to take advantage of all of the opportunities that present themselves. For her, success is the reward of effort, always ahead if you hope for a better future and it is with that courage that she decided to request from Integral a loan that allows her to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, trays, etc. Juana hope that, in this way, she will be able to provide economic security for her home and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast and trays.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is twenty-six years of age and is married with three children.

Lina owns & operates a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Lina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase materials ,painting,craft board for elei printing.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Lina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lina's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials, painting, craft board for elei printing

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.

Eligio has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Eligio became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Eligio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Dicipline Group

texts.en:
Tawiah is 45 years old, widow, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a kenkey and fried fish business in the localities of chorkor. which she has been doing for 10 years.

Tawiah requested a loan from ID-Ghana for which she will use to buy more ingredients such as maize, fish, tomatoes, pepper and other stuff for her trade. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

She represent the discipline group of two hardworking member with she inclusive,they promise to hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as maize, fish, tomatoes, pepper and other stuff for her trade.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana G. is 52 years old. She is married and has two sons who live in Varna now. Her husband is unemployed. Jana has a master degree in economics and has a long professional experience as an accountant. In 1995 she loses her job and starts her own accountant services business. Now she consults over 85 small and medium companies. This business is the only source of income for Jana and her family. Jana G. needs a 1600 loan to buy some new office furniture and a computer for her business.

loans.use: To buy some new office furniture and a computer

loans.name: Zamil

texts.en:
This 50-year-old man is a father of 2 children,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village.
He saved enough money to set up his own business. 
This money was not enough for improving this business and he decided to borrow $400 and so he bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
He has run his business for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Lalotoa

texts.en: Lalotoa has a history of using micro-loan facilities to make incremental upgrades to her small village store.  She has used two previous loans to make renovations and to finance an expansion in product line and inventories.  She is passionate about being a successful businesswoman, and she spends the bulk of her time operating and finding ways to improve her business.  She is now seeking a third loan that she will use to again increase her inventory, aiming to provide a consistent supply to the local villagers.

loans.use: Purchase food and merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Roque Alsacio

texts.en:
Roque G. lives in the city of Villa Elisa, Paraguay. He is 54 years old and works as a mechanic. He has an auto-body shop and a store at his house where he sells oil, gas and filters for particular vehicles.

He started working as a mechanic as a boy in various shops and finally opened his own shop in 1999. His business is thriving due to the fact that he is the only mechanic in his area. He is known for being a fair and competent mechanic in many parts of the city.

His wife, Juana Lopez, is 43 years old and works as a party decorator. They have two sons and two daughters, all of whom are currently in school. Their oldest son is studying business administration. One of their daughters is in her fourth year of studying child psychology. The other son is studying computer technology and their youngest daughter is enrolled in high school.

Roque wants to obtain a loan to buy 200 liters of oil and diesel in order to increase the quality and quantity of his services.

loans.use: To purchase oil and diesel for their auto body shop.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat S. sells food. She is married, has 3 children and a specialized secondary education. Her husband is in Russia earning money and her children are in school. She started her business 2 years ago because life was difficult. Karomat started borrowing through MicroInvest in 2006, back then her assets were worth $230. After multiple loans she increased her inventory. Today her assets are valued at $400.

Karomat plans to move into wholesale sales in the future. Her business partner is in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Каромат занимается продажей продуктов питания. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее специальное. Муж на заработках в России, дети учатся в школе. Начала свою деятельность 2года назад. Поскольку трудно стала жить. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала кредитоваться в 2006году, тогда её активы составляли 230$. После неоднократного кредитования она увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы составляют 400$. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу. На фото ее партнер по бизнессу.

loans.use: to switch to wholesale sales

loans.name: Sherifat

texts.en: Sherifat A. is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. She hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sherifat sells  cooked food and pure water and minerals. She needs the loan of $400 to buy a refrigerator for her minerals and pure water. She has been in business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy fridge to cool sachet water and minerals

loans.name: Tuaoitaua

texts.en: Tuaoitaua is from the village of Faleula. Tuaoitaua was attending the USP (University of the South Pacific) at Alafua, studying this area of planting and arranging flowers. This is her first loan from SBPD, and she is using this loan to upgrade her facilities to make sure that the work is carried out efficiency and productively. Tuaoitaua had been doing this business for years before she heard about SPBD loans. She is so grateful to be part of this program, and she is looking forward to continuing to earn income for more expansion and further improvement.

loans.use: To buy pots, black plastic bags, and tools for her florist business

loans.name: Maria Magda

texts.es:
Mrs Maria Magda lives in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. For 15 years she has been selling shoes in a shop at the central market.

Her story is quite impressive because she started as a street vendor selling “chinelas” (typical sandals) that she would carry around inside a big sack.

This was a very tough job because of the weight she would have to carry around everyday and because she had to work constantly exposed to the sun.

Eventually, she decided to take care of her health and invest in a shop at the central market. She was able to reach her objective through the credits she got from Ceprodel (27 in total) that she invested very wisely.

Nowadays she is very proud of what she has accomplished; nevertheless she knows that she needs to invest on more merchandise as there is a lot of competition in the market. Her wish is to have a large supply of articles and to continue to invest in the infrastructure of her shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Magda es una dama que reside en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde hace largos 15 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de zapatos en un local en el mercado Central. Su historia es muy impresionante debido a que comenzó su negocio primeramente vendiendo chinelas ambulantemente en un saco que cargaba todos los días, sin embargo, a pesar de lo dificultoso de este trabajo por el peso y exposición al sol, decide invertir en un local en el mercado de León y así evitarse molestias en su salud. Esto lo realizó gracias a créditos hechos en Ceprodel (27 créditos) que los ha invertido muy sabiamente.

Hoy en día se siente muy contenta por lo que ha logrado, sin embargo cursa una gran necesidad como lo es el invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que no es la única que se dedica al negocio sino que a su alrededor hay varias personas que se dedican a esto y por tal razón atraviesa una fuerte competencia. Su anhelo es surtir mas su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en infraestructura.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and to continue to invest in the infrastructure of her shoe store

loans.name: Sun Ang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Ang (pictured on the left) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. The group includes two families who live across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. S. Ang, 41, and her husband have been married since 1986.They have three children—one son and two daughters. Ang sells grilled sweet potatoes in the village. Her husband is a fisherman and also grows rice. She is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA for $150. She plans to use this money to help her husband's rice growing farm.

2- Mr. P. Chandara, 36, and his wife have been married since 1991 and have two sons. He runs a motor taxi business and his wife stays at home to take care of their children. He is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA for $150. He plans to use this money to repair his house.

loans.use: For growing rice and repairing house

loans.name: Duo Fatima Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Elvira is married and is 55 years old. She has two children who attend middle school at a public school. Her husband helps with the household expenses. He is a bricklayer, plumber, and electrician, even though he does not have a stable job; he constantly travels to the Yungas.

They own a house, three rooms and a small living room, dining room, bathroom, and kitchen, with basic services of electricity, drinking water, and sewerage. Their home is located in an urban neighborhood called Santa Rosa GranD. in the zone of Villa Fatima. They have a small capital, and this is why she requires a loan to increase her working capital.

Mrs. Vicky is 49 years of age, separated, and lives alone with her son who attends college and who sometimes helps her with the housework at the boarding house. Her only income is that which is generated by this business, which is located in the main avenue of an affluent commercial zone. Her home is located in the boarding house, and with this activity she supports her son through his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Elvira es casada tiene 55 años D. edad, con dos hijos que están en secundaria en colegio estatal. El esposo le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa es albañil, plomero y electricista, aunque no cuenta con estabilidad laboral; viaja constantemente a los Yungas.

Cuenta con vivienda propia, tres habitaciones, una pequeña salita, comedor baño y cocina, y los servicios básicos D. luz, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en un barrio urbano llamado Santa Rosa GranD. en la zona D. Villa Fátima, tiene un pequeño capital y es por eso que requiere crédito para incremento D. su capital D. trabajo.

La sra. Vicky, tiene 49 años D. edad, es separada, vive sola con su hijo universitario que algunas veces le ayuda con los quehaceres D. la pensión, el único ingreso que tiene es el que le genera ese negocio el cual está ubicado en la avenida principal D. una zona comercial D. gran afluencia, se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, y con esta actividad costea los estudios D. su hijo.

loans.use: Buying rice, pasta, potato, oil in large quantities (COMPRA DE ARROZ, FIDEO, PAPA, ACEITE POR CANTIDAD)

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married and has two children who are in school. She has been selling roasted groundnuts and maize for the past five years. Every two weeks, she travels to the northern part of Ghana to purchase the nuts and the maize.

Salamatu wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of maize and groundnuts to reduce her frequent travels to the north and also to avoid price hikes during the lean season.

She a member of the group called Baa Meyi. The group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Salamatu carrying her roasted groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and maize.

loans.name: Srey Mich Yoth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mich Y. is the group leader of five members in Prey Taing Thnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and she can generate a small amount of rice revenues because Mrs. Srey Mich Y. has a small cultivatable land. Mrs. Srey Mich Y. now would like to expand her plantation.

Mrs. Srey Mich Y. has decided to request a loan so that she can buy a piece of rice field to cultivate her rice during the rainy season. Mrs. Srey Mich Y. is a widow with one child who is too young to work or study. In November last year, her child got a lung disease. In order to fight this battle, she had to spend an unforeseen number of expenses.

loans.use: To obtain a loan to buy a plot of field to cultivate her rice during the rainy season.

loans.name: Mussabe

texts.ru:
Mussabe T. is a 40 year old woman with 3 children. Her husband works in Russia. Mussabe has been selling for 15 years. At first she sold at the market and her inventory was small. She slowly increased her inventory and rented a part of a store. Now she decided to take out a loan and to further increase her inventory. She plans to travel in order to purchase an assortment of children’s clothing for sale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тохирова Мусабе женщина в возросте 40 лет замужем имеет3 детей, муж работает в России, сама уже 15 лет как торгует.Сначало она сидела на базаре , оборот её был не большой , постепенно она увеличила и взяла в аренду отдел магазина.Теперь она решила взяв кредит увеличить свой оборот.Поехав за товаром привезти летний ассортимент детской одежды.

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Lien

texts.vi:
Ms. Lien is 56 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1998. Her husband unfortunately died at an early age; therefore, she had to work very hard to raise her children. In 1998 she joined TYM fund and her first loan was 30USD. With this loan, she invested in raising pigs. With the additional loans after that, she always invested in her pig farm and taking care of her children to make sure they were able to go to school. After 10 years, her family's income has become increasingly more stable. Her 3 children were able to finish school, are now grown and have their own family. In addition to her income from raising pigs, she receives assistance from her children. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to purchase buffaloes to raise and to help with her agriculture business. Her income is 150 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Liên năm nay 56 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Chồng chị không may mất sớm vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi các con khôn lớn. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vốn vòng đầu là 500.000đ. Với mức vốn này chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Các vòng vốn sau chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và cho con cái ăn học. Đến nay qua 10 năm cố gắng kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định, chị đã nuôi được các con khôn lớn, 3 người con của chị đã trưởng thành và lập gia đình. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ từ các con. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua trâu về nuôi và phục vụ cho sản xuất nông nghiệp Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi ("Together we are strong") is a group of seven women from the first district of the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso, Republic of Mali). The group members average 37 years of age, are married, and are mothers with at least five children each. They all live in traditional polygamous families with their parents-in-law, co-spouses, children, their husbands, and brothers and sisters.

Linked by ties of profession, blood, and marriage, these women do dye work (learned from parents practicing this work) and commerce in beauty products, dried smoked fish, etc.

Concerned about increasing the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. They have already benefited from nine loans, and each of the preceding ones was correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy 5 boxes of beauty products (from Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers, some baskets of smoked and dried fish (from Korientzé, a fishing village in Mopti Prefecture), and a sizeable quantity of ingredients for dye work (on location at the grand marketplace of the city of Koutiala) from stall-keepers selling at the market.

These women of the Benkadi Group are very enterprising and known for the quality of their work. Their goods are sold retail, cash and often credit accepted, in the districts of the city of Koutiala. The goods are sold door-to-door and in the marketplaces of neighboring villages, to a customer base made up essentially of caterers, retailers, and women.

They intend to realize an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover the loan interest, to address family expenses, and to invest the rest in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Benkadi est un regroupement de sept femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso république du Mali) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants chacune. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames traditionnelles avec les beaux parents, des coépouses, les enfants, leurs maris et des frères et soeurs.

Liées par des relations professionnelles, de parenté et de mariage, ces femmes font de la teinture (apprise auprès de parents exerçant cette activité) et le commerce des produits de beauté, des poissons fumés séchés etc.

Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Elles ont bénéficié déjà de neuf prêts et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 cartons de produits de beauté (de Bamako capitale de la république du Mali, auprès des grossistes), des paniers de poissons fumés et séchés (à partir de Korientzé une localité piscicole de la préfecture de Mopti) et une quantité importante d’ingrédients pour la teinture (sur place au grand marché de la ville de Koutiala auprès des forains fréquentant les foires).

Très entreprenantes et réputées pour la qualité de leurs activités, les produits de ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont vendus au comptant en détail souvant à crédit dans les quartiers la ville de Koutiala de façon ambulante et les marchés des villages voisins à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de restaurateurs, de revendeurs et de femmes.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA. qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, faire face aux charges de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, fish, and basic ingredients for dye work

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., 42, is a widowed grocery vendor and resides with her elderly mother and her younger brother in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She typically makes around US$5 of profit each day and is aided by two daughters who work as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh.

Selling groceries has been a difficult business, as there are many competitors and high inflation which makes prices skyrocket. She is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to add her grocery’s inventory. This will satisfy her and allow her to attract many buyers as well. In the future, she wants to open a tailor shop for her daughters. She does not want her children to work away from their home town.

loans.use: To add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong O., 40, is married and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh. She is a chef in a restaurant, making around US$6 each day. Her husband has a business of raising ducks for eggs, and normally he sells the eggs to the market and can generate about US$4 of income each day. Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia and many Cambodians have faced economic struggles. Yong O. has approached CREDIT for a loan to purchase more ducks for her husband to breed. She feels that this will be a sustainable investment that will keep profits high and generate more income for her family. (Husband is pictured with the ducks.)

loans.use: To raise more ducks.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: hola mi nomnbre es Maria Manzanares me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, tengo 27 años y estoy casada, mi esposo trabaja como albañil, con el hemos procreado 4 hijos los que estan en edad escolar y mantenemos los dos juntos.ntengo dos años de experiencia en la venta de tortillas, las cuales solo las vendo por encargo lo que hace que tenga muy buena clientela y tenga mi producto vendido todo el tiempo, estoy ubicada en el barrio Buenos Aires.nen estos momentos necesito el credito ya que necesito comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de mis tortillas pero todo ha aumentado de precio y ahora es mas dificil comprar las cosas, tambien necesito cambiar los utencilios en donde tengo mi produccion de tortillas ya que estan viejos y me dan problemas para hacer mi producto.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Manzanares. I make and sell tortillas. I'm 27 years old and I'm married. My husband is a builder. We have 4 children who are currently going to school and together we take care of them. I have 2 years experience in selling tortillas which I only sell through special requests from all my clients. I sell them right away. I live in the barrio called Buenos Aires. I'm requesting a loan at this time because I need to purchase basic ingredients in order to make tortillas. Prices have gone up and now it's more difficult to buy these things, and I would also like to change the pots/pans that I use since they are very old and don't work very well.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase logs, corn, water and matches

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., a 36-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are students, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2007. Her family’s main businesses of raising pigs and selling eggs are doing well and yielding them a stable income.  Nguyen is now requesting a loan to invest in her businesses.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ansatou

texts.fr: Ansatou B. est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans, mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son capital d’embouche bovine. Elle souhaite acheter un bœuf,  l’élever afin de le revendre à un meilleur prix. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Ansatou B. is a married woman. She's 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. With this loan, she wants to buy an ox, in order to raise it and to resell it for a better price. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an ox, in order to raise it and to resell it

loans.name: Sanumaiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanumaiya K. is a tailor in the town of  Balkhu. She opened her tailoring shop 10 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which is very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs. K. took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

She has one son and three daughters, who are all studying. Her husband, Mr. Rati Ram K., works in an office.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work.

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely C. vive en Soyapando dentro del departamento de San Salvador.  Desde hace ya 5 años  Delmy es madre de dos niños menores de edad, que reciben educación primaria. Delmy  se dedica a su pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de belleza AVON. Tras no poder pagar un local en una zona de actividad económica, Delmy sale día a día de su casa para recorrer calles y vender ambulantemente de casa en casa.Con perseverancia y optimismo Delmy encuentra las fuerzas para levantarse cada mañana. Ahora Delmy solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y extender la gama de mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes,  pues considera necesario innovar en sus productos y ofrecer siempre novedades para mantener sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely C. lives in Soyapando in the region of San Salvador. For 5 years, Delmy has been mother to 2 young children, who are at primary school. Delmy has a small business consisting of the sale of Avon Beauty Products. After not being able to pay for a location in the economically active zone, Delmy leaves her house every day to travel around the streets and make mobile sales house to house. With perserverance and optimism, Delmy finds the strength to get up each day. Delmy is seeking a loan to buy new products and extend the range of products that she offers her clients, because she considers it necessary to be innovative with her products and always offer new things to maintain satisfied clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon beauty products and perfumes

loans.name: Jairo Joel

texts.en:
Jairo Joel R., the 30-year-old married father of a five-year old son, has been running a discount retail store for over ten years, having risen during that time from being a simple market vendor of goods to the owner of his own shop. Through the help of other loans with Fundación León 2000, Jairo Joel has been able to build a consistent clientele, increase his monthly revenue, and thereby improve his family’s life.

Jairo Joel is asking for a Kiva loan in order to increase both his inventory of discount goods and the breadth of his contact with potential clients. He dreams of opening a larger shop with a much greater variety of products, and believes he can accomplish this goal with the assistance of Kiva lenders. Jairo Joel is asking you to support a loan of C$4,600, to be paid back over the course of eight months.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in his shop.

loans.name: Jessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jessenia Z. se dedica a laborar en su propio negocio de ferretería teniendo su tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario lo atiende.

Ha logrado salir adelante y así apoyar a sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares ya que es una madre soltera y por tanto hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. La razón por la cual espera el crédito es para la compra de los productos ferreteros para ofertarlos y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessenia Z. has a hardware business in a stall in the Mercado Mayoreo market of the city of Managua where she serves customers daily. She has managed to build her business and in this way support her two small school-aged children as she is a single mother and must take on the role of both father and mother. The reason she is hoping for this loan is to buy hardware goods in order to resell them and keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to retail in her hardware store

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana María O. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soletera. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es la venta de leña y gaseosa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio por la necesidad que ella enfrentaba con sus hijos y Doña Juana no poseía un trabajo estable para y decidió comenzar en su propia vivienda. Los propósitos de Juana son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que la situación en el país esta muy difícil. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima ya que se aproxima el invierno y necesita realizar la compra de leña y gaseosa. El sueño de Juana es de poseer una pulpería para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana María O. is 41 years old and single. Doña Juana has 2 children who study. She sells firewood and pops for a living. She has been doing this for more than 8 years, and she began in order to meet the needs of her children, she did not have a stable job and decided to start her business at home. Juana's goal is to move ahead with her business as the situation in her country is very difficult. The loan will be used as work capital to buy raw material as winter is close and she needs to buy firewood and pops. It is Juana´s dream to own a general store in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: El comercio informal es la actividad principal a la que se dedica la  asociación “Cielo Azul”, venden ropa, material de escritorio, cosméticos, zapatos, comida, otras son costureras, también ofrecen servicio de café. Trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer, en el centro focal Villa Adela hace más de cuatro años con mucha responsabilidad. Ellas realizan sus ventas de manera ambulante y también algunas en puestos, desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan adquirir mayor cantidad de productos. Tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The association “Cielo Azul’ is primarily involved in informal commerce. They sell clothes, office supplies, shoes, and food. Others are seamstresses; some sell coffee. For more than four years they have responsibly worked with Pro-Mujer in the main center of Villa Adela. Some are street venders and others have stalls. They want to increase their sales. To do this, they need to get a larger quantity of products. They are sure they will be able to get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Need to buy products.

loans.name: Antonia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 5 hijos.  
Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida  Jr. Zepita S/n,  ella tiene estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de productos de la región (papas, chuño, ocas), así como también frutas.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles; este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de productos de la zona (como papa, chuño, ocas, habas) para luego venderlos en el  Mercado 15 de Agosto. Quiere seguir trabajando para construir su casa ya que nos indica que ya adquirió el terreno.
 
La señora Antonia Cristina  nos cuenta que está contenta ya que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the "Yunga Uyo" communal bank in the district of Yunguyo, Chicuito province, in the department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She lives in the Alto Florida neighborhood, on Jr. Zepeta S/n and she has completed her primary school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 5 years. She buys and sells regional products (potatoes, chuño-a freeze-dried potato product, and oca) as well as fruits. Her first loan was for S/ 300.00 new soles. She would now like an additonal loan for S/. 800.00 new soles. This loan will help her to buy a variety of local products (like potato, chuño, oca and fava beans) to be later sold at the 15 de Agosto market. She would like to keep working so she can build a house and says that she has already bought the land. Antonia Cristina says she is pleased because she likes the meetings of her communal bank and most of all the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, dried potatoes, ocas and fava beans.

loans.name: Savri

texts.en:
K. Savri is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't stable, so sometimes debts accumulate. To help her husband, Savri decided to start her own business, designing and making traditional dresses for women. She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned.

Now, she has a small workshop in her house. The good service and fine quality she offers have made her business grow into a small company. Savri wants a loan of 500 USD to buy seasonal fabrics so she can fill her customers' orders. The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for this family. Savri sincerely thanks you for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing traditional dresses

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en:
Benedictor A. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Benedictor uses all her income in supporting her husband in footing all the housekeeping expenses.

Benedictor sells clothes, leather bags and some other African batik bags in Hohoe. She will use the loan to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Benedictor plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell
