loans.name: Bénédicte

texts.fr: A. Bénédicte est née le 16 Mars 1983 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin.  Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant.  Bénédicte habite à Cotonou avec sa famille.  Son activité commercial est la vente des fruits saisonniers et des condiments.  C'est pour la première fois qu'elle désire de contracter un prêt d'Alidé. Elle voudrait se procurer un prêt pour acheter en quantité très suffisante des avocats, des condiments, des cartons de biscuits. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux renforcer son activité en vue d'augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
A. Bénédicte was born on March 16, 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of one child. Bénédicte lives in Cotonou with her family. Her commercial business involves selling seasonal fruit and condiments. For the first time, she would like to take on a loan from Alidé. She would like to acquire a loan to buy sufficient quantities of avocados, condiments, and boxes of cookies. This loan will enable her to bolster her business more, with the aim of increasing her turnover.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of avocados, cookies in boxes, and condiments

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en:
Jethro H. is from the municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Jethro is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jethro owns and operates a sari-sari store (a general store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice retail in the local community. Jethro has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jethro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jethro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Jethro is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Lucia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia raises livestock, mainly pigs. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mrs. Sarong Chhon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who are all living in Andoung village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Sarong C. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan indifferent purposes. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Aside from this business, she is also a pig breeding. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Khorn, is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sarong C. is 52 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are woodworkers. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Cuenca está ubicada al sur del país, es una ciudad muy bonita por su arquitectura medieval, además es la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, su clima es frio pero se suple con el calor de su gente amable y educada.

La Sra. María Lucrecia vive en un hermoso lugar de la Ciudad de Cuenca que es Totoracocha, forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, tiene 48 años de edad y se encuentra  felizmente casada, fruto de ese amor procreo 8 hijos de 26, 25, 22, 21, 17, 15, 14, 12 años de edad, el primero de sus hijos es casado y sus tres  hijos mayores trabajan y aportan un poco para los gastos de  la casa, mientras que los cuatro  menores estudian, dos de ellos en un colegio nocturno y sus dos hijas por la tarde en el colegio Ecuador, su esposo se encuentra postrado porque le dio una enfermedad  a causa del alcohol ya que bebía demasiado.

María Lucrecia es comerciante ambulante, vende gelatinas, lleva quince años trabajando en este negocio y nos comenta que le va bien, también tiene otro trabajo por las noches en una cafetería,  trabaja todos los días de la semana sin tener un solo día de descanso.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando junto a la fundación y le da mucho gusto ser parte del banco por todos los beneficios que la fundación les entrega.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en su negocio de gelatina para comprar envases desechables como: vasos, cucharas, sorbetes, etc.

Su sueño es tener su propia cafetería ya que tiene mucha experiencia y sabe cómo se maneja este negocio.
texts.en:
Cuenca is located in the south of the county. It is a pretty city with medieval architecture. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. It has a cold climate that is moderated by the warmth of its friendly and educated people Mrs. Maria lives in a beautiful place in Cuenca. It is called Totoracocha. She is a member of the community bank called “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women). She is 48 years old and is happily married. The fruits of their love are the eight children they have created. They are 26, 25, 22, 21, 17, 15, 14 and 12. The oldest child is married and the three oldest children work and and help with the household expenses. The four youngest children attend school. Two of them go to night school and two of them go to high school in the afternoon. Her husband is incapacitated because he became ill from drinking too much alcohol. This is her third cycle with the foundation. She is glad to be part of the bank because of all the benefits the foundation provides to her. With the loan that the “Foundation Espoir” will deliver she will invest in her candy business. She has worked in this business for fifteen years and it has worked out well for her. She also has another job working in a cafeteria at night. She works everyday of the week without having a day off. This is her third cycle working with the “Foundation Espoir”. She will use the money for her candy business to buy disposable items such as cups, spoons, sorbets, etc. Her dream is to have her own cafeteria because she has a lot of experience and she knows how to manage a business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy disposable items such as cups, spoons, sorbets, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married to Eugenio but their marriage has not been blessed with a child. They reside in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi-urban and plain area located along the national highway.

Marcelina is engaged in a sari-sari store (community based store) business in their village. Her weekly net income is PHP 1,000 and, with her desire to improve her business, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that she can use as capital for business growth.

Marcelina said that "happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction."

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda G. is from the village of Country Hill, Iligan City. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Luzminda plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Youth For Truth Group

texts.en:
Tarweh G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Youth for Truth. He is 27 years old and married with a 7-year-old child in kindergarten.
Tarweh is a high school graduate and trying to enroll in the University of Liberia. 
He and his family live and work on the battle field in West Point, a community that is full of poor Liberians. The crime rate is very high there and it is close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
Tarweh’s business is tailoring. He buys fabric from wholesalers, sews nice designs and sells to residents of West Point. He has been running this business for about eight years. He learned tailoring in his youth and decided to take tailoring as his career.
Tarweh is hoping to become a bigger designer and have a large boutique in the future. Tarweh sews well, has new designs and talks to his customers in a good manner of approach in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.
He needs this loan to purchase more fabric to sew more clothes for the Christmas season.
Tarweh dreams of giving his children a better education and good medical attention when needed.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to sew more clothes

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a resident of Sto. Domingo Luna, Isabela and she has been engaged in the hog raising business for five years.  She is 53 years old and is married to Rogelio, a farmer.  They are blessed with four children, three of whom are already married. 

Editha is thankful that her business is doing well.  However, she still needs additional capital amounting to PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders.  She plans to use the loan to further improve her business and purchase enough feed supply for their growth.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase feed

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary T., 41, has been growing and selling flowers and longan for more than 5 years. Her husband Mr. Kunthea Un, 44, has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for more than 8 years. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have two sons. Their eldest son is a full-time employee in Phnom Penh and the younger son attends school.

Currently, Kunthea's business is suffering as his motorbike is old and does not work well. Thus, Sothery is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help her husband purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one and also to buy longan under contract for resale.

Mrs. Sotheary T. and Mr. Kunthea Un are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and longan for resale

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raul se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su local ubicado en el 4to anillo, donde atiende todos los dias y además tiene su Rockola, su esposa le ayuda en las noches cuando sale del trabajo mientras que sus hijos se quedan en casa al cuidado de su tia. Ellos trabajan arduamente para poder darles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y poder comprar una casa para vivir independientemente ya que ahora viven en casa de un familiar. Ellos necesitan el prestamo para aumentar capital y comprar sillas y mesas que le estan haciendo falta. Ellos son clientes antiguos en la institucion y son muy responsables.
texts.en:
Mr. Raul works selling beverages in his business on 4th Avenue where he serves his customers every day. He also has his Rockola jukebox. His wife helps him in the evenings when she leaves her work, the children staying home where an aunt cares for them. Raul and his wife work hard to provide their children with better living conditions and to be able to buy a house where they can live independently, since they now live in the home of a relative. They need the loan to increase their capital and to buy chairs and tables that they need. They have been clients of the institution for a long time and are very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia B. is from the barangay or village of Solinog located in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old. She is married and blessed with three adult-aged children. She gets a small income from dealing NATASHA products (apparel, beauty products, etc) to the local community but this is not enough for her to be self-sustaining or to help support her husband and family. In fact, her main source of income comes primarily from her pension, which is in the amount of P7,500 monthly. In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to the programs and services of the Co-op. She requested her second loan in the amount of P30,000, which will be used to purchase housing materials so she can repair and renovate her house, as seen in the picture above. 
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For housing materials

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en: Ariel M.'s main source of income comes from operating a motorcycle to transport passengers in his area. He is a 30-year-old married man from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Ariel has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ariel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to repair a transport vehicle. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his fourth loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yadira Liceth

texts.es:
la señora Yadira Liceth A. tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tienen tres hijos, su esposo se dedica al comercio y Yadira se dedica a la venta de pescados, sus padres le enseñaron el negocio desde muy pequeña, esta a sido la actividad que ellos han realizado por siempre.
 
yadira trabaja desde muy corta edad tiene su propio negocio y le va muy bien esta solicitando el credito para surtir de pescado seco ya que se aproxima la epoca de semana santa.
en semana santa la venta de pescado es muy grande.
texts.en:
Yadira Liceth A. is 32 years old, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and Yadira sells fish. Her parents taught her the fish business at a very young age, as they had always done it themselves. Yadira has been working since she was very little and has her own store. It's going very well and she is seeking a loan to increase her stock of fish in preparation for Easter season. During Easter season, fish sales rise dramatically.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine M. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Elaine is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. Elaine owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling "Balut & Pinoy" (a variety of Filipino egg specialties) in the local community. Elaine has been involved in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Elaine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elaine is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye M. est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et responsable de la garde de 5 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par ses proches et parents. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi et a 7 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de poissons frais et de crème glacée. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye M. is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children. She also takes care of five other children entrusted to her by friends and family. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for three and a half years and obtained seven successive loans in the past. She runs a small business selling fresh fish and ice cream. Her goal is to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a 25-year-old woman and a single mother of one child who is four years old. She looks after a family of four people and they live in a rented house. She operates a bar business in Hoima, Uganda and has been in the business for four years. She says she encounters challenges of bad debtors but still says the business has been able to sustain her and her family. She dreams of having a bar on the main street of the town where there are many clients. She intends to buy alcohol and drinks for selling in the bar and paying school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy alcohol and drinks to sell and to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Juan Luis tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos pequeños los cuales dependen de él, actualmente la familia vive en una vivienda pagando alquiler. Juan Luis se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el área de la construcción, es maestro albañil. Juan Luis se dedica a estas actividades hace mucho tiempo atrás porque tiene bastante experiencia y es muy requerido por las personas que conocen su trabajo. El nivel de competencia para Juan Luis es alto, ya que existen muchas personas que se dedican  a estas actividades, pero la demanda por dichos servicios es alta también. Juan Luis destinó el crédito para comprar una máquina mezcladora, este artefacto le ayudará a ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El presente crédito es el cuarto crédito individual al que accede Juan Luis. Por otra parte Juan Luis no presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero ni en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Juan Luis, 40, is single and has two children that depend on him; they live in a rented house. Juan Luis works in construction, he is a master bricklayer. He has been in this line of work for a long time and, because he has a great deal of experience, is sought-after by people who know his work. Competition for Juan Luis is high because many people are in this same occupation but demand is also high. Juan Luis earmarked the loan to buy a cement mixer which will make it possible for him to offer better service to his customers. This loan is his 4th individual loan. Juan Luis has no negative marks anywhere in the financial system or with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Know Yourself Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Know Yourself Group. She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 32 years old. Jacqueline was only able to attend school through elementary school because of lack of financial support.

For more than fifteen years, Jacqueline has been selling dry goods such as textiles and sundries at the G. Town Market, near Monrovia, Liberia. She says she talks to her customers in a friendly manner which keeps them returning.

Jacqueline plans to use her 26,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 89,600 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. Her dream is to open a shop.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jacqueline is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods.

loans.name: Livistone

texts.en: Livistone is a married man with three children.  He offers motorbike transport to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  He is a member of NRBI Lussaco group, and he saves his money with them on weekly basis.  This savings has helped him invest in his business.  His group members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes 30,000. With this loan, he plans to buy spare parts for his motorbike.  He hopes to own several motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 49 years-old and married to Wilfredo.  They have three 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Madelyn owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Madelyn joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Madelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase pigs to raise. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda, D.  58 años, vive con el menor D. sus 7 hijos en su casa que es  propia.DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas del campo, y en la actualidad comercializa ganado ovino que ella misma y su hijo  llevan a pastear al campo y también les brindan el cuidado necesario  en su establo. La manera D. trabajar D. Casilda es la siguiente, adquiere becerros, los alimenta, hasta que  obtienen un buen peso, y luego los venD.  en su mercado local.  Además cultiva papa y maíz, principalmente venD. a los mayoristas D. la ciudad.  Para ella es mucho más rentable la venta D. animales, que el cultivo, por lo que ha decidido incrementar la cantidad D. animales que tiene en la actualidad.Es la oportunidad número 14 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Casilda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono y también en  la compra D. cantidad D. ovejas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Casilda, 58, lives with the youngest of her seven children in her own home. Since childhood she has labored in the various activities of the countrysiD., and currently sells sheep that she herself and her son take to graze in the countrysiD. as well as providing the necessary care in their stable. Casilda's work method is the following: she purchases lambs, feeds them until they have achieved a good weight, and then sells them in her local market. In addition she grows potatoes and corn which she mainly sells to wholesalers from the city. She has found it much more profitable to sell animals than cultivate crops, so she has decided to increase the number of animals she currently has. This is the 14th opportunity she has had to get a loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible in making her payments. She also thanks everyone who maD. the loan possible, as it will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Casilda plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of some bags of manure and also in the purchase of a number of sheep in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and sheep for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old, married, and has 2 infants. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fifth loan Melanie has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Sainte Therese Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE THÉRÈSE est créé 27 juin 2007. IL fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE de Thiès. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues de la même Paroisse que porte le nom du Banc Villageois (SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE). Les femmes ont organisé leur groupe par voisinage et par confession. Elles participent activement aux différentes activités de leur Paroisse. 

Madame Rose F., debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est également tutrice de 3 autres enfants.
 
Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend au marché du poisson frais, des légumes, du poisson séché, de l’huile de palme et de la pâte d’arachide. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en marchandises afin d’accroître ses bénéfices.

Elle a comme objectif de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à la dépense quotidienne. Et à long terme elle voudrait construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
The SAINTE THÉRÈSE solidarity group was created on June 27, 2007. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of the catholic women of SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE, in Thiès. It consists of 10 women, all from the same parish, which bears the same name as the Banc Villageois (Saint Jean Baptiste). They organized their group by neighborhood and faith. They are actively involved in the various activities of the parish. Mrs. Rose F., standing at the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is the head of the group. She is 49 years old, married and a mother to six children. She is also the guardian of three other children. She runs a small business selling fresh fish, vegetables, dried fish, palm oil and peanut paste at the market. Her new loan will allow her to acquire enough stocks to increase her profits. Her goal is to help pay for her children’s tuition and for daily expenses. In the long term, she would like to build a house for her family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, vegetables, dried fish, palm oil and peanut paste

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar D. est un informaticien de 39 ans qui habite à Yoff Ndenatte. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 12 ans. 
Monsieur D. était employé dans une entreprise de la place dans  un département de maintenance. C’est en 2002 qu’il s’est adonné au dépannage de matériel s informatiques. C’est une occupation qu’il a choisi par passion et aussi pour réaliser des bénéfices. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis décembre 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des claviers d’ordinateurs pour les besoins de son atelier multiservices  qu’il gère.
A partir de ce financement son vœux est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.. Il souhaite faire de ce multiservice une grande entreprise  dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar D. is a 39-year-old computer specialist who lives in Yoff Ndenatte. He is married and the father of three children, whose are between 6 and 12 years old. He used to be employed in the maintenance department of a local company. In 2002, he devoted all his time to repairing computer equipment. He chose this occupation out of passion and also to make a profit. Mr. D. has been an associate of the Yoff branch since December 2007. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of buying computer keyboards to serve the multi-service shop he manages. With this financing, his wish is to improve his family's living conditions. He would like to turn this multi-service into a big enterprise in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An investment

loans.name: Sidey

texts.es: Sidey Q. R., tiene la edad de 28 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar almacigo de café  para sembrarlo y aumentar la cantidad de café en producción a su beneficio y de terreno en uso. Además, su finca ya tiene una parte de café la cual quiere resembrar para mejorarla y a su vez sembrar una parte del terreno que se perdió por falta de mantenimiento en años atrás. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. También, ella no  ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Sidey Q. R., age 28, is married and has 2 children who are her highest priority. She wants to purchase coffee seeds to plant and increase her coffee production. On her farm, there is already an area seeded with coffee, which she wants to re-seed in order to improve it. She also wants to sow an area of land that she lost for lack of maintenance a few years ago. She has been a farmer for several years and she wants to expand. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had problems with her property, but she wants to have a productive farm. Also, she has not received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She also wants to offer her children the necessary education so that in the future they will be prepared and more able to handle life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: coffee planting

loans.name: United Pettie Traders Group

texts.en:
Taywa M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Pettie Traders'.  She is 30 years old, married, and has two children,  9 and 12 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling electrical materials in Clara Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 75,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more electrical materials. 

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue her education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Isaac is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma  D. C. is a widow who lives in Purok MMY Village, Bgry. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses:  she sells fish and fattens pigs. Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 14000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4800, improving her family's standard of living.  This time, for her eleventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her fish vending business.  She will use the additional income to continue to save up for future home repairs. Thelma D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Nelio

texts.en:
Nelio P. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City (pictured is his wife, Mrs. P., because Nelio went to Manila for a job to obtain additional income for his family). He is 34 years old. Nelio is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables, such as string beans and eggplant, to sell. Nelio has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP per month for these activities. Nelio and his wife help each other in their vegetable gardens. 

In 2010, Nelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Nelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Nelio is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nelio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 38-year-old man who is married with three children. He lives in his own family house in Fort Portal Uganda and his family dream is to have his children educated. He deals with metal fabric, which has enabled him to maintain a minimal standard of living. However, William has the challenge of limited capital and this has affected his household income. William needs the loan to purchase an angle line to ease his metal fabrication business work.

loans.use: To purchase an angle line to ease his metal fabrication business work.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma R. is from the village of Bago. She is 37 years old, married with four school-aged children. Delma owns and operates a food stall and her main source of income is from selling a variety of food products in her local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Delma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Delma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Lesther Antonio

texts.es:
O., vive en Juigalpa con su esposa Mirna G. Centeno quien le ayuda en los gastos familiares, tienen tres hijos de 2, 4 y ocho añitos; Lesther es Conductor, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para los gastos familiares y sus obligaciones de pago. 

Solicita un credito para mejorar su Vivienda que poco a poco ha venido Construyendo  y se siente muy agradecido con la atencion brindada por nuestra parte.  

Su mayor Sueño es llegar a construir toda su vivienda con mejores comodidades para que su Familia goce de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mr. O. lives in Juigalpa with his wife, Mirna González Centeno, who helps him with family expenses.  They have three children who are 2, 4 and 8 years of age.  Lesther is a driver and earns good monthly income for family expenses and to repay loans.

He is asking for a loan to make some home improvements to the house he’s been building little by little.  He feels very grateful for the attention we’ve given him.

His greatest dream is to complete his house with all the comforts so that his family will enjoy a dignified home.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
This is Angie G., 42, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime G., a jail officer of the local penitentiary, and mother of three children, all of whom are still enrolled in elementary. By the grace of God, Angie has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Angie, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Angie operates an Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. What she basically does is to buy electronic cellular phone load in huge amounts then retail it to the customer. Profit is generated depending on the network's policy of dealership. She may buy 3,000 PHP worth of load for 2,500 PHP, where she already has a 500 PHP profit, depending on promos and quota set by the networks. Angie is also currently readying a few pigs for slaughter and operating a buy-and-sell business with a variety of products.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products to be incorporated into her buy-and-sell inventory. She will also invest some of the loan to buy electronic load from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Angie hopes to be able to give her all her children a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products for her buy-and-sell inventory and buy electronic load from different local networks

loans.name: Not

texts.en: Mrs. Not K. is married to Mr. Yorn Yorng and they live in Thmei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice which she sells to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband is a palm juice collector who earns money from selling palm sugar at the local market. Her breeding is going well so she would like to expand. For this purpose, Mrs. Not K. is asking for a loan to buy five more piglets. The rest of the loan she plans to add to her savings to start a new business by buying a cow for breeding. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and two of whom are students.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets.

loans.name: Gulzyina's Group

texts.en:
Gulzyina K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 55 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and three daughters. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are employed. Two older daughters are married and live separately with their families.  Gulzyina used to work at the meat processing and packing factory. But then she started her own business, and started to sell fruits and vegetables on the market. In this way she earns 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, Gulzyina wants to see her youngest daughter get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Phum's Group

texts.en:
These four people are forming a group loan; they are located in Lekh Bei village in Kandal province.  While each member of this village will use their money to support their own different purpose. 

Mrs. Phum P. is 48 years old, and she is the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by its members.  She and her husband, Mr. Choup Choeun, are farmers who own a plot of land for growing green vegetables that they sell to support the family.  With this farm, they do not have enough money to farm it.  So Mrs. Phum P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her farming. 

They have four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her farming.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 34 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Leonarda nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora la artesanía. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambres y muchas cosas más. 
 
Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 34, has four children.  She lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.

Leonarda tells us that she sells crafts of the costume jewelry type.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes the crafts.  She’s been in this business for 8 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into the work.  On this occasion, Leonarda needs the loan to buy materials like wires, for example, and many other things.

Leonarda is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means; she also commits to repaying in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy materials, like wires, for example, and many other things.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano de 52 años, es un hombre trabajador que por 11 años ha trabajado en una empresa como Operativo. 

Dando esfuerzo a todo su día de trabajo desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Tienes muchas aspiraciones para seguir con su trabaja ya que tiene tres hijos y uno de ellos es niño especial. Para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y esposa él quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, zinc para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
52-year old Maximiliano is a hardworking man who for the last eleven years has worked as an operator in a business. His long day starts at 8am and finishes at 7pm. He has a great desire to continue in his work as he has three children, one of them a special needs child, to support.  

To provide them and his wife with a better life, he wishes to use the loan to buy cement, blocks, and zinc sheeting to make improvements to his house. Maximiliano’s wish for the future is to finish building his house.

loans.use: purchase of cement, blocks, and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha A. is from the Barangay of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with four children. Some are in school and others are now at their adult age. 

To make a living, she is engaged in aquaculture production, particularly in “guso” (seaweed) culture. She’s been engaged in this activity for 13 years already. She’s earning an average of not less than PHP 3,000 a month. 

In April 2007, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 Program, Editha has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 5,000. 

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as her fifth loan, which will be used for guso culture and production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, educating the children and possibly expanding guso production.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand guso culture and production

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a young woman from Hebron, married and the mother of one daughter and three sons. Raeda's husband is an employee with a decent salary.

Raeda bought home furniture, a bedroom for her four-year-old daughter, a kitchen table and chairs. Since her husband can't pay the price of the above-mentioned items at once, she took a loan from FATEN to pay the stores and pay FATEN on monthly basis.

Raeda's husband appears in the picture here instead of her since she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to pay for home furniture and kitchen set

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra Angélica es oriunda de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala, tiene  46 años, vive en  pareja hace 15 años, y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 15 años y otro de 13 en edad escolar.
La misma cuenta que su familia decidió venir  a Villa Elisa cuando ella tenia 20 años, que al principio fue bastante difícil ya que no tenia una profesión y por ente no podía conseguir un buen trabajo, entonces empezó trabajando en una casa de familia, luego trabajó en un local de negocios de juegos electrónicos, y más adelante conoció a una señora que le ayudó y le enseñó a coser en la máquina, fue así que aprendió la profesión de modista, la misma mujer le ayudó a comprar su primera máquina de coser.
Hoy día tiene muchos clientes, a quienes les confecciona las prendas.
Con los ingresos  obtenidos  pudo comprar para su terreno en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora, en donde está construyendo de a  poco su casa.
Con el crédito que solicita piensa crecer y afianzarse un poco más en cuanto a su profesión, comprarse de a poco otras máquinas y obtener materias primas.
texts.en:
Angélica is from the city of Eusebio Ayala. She is 46 years old and has lived with her spouse for 15 years. She has 2 children, one 15 and the other 13, both school aged. 

She relates that the family decided to come to Villa Elisa when she was 20 years old. at first it was very difficult since she had no profession and therefore wasn't able to get a good job. So she started working at a family's house, Later she worked at a business that sold electronic games. Later, she met a lady who helped and her and taught her to sew with a machine. That is how she learned to be a seamstress. The same woman helped her buy a sewing machine.   

Today she has a lot of customers for whom she makes clothing. With the income she obtained, she was able to buy a plot of land in the city of Fernando de la Mora, where she is building her house little by little. With the loan she is asking for she plans on financing her self a little better in her profession by buying more machines and getting raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric and thread and more sewing machines.

loans.name: Chanphorn

texts.en: Chanphorn P. is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  They live in a village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Chanphorn and her husband are farmers. They grow water spinach, eggplants, gourds, and mangoes on their farmland in the village. Chanphorn is requesting her first loan of $500, which she will use to purchase additional mango trees for planting.

loans.use: To purchase additional mango trees for planting.

loans.name: Bircakhan

texts.en: Bircakhan Mammadov is a hard-working, entrepreneur from Agsu city. Six years ago he decided to open his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Bircakhan has requested a loan of 1000 AZN so that he can purchase additional foods for his grocery. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making an ever-popular delicacy. Bircakhan is married and has two children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods for grocery.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old and married with three children. He is a maize farmer, which he has been doing for the past eight years. 

He knew KADET through a registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his third loan, which he planned to use to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs, including seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos de 11 y 1 año de edad, en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana del municipio de Soledad, escenario social apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su proceso de construcción de comunidades. Allí en un espacio de su vivienda tiene su propio negocio de vender mercancías y variedades en su miscelánea, experiencia construida desde que trabajó al lado de su cuñada en el comercio de calzado y una vez se independizó comenzó vendiendo muchos productos, como accesorios femeninos, pulsos, moños, ganchos, sandalias, y hasta dulces. Su clientela principal son mujeres que compran diariamente pero principalmente en fechas especiales como el día de las madres, día del padre, Halloween, carnavales, navidades etc. fechas en las cuales ocurre un repunte de sus ventas, que son principalmente a crédito aunque también vende de contado. Su negocio le genera ingreso con los que ayuda en la gestión de su hogar y por eso desea hacerlo crecer para aumentar el bienestar familiar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dulces, sandalias elaboradas por un familiar propietario de una microempresa y accesorios femeninos que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes rentables, lo cual augura que su rotación de mercancías sea rápida y que su inversión tenga éxito. Su sueño más adelante es tener su casa propia, para adecuar un local comercial separado del ámbito familiar, definiendo la jornada laboral y momentos saludables de buen descanso. Mientras esto ocurre Norma continua trabajando para responder a su mayor desafío que es su poco capital de trabajo y la competencia,  que muchas veces se torna intensa y ella  entonces debe acudir a su capacidad de servicio oportuno para sostenerse.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and their children aged 11 and 1, in the Ciudadela Metropolitana barrio in the municipality of Soledad, a social scene helped by the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo in the process of community construction. Here within the space of her living quarters, Norma has her own business, selling merchandise and a variety of miscellaneous goods. She created this business since working along side her sister-in-law in a shoe store. Once Norma became independent, she began selling many products, including feminine accessories, bracelets, hair fasteners, hair pins, sandals, and even sweets. Her principal clientèle is women who buy daily but principally on special dates like mothers day, fathers day, Halloween, carnivals, Christmas, etc., dates when sales surge. These sales are usually on credit, although she also sells for cash.

Norma's business generates income that helps with household expenses, and for that reason, she wants to make it grow to increase her family's well being. This “credikiva” is the first financing she has received through the Fundacion, and she will use it to buy sweets, sandals made by a familiar proprietor of a micro enterprise, and womens' accessories already ordered by her profitable customers. This indicates that merchandise rotation will be rapid and her investment will enjoy success.

Her dreams for the future include having her own house, providing a commercial site separate from family living quarters, and defining the working day to include healthy moments of rest. While this evolves, Norma will continue working to respond to her greatest challenge, which is her small working capital and the competition, which at times becomes intense, and she needs to increase her capacity for opportune service to sustain herself.

loans.use: buy sweets and sandals in larger volume to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Marlene

texts.es:
Yesenia, administra un negocio D. confección y creación D. artículos D. decoración, ella vive con su familia, lleva 10 años en el negocio, tiene ya mucha experiencia, por lo que se encuentra estable con un número D. clientes.
Actualmente ella necesita comprarse para el negocio, material plástico y tela decorativa, pega y otros materiales para hacer decoraciones y recuerdos, para realizar la inversión solicita  préstamo que le ayuD. a comprarse todo lo necesario para el negocio.
Para Yesenia su único objetivo es trabajar por su negocio, para que este no deje D. crecer, que por el contrario se vuelva cada día más fuerte y rentable.
texts.en:
Yesenia lives with her family and manages a decorative creations business which she have been involved in for ten years, gaining much experience and a stable customer base.

She needs to buy materials for the business such as plastic, decorative fabrics, glue and other materials to make decorations and souvenirs.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy everything she needs.

Yesenia's only goal is to work and grow her business so it is strong and profitable.

loans.use: To buy plastic material, decorative fabric, glue and other materials.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a young woman from Hebron in Palestine, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Basma took out a loan of $1,500 to purchase kitchen tools and a kitchen table and chairs. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, helped. Basma is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen tools and a kitchen table and chairs

loans.name: Herberth Mauricio

texts.es:
Herbert, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a brindar servicio de taxis, tiene dos años de estar trabajando, aprendió por iniciativa propia y su riesgo es la delincuencia en las zonas donde transita.
Actualmente su taxi ha presentado problemas mecánicos por lo que solicita un préstamo, para cubrir los gastos del mecánico y compra de repuestos, por lo que este préstamo será una gran ayuda, que le servirá para mantener en buenas condiciones el vehículo garantizándoles a los clientes una mayor seguridad al viajar.
Su aspiración es que a través del trabajo sus hijos se puedan superar, terminando sus estudios y teniendo mejores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Herbert lives with his wife and two children and provides taxi services.  He’s been doing this for two years, having learned by his own initiative.  His biggest risk is the crime in the zones he drives through.

His taxi is currently giving him some mechanical trouble, so he is asking for this loan which will be a great help in covering the repair costs and replacement parts so that he can maintain it in good condition and guarantee his passengers’ safety.

His aspiration is that his children can succeed through his work, so that they can complete their education and have more job opportunities.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Elmer Dagoberto

texts.es: Elmer Dagoberto de 42 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con su compañera de vida, cuñada y su hijo que por el momento se encuentra estudiando. Elmer se dedica a la venta de billetes de Lotería y Lotín en las principales áreas de la zona donde él Habita, va ambulante por colonias, parques y calles en busqueda de potenciales clientes. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad  por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el mundo de los negocios. Elmer es un hombre ingenioso que no pierde oportunidad para hacer negocio.  Últimamente ha sentido un aumento en la demanda de sus billetes de Lotería  por lo que ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mas billetes de Lotería y Lotín con el objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer Dagoberto is 42 years old and lives in his family house with his life's companion and his sister-in-law, and his son who, at the moment, is still studying. Elmer sells lottery tickets in the principal areas of the zone where he lives, walking the neighborhoods, parks and streets, in search of potential customers. He has done this for many years and, consequently, has much experience in the business.

Elmer is a clever man who doesn't neglect opportunities to do business. Lately, he is experiencing  increased demand for his lottery tickets and has decided to solicit this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in additional lottery tickets. His objective is to capture more of that demand, which will permit him to improve his income as well as his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy additional lottery tickets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise some walls.

loans.name: Lkhagva

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagva is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own house in Darkhan – the second largest city in Mongolia. He runs a transportation business with his minivan and has been in this business since 2006. That year, he bought his second minivan to expand his business. Also, recently, he has purchased a small parcel of land and an old house near the suburbs. 

Lkhagva has requested a loan to make repairs to his fence and house because there is too much damage and destruction in it. As is known, it makes for uncomfortable and dangerous conditions to live. Therefore, he needs additional funding to buy some building materials to make repairs to his home.

loans.use: to buy some building materials to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: For the last four years Juliana worked as a hair dresser in Jukwa, a small village in Ghana’s central region. Now she has returned to an earlier line of work, selling children's clothes. She is married to a farmer and they have two children. Juliana will use this loan from CRAN and Kiva to buy sewing supplies, more clothes to sell and care for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married business lady with two children. Her business is a beauty salon, which is located at Dandora Estate in Nairobi. Her customers are ladies, children and men. She says the business is good and her major challenge is customers who do not honor their debts as per the agreement. She is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more hair relaxers, treatments and other hair additions, as per customer demands. Her hopes are to have a hair dressing school and her children to have a quality education. Beatrice describes herself as honest and smart.

loans.use: to add hair relaxers, treatments etc.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Maria, Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de pantalones jeans, camisas, ropa interior de hombre y ropa femenina, la compra le ayudara para incrementar el inventario y salir a visitar a los clientes con nueva mercadería.
El sueño de María es en el futuro tener un local fijo donde pueda exhibir sus productos a la clientela, ella manifiesta que por el record crediticio que ya tiene, lograra a traves de un prestamo su sueño, de tener un local fijo y adecuado, para generar una mayor afluencia de clientes al negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is currently requesting a loan to buy pants, jeans, shirts, men's underwear and women's clothing.  This purchase will help her to increase her stock and enable her to go out to visit her customers with new merchandise.  

María's dream for the future is to have a fixed sales location where she can display her products for her customers.  Owing to the credit history that she  has, María states that she will use a loan to achieve her dream of having a fixed, suitable sales location so that she can attract a larger number of customers to her business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, men's underwear and women's clothing

loans.name: Jesus Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 45 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento. Su negocio de venta de comida lo inicio aproximadamente 10 años, este negocio está situado en un local del mercado.

Inicio este negocio porque se dio cuenta que tenía el arte de cocina en las manos. Su actividad la realiza sola, su horario de trabajo empieza de las 6:00am hasta 1:00pm.

Está casada, su esposo trabaja en el mercado vendiendo productos naturales. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: arroz, aceites, bebidas, azúcar, etc. Su sueño es tener un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old and a hardworking woman with aspirations for growth. She started her food sales business approximately 10 years ago and it is located in a local market.

She began this business because she realized that she had the art of cooking within her grasp. She does this by herself and her work schedule goes from 6:00am until 1:00pm.

She's married and her husband works in the market selling natural products. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like: rice, oil, drinks, sugar, etc. Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like: rice, oil, drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира любящая жена и заботливая мать 4 детей. Она начала продавать детские и женские одежды 12 лет тому назад, когда её муж не работал. Она ездила в город и привезла товар в малом количестве, а потом получила займ от «Имон Интернэшнл» и начала работать с займом, чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот. И так она расширила свой бизнес и сейчас имеет свою торговую точку. Её торговая точка находиться в центре рынка. Также её муж устроился на работу, а теперь работает главным технологом на химзаводе. Её дети выросли, и её сын уехал в России на заработках и ежемесячно отправляет денежные переводы на стройку дома. Она хотела бы получит займ для покупки детских и женских товаров на зимний период.
texts.en: Munira is a loving wife and caring mother of four children. She started selling children's and women's clothes twelve years ago, when her husband did not have work. She travelled into the city and brought small quantities of goods. Later, she received a loan from IMON International and used the money for her business, increasing turnover. Thus she expanded her business and now has her own retail area in the center of the market. Her husband has also found work as the head technologist at a chemical factory. Her children have grown up, and her son has gone to Russia for work, sending money back every month for construction of a house. Munira would like a loan to purchase children's and women's clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's winter clothing

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto es jubilado y recibe una renta cada mes. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de un tratamiento medico ya que tiene una enfermedad de las caderas. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Bajo San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos pero ya están casados. Humberto ya ha recurrido a Impro en siete ocasiones para solicitar crédito desde el año 2006, y esta es la tercera vez que solicita que su crédito sea fondeado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Humberto is retired, and he receives a pension every month.

He needs the loan to pay the bill for medical treatment because he has a hip disease.

He lives in his own house in the Bajo San Antonio area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children, but they are married.

Humberto has come to Impro on seven occasions since 2006 to request a loan.  This is the third time that he has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for his hips because he suffers from an illness that does not allow him to walk well.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: el señor Marcos nacido en Valle grande, convive con la Sra. Adela tienen tres hijos pequeños, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos, el vive  hace 37 años en la comunidad llamada Villa Florida a 20 km de el Torno,  el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, camote, y un poco de yuca para el consumo con su familia, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de Camote y la cosecha de maní, también se dedica a amansar caballos, el señor marcos hace 6 secuencias  que viene trabajando con emprender y esta muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza  que le han dado para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Marcos was born in the Valle Grande. He lives with Sra. Adela with whom he has 3 small children. His partner takes care of the children. He has lived for the last 37 years in Villa Florida, 20 kms from el Torno. He is a farmer who plants: corn, sweet potatoes and a little cassava for his own family's consumption. He will use the money from the loan to plant sweet potatoes and harvest peanuts. He also breaks in horses. Señor Marcos is in his 6th loan cycle with Emprender and is very grateful to the institution for the confidence placed in him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to plant sweet potatoes and harvest peanuts.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 48 years old and has a son. Ha and her husband have been earning a living by operating a general store from the front of their house for the past fourteen years. They sell a variety of goods, such as sugar, candies, basic household necessities, and beverages.

Ha would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children.

Norman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Norman has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Norman hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Firuzamo

texts.ru: Фирузамо проживает в районе Вахш. Она замужем. Ей 29 лет. У  нее двое детей. Фирузамо занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и бычков.
texts.en: Firuzamo lives in the Vakhsh district.  She is 29 years old, married and has two children.  Firuzamo is involved in animal husbandry.  She fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and bulls

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roberta has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Roberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Marie Therèse
