texts.fr: Marie Thérèse est une jeune femme de 33 ans ayant un enfant de 14 an à sa charge. elle vend des arachides dans un marché de la place. elle se trouve régulièrement confrontée à un problème de de rupture de stock au regard de la petitesse du stock.elle sollicite donc un crédit pour diversifier sa marchandise afin de s'acheter des sacs d'arachides des sacs de riz et du haricot.les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront de réinvestir en partie dans son activité afin de la péréniser et plus assurer la scolarité de son fils.
texts.en: Marie Thérèse, aged 33, is a young woman who sells groundnuts at a local market and supports a 14-year-old child.  She regularly faces shortages because her stock of merchandise is very small.  She is therefore requesting this loan, which will help her to diversify her business through the purchase of bags of groundnuts, rice and beans.  Her profits will be reinvested in her activity in order to make it permanent, and also used to pay her son's school fees.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of groundnuts, rice and beans.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4  femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MINATA qui est la deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles nucléaires à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
MINATA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excellente dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux.).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bendiya is a group in the Danaya association of Ouelessebougou. It includes four women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 48 years old, married with four children.

They lead different activities such as trading condiments like Minata, the second person sitting from left to right in the photo. They live in large nuclear families in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their commerce of condiments: peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc.

To satisfy their customers' growing demands, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, where they are on their sixth group loan.

Minata, a member of the group and well known in Ouelessebougou, excels at selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy different kinds of condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage). She resupplies in Bamako and with local wholesalers, and conducts her retail sales in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallinas, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria esta solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de gallinas, maíz, verduras, tomates entre otros ingredientes que utiliza y asi poder continuar con sus venyas ya que le genern buenas ganancias.

loans.use: para la compra de gallinas, maíz, verduras, tomates entre otros ingredientes

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.en:
Dora is a tenacious and enthusiastic woman. She divorced almost six years ago and her husband has not helped her and their three young children with the family expenses. In this difficult situation and wanting to put her children first, she decided to start making and selling food (traditional Mexican food: menudo and tamales). With her small business she earned enough income to provide for her children and it gave her enough time to look after them as well. The adversities in Dora\'s life did not stop there but she continued to persevere, fighting for the welfare of her children. She is requesting a loan of $475 to buy ingredients, raw materials, and utensils to meet the demand.

With this loan Dora will be able to increase her income, but she needs your support. Help her give her children a better quality of life and an education. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora es una mujer muy tenaz y entusiasta, ella es divorciada desde hace más casi 6 años, su ex esposo no ha contribuido con los gastos de sus tres pequeños, quienes aún son menores de edad. Ante esta difícil situación ella decidió sacar adelante a sus hijos y comenzó a elaborar comida para vender (menudo y tamales), pues con esta actividad tenía ingresos y además podía cuidar a sus hijos. Las adversidades no detuvieron a Dora y ha luchado fuertemente por el gran amor a sus hijos. Ella ésta solicitando un crédito de 475 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos e instrumentos necesarios para hacer frente a los pedidos que se le presentan.

Con éste préstamo Dora podrá incrementar sus ingresos, ella requiere de tu apoyo, no la dejes sola y ayúdala a darle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos, ellos de te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works selling clothing and cosmetics door to door in rural areas. She has a portfolio of fifty clients. Margarita’s business started out of necessity when her husband suffered from a 6 month illness. Her relatives helped her with 200 dollars in funds to undertake the opening of her business. In the beginning, she only sold clothes for children and women. Now, in addition to those products, she offers men’s clothing, and cosmetics. Margarita hopes to begin offering small appliances such as toasters, mixers and rice cookers – as these are the products most frequently requested by her clients. She has faith that with these new products her business will grow. Margarita is married, with two children in school. She is 44 years old. Support for her children and their education comes solely from her business. Margarita is confident that this loan will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos puerta a puerta en la provincias teniendo una cartera de cincuenta clientes. Margarita empezó su negocio por la necesidad de que su esposo estuviera enfermo por el lapso de seis meses. Sus familiares la ayudaron con un capital de 200 dólares para que emprendiera el negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa para niños y damas. Ahora sigue vendiendo este producto junto con ropa de caballeros y cosméticos. Margarita aspira vender pequeños electrodomésticos como tostadoras, batidoras y ollas arroceras que son los que mas le solicitan sus clientes. Ella tiene fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá. Margarita esta casada tiene dos hijos que estudian. Ella tiene 44 años. Ella depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos. Margarita tiene la confianza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Investment in new product line

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is the Chief of her village’s SPBD Center.  And she is one of SPBD’s best Center Chiefs, as she takes her duties very seriously and ensures that she has collected payments from all of her fellow loan group members prior to an SPBD Manager arriving in the village for the weekly group meeting.  Malia is also a good role model for her Center's group because she runs a successful business weaving and crafting women’s handbags.  She makes a variety of sizes and different types of decoration but all are woven from the leaves of a native Samoan plant, laufala. Maria is a widow, and her husband died a long time ago.  Maria has used her weaving talents for some time now to support herself and put her two daughters through school.  She now weaves and creates about five handbags a week and that brings in about ST 20–30 per week (about USD 8–12).

loans.use: Buy needles, boxes, decorative materials

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en: Fariz is 26 years old, and lives in Khachmaz town. He began his business of repairing mobile phones two years ago. He would like a loan of $725 to purchase spare parts for mobile phones, so he can offer better services to his clients.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Despite very difficult life circumstances, Mariya brings joy to many people through her small business making and selling Piroshki, a delicious ethnic food. Piroshki consists of a bread pocket that is cooked in oil and filled with cabbage, cherries, and other tasty fillings.

Mariya has two sons with disabilities – one who is 19 and another who is 14. Her husband, Zinoviy, had run a business similar to Mariya’s but is now also disabled.

Her business is a major source of income for their family. Mariya has been in this food business for about 10 years and makes around $800 USD per month. She loves to work and is an honest and responsible business owner.

Mariya has requested a loan of $500 USD to purchase supplies of flour, sugar and oil that she uses to make the Piroshki. We are delighted in this opportunity to help Mariya continue to be successful in her business and to earn a valuable living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells all types of clothing in her shop. She is a widow and has 6 children ages 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, and 20 years old. She is a very hard worker for her family and business. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to improve her business standard. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: Improving Business Capital

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is twenty-two years of age and she is from the village of Vailoa Tai. She is one of the newest members and this is her first loan. Patricia’s husband works at the Electrical Power Corporation and he earns fortnightly. She has three kids and all of them are in school. Patricia’s business is selling barbecue plate. She is planning to do her business at the front of her house and her customers are the locals, the passing traffic, and village people. She is young and active and she is looking forward to growing her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, soy sauce, onions, and boxes of mutton flaps, turkey tails and sausages for the barbecue business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S., 63, is widow and has seven children. She works very hard on her plot of land growing variety of vegetables and she then sell them to the people in her community. She normally makes on average around $4.60 each day, while three of her children are lately employed at Thailand as laborers and the rest of whom are enrolled in school.  Kim S. has had a problem with a water system to grow her crop. Additionally, she will use this loan to purchase a water- pump machine and pipes to enable her to get water supply from a nearby pond and a well in her community. This will enable her to make the cultivation much further faster, easier and more effective. ( Her husband is pictured with one of her daugher because Kim S. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump machine and pipes to facilitate her water supplies.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian S. is 33-years-old, married with three children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is in the business fo selling office supplies and is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional office supplies for resale

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Good low middle class client. Her husband is in Argentina working as a sewer. In her spare time she sells fresh fish, in order to make a living and support her three children. She makes her payments timely.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Buena Cliente de clase media baja. Su esposo está en la Argentina trabajando de costurero. En sus ratos libre se dedica a otra actividad (venta de pescado fresco), para la manutención de sus tres hijos. Es muy puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of paraffin wax for the manufacture of candles.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-four years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are in school. Margaret has been selling items like diapers, bedspreads, and baby dresses for the past seven years.

She wants to use her new loan to buy more diapers, napkins, bed spreads and to buy containers to secure her products from theft and weather as she peddles them from place to place.

Margaret is a member of the group called Shepherd. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more boxes of diapers, dresses, napkins, etc

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is a single woman who has been a tailor for six years. Due to reduced demand, she has found herself unable to continue. She believes that with a loan she will be able to leverage her expertise to expand her business and reach more customers, making a better future for herself.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao S., 29, and her husband, Mr. Lanh Sam, 28, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children, one son and one daughter. The couple live with their parents.

Mrs. Sreymao has been a tailor since she was eighteen years old. She does her job at home. Mr. Lanh Sam has been a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh for eight years. Now his motor is very old and needs to be changed for new one.

So, Mrs. Sreymao is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase one sewing machine and buy one new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to keep being a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and buy one motorcycle for her husband who is a motor taxi driver.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Married to Yeyi Théodore Eholou, an official with the National Geographic Institute of Benin in Cotonou, Mrs. Paulette E. was born September 27, 1979 in Cotonou and is the mother of three children:  nine-year-old Martial and seven-year-old Romual, both in elementary school, and four-year-old Espérancia, in nursery school.  For the past two years, Paulette and her husband have lived in the Sènadé district of Cotonou.  She has been a retail merchant of various food products, palm wine and vegetable oil for the past decade. She replenishes her stock with food products from the Dantokpa market in Cotonou, and regularly travels between Cotonou and markets in the interior of the country for other goods. To expand her business, she sought and obtained her first loan of $100 in 2007. Business is booming, and to meet the needs of her customers, she is now seeking her third loan, $250. 

 Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à EHOLOU Yeyi Théodore agent de l’Institut Géographique National du Bénin (IGN) à Cotonou, dame E. Paulette est née le 27/09/1979 à Cotonou et mère de trois enfants; Martial  9ans et en classe de CE2, Romuald 7ans et en classe de CE1 et Espérancia 4 ans et en classe de maternelle. E. Paulette réside au quartier  Sènadé depuis 2 ans avec son époux. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits vivriers, du vin de palme et d’huile végétale depuis une dizaine d’années. Elle fait ses  approvisionnements en produits vivriers au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Pour les autres produits, elle fait la navette entre Cotonou et les autres marché de l'intérieur du pays. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité et obtenu en 2007 un premier prêt de 40.000F CFA. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans son activité. Pour faire face à la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite à présent pour son troisième prêt 100.000F CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of a 100 kg sack of corn, a case of tomato paste, three dozen boxes of Omo  and Klin detergent, and a case of BF soap.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Beatrice is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a kuku, or poultry, business that she started last year. Although she is a new entrepreneur, she has been making a monthly profit of approximately $US140. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Beatrice is requesting a loan of $US275 to increase the number of chicks in her business and to purchase additional feed. With the expected increased profits, Beatrice hopes to increase the scale of her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Đurđija

texts.en: Đurđija is a married woman with two children from the town of Prnajvor. Đurđija is requesting a second loan of 1,000 KM to buy more clothes to sell at her stall at the market. She needs to earn money because her husband's salary is not enough to cover household costs. She wants to expand her business in order to earn more money.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en: Tasi S., 50, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days a week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Tasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and an axe. Her whole family, including her husband, supports this business.

loans.use: purchasing chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and an axe

loans.name: Ousman

texts.en:
Mr. Ousman S., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Chariyas Tort, 47, were married in 1985 and have six children. The first child, 22, is a disabled person. Two children raise cows, two children study in local school, and the youngest child is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ousman has been fishing since he was young, a skill he learned from his grandparents. He does fishing from Mekong River and his wife sells the fish in the village market.

Mr. Ousman is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one boat motor and fishing nets for fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn A., 33, is married to Mr. Henry A.. They are blessed with 3 children and reside in Brgy. San Francisco, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Currently they are living with her parents-in-law due to insufficient funds to build their own house.  

Like others, Evelyn had terrible experiences earlier about completing her studies; she worked just to support her brother and sister, since she is the eldest in the family.  Since she has had a family of her own, she is still suffering from the different facets of poverty, especially financial problems.  Thanks to her industry and courage in facing those trials, she started up a variety store as one of her sources of income to cope up with the basic needs of her family.   

One of her greatest dreams is to send her children to school and have them finish their studies.  She also dreams of a stable business and even of having the working capital to become a wholesaler of rice and a retailer as well.  With these dreams she needs a capital of Php 10,000 for her next loan through ASHI.  Giving a chance to have a starting capital of Php 5,000 she aims to do her best to maintain her good performance in ASHI, since this is an opportunity, according to her.

loans.use: variety store

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides Báez de 29 años, es separado, el tiene 3 hijos, los 3 están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Don Alcides después de haber cursado sus estudios secundarios, empezó a estudiar para su profesión, el es  peluquero, gracias al apoyo de sus padres; en la actualidad ya tiene una gran clientela formada.
   El Sr. Alcides invertiría este crédito para la compra de un aire acondicionado y un juego de living, para que todos sus clientes se sientan a gusto en su local.
texts.en:
Mr. Alcides Báez is 39 years old, separated, with 3 children, all of whom are in secondary school. After finishing secondary studies, Alcides began studying for his profession – he is a barber. Thanks to the support of his parents, today he has a very large customer base. Alcides will invest this loan in buying an air conditioner and comfortable waiting area furniture so that his customers will feel comfortable in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an air conditioner and comfortable waiting area furniture

loans.name: Amina Ahmed

texts.en:
Amina Ahmed H. is a 53-year-old widow living in the Likoni neighborhood in Mombasa, Kenya. Amina runs two businesses and also works on the city council in town.

Amina has a business selling fruit-flavored popsicles, which she started 10 years ago. She has two employees who come to her home each morning to receive a supply of popsicles that they take to town and sell on the streets. Her second business is one selling building materials, like stones and “sarugi” tiles, which she started 2 years ago. Building goes by season in Kenya, so Amina does not sell much during the rainy season, but is quite busy now during the dry season, as people are building homes and offices before the rains come.

Amina found that working on the council has not provided her with a high enough salary to support the 5 out of her 10 children who are still dependent on her. Her profits from the popsicle business go toward daily transport, meals, and daily costs, while the larger (but infrequent) sales of building materials provide money for school fees and larger purchases.

Amina has applied for a loan of approximately 375 USD in order to buy what will be her second freezer, flavor and sugar packets, food coloring, and ice cream powder, as well as building materials. Amina says that she is two years away from retirement from the council, but cannot leave her businesses until her children are older. She has 1 child in university, 2 in college, 1 in form 3, and 1 in standard 7. They all attend private schools and the fees are high. Amina would like to expand from selling building materials into building houses with those materials and selling them. She is currently working to save funds in order to advance with this plan.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Osvaldo Júlio

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Júlio N. é natural da província do Maputo distrito de Matola, tem 30 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de dois filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 4 anos e o segundo com um ano de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Osvaldo estudou até 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições, desde a sua infância viveu na Matola e aos vinte anos mudou se para distrito de Boane no bairro de Massaca local onde mora até data hoje.

Osvaldo é trabalhador como motorista mecânico a 7 anos, tem um horário das 7 as 17h da segunda a sexta-feira, tem um salário mensal de 8000,00mt e consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês, ele vive na casa cedida pelo tio.

Para Osvaldo este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva. Tomou conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku através de colegas que já são clientes. Osvaldo pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro de forma a concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Júlio N. was born in Matola, Mozambique. 30 years-old, married, and father of two children ages 4 and 1, he is the sole provider for his family. Due to financial difficulties, his studies were interrupted at the end of high-school. At age 20 Osvaldo moved from the Matola to the Boane district, where he still lives. He has been working as a driver-mechanic for 7 years. Working Mon-Fri, from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, his monthly salary is 8000,00 mt, which allows him to save some money--he currently lives in a house lent by his uncle. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He learned about Hluvuku though a friend, who is already a client. Osvaldo plans to pay his first loan back quickly, so he can apply for another one, to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Бахтиёру 33 года, женат, воспитывает 3 детей. За свою жизнь он занимался разными видами предпринимательства, но на сегодня остановился на купле продаже поддержанных автомобилей. Это приносит основной доход в его семью.  Жена нигде не работает и на Бахтиере лежит вся тяжесть семейных расходов. Бахтиер планирует на полученный займ добавив свои собственные средства приобрести поддержанный Опель.
texts.en:
Bahtier is 33 years old, married and has three children. All his life he had many different businesses, but today he has chosen to continue selling used vehicles. This gives a steady income for his family. His wife does not work anywhere and Bahtier carries the sole responsibility of household expenses. Bahtier plans to use the loan and some of his own money to buy a used Opel.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used Opel

loans.name: Martha Ondina

texts.es: La Sra. Martha L. tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos preciosas niñas, tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio, este negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estrategico donde transita mucha gente, ella tiene una cantidad fija que vende a la semana, todas las semanas vende siempre los mismo y ya tiene medidas las ventas pero si ella tuviera mas productos pues venderia mas y asi siempre tendria el mismo margen de ganancias todas las semanas, por eso es que ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos al por mayor ya que asi como los esta comprando ahorita no tiene precio de por mayor porque compra poco, pero asi tendria mas ganancias, ella desea y sueña tener un negocio grande que sea como un mercadito en donde pueda ofrecerle varios productos a sus clientes y tambien desea generar empleo ya que ella quiere ayudar a las demas personas.
texts.en:
Martha L. is 37 years old and the mother of two precious daughters. She has dedicated herself to the business, which is in a very strategic location with a great deal of foot traffic, for one year. She has a fixed amount she sells every week, but would like to have more products to sell so she can increase her margin of income. For this reason, she needs a loan in order to buy merchandise at wholesale. The small quantities she buys now are not enough to allow her to buy at wholesale, so she is paying higher prices for her goods. She dreams of one day having her own business, such as a small market, where she could offer a variety of products to her customers. She would also like to be able to generate jobs because she would like to help other people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy churros, bread, cookies, juices, soft drinks, soaps, toilet paper, lard, soups, oils, eggs, beans, sugar, coffee, rice.

loans.name: Juana Jeyling

texts.es: Juana Jeyling vive en la colonia San Pablo a 40 km de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Divino Redentor desde hace 7 años, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 2 añitos de edad, y no cuenta con la ayuda del papá de su hija,  vive con su mamá quien le ayuda a cuidar a su bebita cuando ella va a trabajar, está solicitando  su 3er financiamiento para invertirlo en el repello de una habitación y ponerle el piso, esta cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus alumnos, ella comparte los gastos familiares del hogar con su mamá, aunque son una familia pobre son muy unidos, el mayor sueño de Juana es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda,  tener estabilidad laboral, salud y finalizar la licenciatura que actualmente esta estudiando para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija que es su razon de vivir.
texts.en:
Juana Jeyling lives in the San Pablo neighborhood 40 km away from Nueva Guinea. She has worked as a teacher at the Divine Redeemer School for the past 7 years. She is a single mother, has a girl who is 2 years old and does not have the help of her daughter's father. She lives with her mother who helps her to care for her baby when she goes to work. She is applying for her 3rd loan to invest it the titles for the flooring of a room. This client stands out for being very responsible, honest, hard working and loved by her students. She shares the household expenses with her mother. Although they are a poor family they are very united. Juana’s greatest dream is to improve her house little by little, have job stability, health and finish the degree for which she is currently studying to provide better living conditions for her daughter who is her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile the floor of a room

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta D. est une femme divorcée restauratrice depuis 2004, ayant deux enfants en charge. Avec son restaurant elle assure le minimum vital (payer son loyer, sa nourriture et les frais de scolarité des enfants) ; elle loue le restaurant où elle mène ses activités. Le propriétaire des locaux voyant son affaire se développer lui demande de lui rendre son local car il veut mener des activités. Madame Anta est venue voir l’IMCEC pour l’aider à investir sur une surface d’à côté que lui a cédé une de ses relations. Avec son crédit elle va acheter le ciment et la penture, les tables et les chaises, le reste elle va augmenter son fonds de roulement. Le fonds de roulement c’est l’argent avec lequel elle achète le riz, le poisson, la farine, la viande… pour préparer les repas. Ses enfants mangent au restaurant. A chaque jour elle réalise un surplus de 2000 FCFA ($4) qu’elle garde à la banque. Elle aura donc à la fin du mois 60000 FCA ($120), ce qui lui permettra d’honorer ses échéances de remboursements 40 250 FCFA ($80) et de garder en épargne 18 750 FCFA ($20).
texts.en:
Ms. Anta D. has been a divorced woman restauranteur since 2004. She has two children to support. With her restaurant, she ensure a minimal living standard (she pays for her rent, food, and schooling costs for the children). She was renting the restaurant where she operated. The owner of the premises saw her business being developed and asked her to give up the place because he wants to do business.

Ms. Anta came to see IMCEC for help with investing in an adjacent place her relatives let her have. With this loan, she's going to buy cement, paint, tables, and chairs, and the rest will be for augmenting her working capital. This working capital is the money she will use to buy rice, fish, flour, meat... to make meals. Her children eat at the restaurant. Each day, she earns over 2,000 francs CFA that she deposits into a bank. She will then have 60,000 francs at the end of the month, which will enable her to honor her 40,250 francs loan payments and to keep 18,750 francs in savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixed assets for a restaurant

loans.name: Los Luceros Group

texts.es:
Maria Lenny J..-  es la presidenta del banco comunal, fue elegida debido su actitud D. positivismo y por ser muy trabajadora.
Vive en el Balcón II KM.9  D. la cuidad D. Santa Cruz. En casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Gonzalo García y sus dos hijos, su actividad principal es la venta D. abarrotes el cual lo realiza en su domicilio. Como segunda actividad tiene punto D. llamadas. Su esposo el Sr. Gonzalo es chofer el mismo que trabaja hace 5 años con esta actividad. 
Rosa M..- tiene el cargo D. tesorera en el banco comunal, ella es casada tiene un hijo, viven en anticrético. Se dedica a la venta D. ropa en la feria los fines D. semanas. Su esposo el Sr. Edgar Palacios, se dedica a la cerrajería ya hace mas D. tres años que viene trabajando con esta actividad, están acumulando su propio capital para la compra D. un puesto dentro D. la feria D. Barrio Lindo. 
Clara R..- es una mas D. las integrantes D. este banco comunal, doña Clara vive en casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Francisco J.  y sus dos hijos, su actividad principal en la venta D. comida, como segunda actividad tiene la venta D. pan casero. Estos son realizados en su mismo domicilio.
Su esposo el Sr. Francisco es albañil el cual trabaja en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz. El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para aumentar sus mesas y sillas ya que estaba empezando a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Lenny J. – She is the president of this community bank. She was elected due to her positive attituD. and because she is very hardworking. She lives in Balcón II KM.9, in the city of Santa Cruz, with her husband, Mr. Gonzalo García, and their two children. Her primary activity is selling groceries out of her home. As a siD. business, she also operates a telephone center (where people can go to make phone calls). Her husband, Mr. Gonzalo, has worked as a driver for 5 years. Rosa M. – She is the treasurer of this community bank. She is married with one child. They live in a house with an “anticrético” contract, in which they paid the landlord a fixed sum when they moved in, in lieu of monthly rent. She sells clothing in a weekend market. Her husband, Mr. Edgar Palcios, is a locksmith with over three years of experience. They are saving up to buy a stand in the Barrio Lindo market. Clara R. – Another member of this community bank, Ms. Clara lives with her husband. Mr. Francisco J. and their two children. She sells food as her primary line of business, and receives a secondary stream of income from selling homemaD. bread. She runs both these enterprises out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries (oil, rice, noodles, flour)

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo Y. is from the city of San Simon, Cagayan de  Oro. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Guillermo owns a farm; his main source of income is from planting & harvesting coconut and banana. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Guillermo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. Guillermo  repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which he used to expand the business. Guillermo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will  also be used for additional capital.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and provide for the needs of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital for the business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ol-Tite Group

texts.en:
This is Mustapha K., Unisa K. and Mary S.. They called their group Hold Tight. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have received from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, however, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve on their standards of living. 

Mustapha Kamara (right) is the leader of this group. He was born in a village called Yele, about forty miles from Makeni city and is now age twenty-nine. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children together. His children are still in primary schools. Mustapha sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther H. sells drinks and large doughnuts at Atabadze near Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents.  Her husband is an engineer.  Esther has been selling drinks and dough nuts since 2005. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks and ingredients for the preparation of the doughnuts. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and ingredients for preparing doughnuts

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 37 years old. She is married to Rolando, a welder who owns a welding shop. They live in San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. Cynthia is giving her full support to her husband by helping him in the business. She is now asking to take out a loan of PHP 7,000 for their welding shop. The loan will be used to buy welding rods, steel, and other materials needed in their welding shop. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that they can maintain the business and make it grow.

Cynthia and her husband have three children, and they are all studying in elementary and high school level. They want them to continue their studies in college and become successful with their chosen careers. Cynthia and her husband are helping each other in maintaining their business and they are hoping to further expand into manufacturing steel windows. She prays and supports her husband in their business so that someday, they will become successful.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rukayat

texts.en: Rukayat is very optimistic about the speedy growth of her business, and she has the zeal to pull her family out of poverty. Rukayat sells hair extensions and she is also a hair stylist. She is 26 years old and married with a child. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Originario de la ciudad de Nindiri, municipio de Masaya, el grupo Las Hermanas está formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y grandes amigas. Desde hace mas de 3 años están ADIM y son un grupo con buen record crediticio.

María Elena B. de 52 años, es la coordinadora del grupo y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en Nindiri. Negocio al que se dedica desde hace 10 años y con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, quienes le ayudan en las gestiones de cobro.

María dice sentirse muy orgullosa ya que pese a los altibajos que ha enfrentado en este negocio se mantiene en pie, ha sabido ser paciente con los clientes que se atrasan.

Consuelo M.  trabaja igualmente en este mismo negocio y Martha Lidia B. es costurera y elabora ropa de cama y los distribuye en la zona norte del país.
texts.en:
The Las Hermanas (The Sisters) group was started in the Masaya municipality of the city of Nindiri by three hardworking women who are great friends. They have been part of ADIM for 3 years and are a group with a good credit record. Maria Elena B., who is 52 years old, is the group coordinator and she works in the sale of clothing and shoes in Nindiri. She has worked in this business for 10 years. With it her three children have been able to prosper, and they now help her with managing the billing. Maria says she feels very proud that despite the ups and downs she has faced in this business she still perseveres, and has had the understanding to be patient with clients who fall behind. Consuelo Martinez likewise works in the same business, and Martha Lidia Blandon is a seamstress. She crafts bed linens and distributes them in the north of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the growth of their business

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Battsetseg and her husband operate a grocery store in their town. They began their business in 2000, and since then, they have been able to buy their own store which enables them to sell larger quantities of food. Battsetseg wants to keep expanding the amounts of products her store sells so that her neighbors will not have to go to larger markets farther away in order to buy their groceries. She says, “My wish is to own our own house in the future.” Battsetseg is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~425 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries to sell for the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria B. is from the village of Talic. She is 50 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eleuteria owns & operates a hog fattening business. Eleuteria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eleuteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleuteria has successfully repaid one previous loan from PMPC. Eleuteria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in future.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luís H. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor José Luís es policía de baja graduación de este municipio, ingresos con los que se mantiene. 
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado de un baño en la parte de la vivienda que le cedieron sus padres.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
José Luís Huanta lives in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri region on the west side of the city of La Paz. José Luís is a low ranking policeman in this municipality. He uses this income to support himself. The loan he is asking for is to finish a bathroom in the part of the house his parents gave him. This is the fourth time that he has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis that was completed favorably qualifies him, and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of material and labor to finish a bathroom in the house where he lives

loans.name: Sonak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonak S., 29, a silk weaver, has been married to Mr. Phoun Choun since 2001 and they have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are still young. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sonak’s husband is a silk weaver as well. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to resell in Phnom Penh.

Sonak has asked for a loan from Kiva one time already. She now is requesting her second loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her silk-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Soklin

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklin L., 41, and her husband Mr. Teat Ly, 42, have been married since 1991. They have two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mrs. Soklin L. has been a scarf weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a policeman since 1987. 

Soklin has requested a loan from Kiva two times previously. She now is asking for her third loan of $1,000 to purchase cotton thread materials to use in her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread materials to use in her scarf weaving business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 58 años, es una alegre y amable mujer que se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, vive sola ya que se separo D. su pareja.DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a este oficio ya que le da buenos ingresos con los cuales pueD. mantenerse y sentirse independiente. El trabajo D. Carmen comienza desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana cuando  apertura  su establecimiento para ofrecer las gaseosas, cervezas entre otras bebidas las cuales venD. y distribuye a sus  asiduos clientes. Ella considera muy rentable su trabajo es por esta razón  que desea ampliarlo, y compra al por mayor gran cantidad D. estas bebidas, las cuales sabe serán muy demandadas en la estación D. verano que ya se acerca.Es su quinto préstamo en MFP y siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en todos sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito comprará varias cajas D. cervezas y también jabas D. gaseosa que piensa vender con mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and a cheerful, friendly woman who sells drinks. She lives alone and is separated from her common law husband. Carmen has been in this business for the past six years because it provides a good income to support herself and remain independent. She begins work in the early morning hours when she opens her establishment to begin selling sodas, beer, and other beverages to her frequent customers. Carmen believes her business is very profitable, so she wants to expand it by buying more beverages at wholesale. This will enable her to keep up with the high demand for the upcoming summer season.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Carmen has always demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in all of her payments. With the proceeds of her loan, she will purchase crates of beer and sodas in hopes of selling them successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Aba U. vende lotería ambulante en el mercado Israel lewite Managua.
Ana va usar el crédito para comprar varios billetes de lotería.
Su negocio comenzó cuando Ana empezó a vender ambulante, viendo  que las ventas estaban aumentando ella decidió vender lo que era la raspadita y la chalupa.
Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Ella espera que con este financiamiento su negocio cresca mas y a si tener mas utilidades.
Ana es  madre soltera y con una hija en la universidad.
Este es el octavo crédito que Ana ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Ana dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que su negocio se ha mantenido y este esta mas solido.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A.U. sells lottery tickets on an itinerant basis in the Israel Lewite market in Managua. Ana wants to use the loan to but lottery tickets.

Her business began when Ana started selling on foot in the market. Seeing that her sales were increasing she decided to sell “raspadita”, a lottery ticket in which the surface is scratched with a coin or key, and “chalupa” , another type of lottery ticket. She works each day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

She hopes that with this loan her business will grow more and, thus, have greater earnings. Ana is a single mother with a daughter in university. This is the eighth loan that Ana has had with CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. Ana says that her loans with CEPRODEL have helped her a lot. They are the reasons why her business has sustained itself and is on a more solid footing.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is going to be invested in the purchase of lottery tickets for resale

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas M. is from the city of Mambajao in Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Tomas is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tomas provides motorela (a motorcycle with a passenger compartment) transportation to local community members. Tomas has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Tomas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tomas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Tomas is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Tomas's 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Luz Neila

texts.es:
Luz Neila Marin T., tiene 41 años de edad  y vive en el barrio España ubicado en el centro de la ciudad e Cartagena con sus 2 hijos  de 10 y 12 años de edad.  Ella tiene un negocio donde realiza actividades económicas mixtas: confecciones, variedades y peluquería; es separada y tiene la  custodia de sus menores porque su padre viajó al extranjero y por eso muy sola trabaja para sacarlos adelante;  Con mucho  esfuerzo se ha capacitado en  los oficios de confecciones, peluquería manualidades y artesanías, actividades de las que vive y le permiten luchar con vehemencia para conseguir el sustento de sus hijos. 
Ha recibido 11 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde su primer ingreso en el programa de grupos solidarios, hasta hoy  que está vinculada individualmente. Su participación en esta organización ha marcado una diferencia  en su vida, porque la han apoyado no solo con  crédito  sino  con asesoria empresarial y personal. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito de $1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares, papelería, lencería,  accesorios para confeccionar disfraces vestidos de primera comunión y mercancía como sabanas y calzado.
En su negocio, tiene durante todo el año, convenios con colegios de la ciudad a los que les arrienda disfraces vestidos de primera comunión, porque fabrica todo tipo de vestidos y ropa deportiva. Mediante esta actividad ofrece a personas de escasos recurso su negocio de alquiler de vestidos ocasionales a muy bajo costo; ella también  vende útiles escolares y mercancía en general, por eso es muy conocida en esta comunidad.
Su  principal sueño  es adquirir vivienda propia con un local contiguo para su negocio  y llevar  a sus hijos a la universidad  y darles la educación que ellos merecen. Su desafío principal es sostenerse en el mercado con un buen nivel de competitividad.
texts.en:
Luz Neila Marin T. is 41 years old and lives in the España neighborhood in central Cartagena with her two children, ages 10 and 12. She has a business where she engages in three economic activities: a sewing workshop, a variety store, and a beauty salon. Luz is separated from her husband and has custody of her children because their father left the country. Therefore she must work with great effort in order to get ahead. She learned how to sew and style hair, skills that enable her to make a living and fight vigorously to support her children.

Since first entering the solidarity group program, Luz has received eleven loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She now receives individual loans. Her participation in the organization has made a difference in her life because she has received business and personal advice in addition to taking out loans. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 COP to purchase school supplies, stationery, lingerie, accessories for making first communion dresses, linens, and shoes.

Throughout the year, she has contracts with schools in the city to rent out first communion dresses since she manufactures all kinds of clothing and sportswear. Through this activity she gives poor people the opportunity to wear clothing for special occasions at a very low cost. Luz also sells school supplies and general merchandise, so she is well-known in the community.

Her main goals are to acquire a home of her own that is adjacent to her business and provide her children with the college education they deserve. The main challenge that she faces is maintaining her business in a competitive marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making first communion dresses, as well as school supplies, stationery, lingerie, linens, and shoes

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo P. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal Liloy. He is 43 years old. Angelo is married and has 2 school-aged children. He owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Angelo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $130 US) for these activities.

In 2009, Angelo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Angelo is requesting a new loan, which will be his third, of 20,000 PHP. He will use it to expand the business.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Louise Dite Yadègnè

texts.fr:
Madame  Louise dite Yadègnè D.  est âgée de 45 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille au quartier Sébougou  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 5 ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Après des années d’apprentissage, elle finit par évoluer de ses propres ailes. Elle opta pour l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires. Elle jouit d’une forte clientèle et notoriété.     
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires correctement remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1barrique d’huile, 2 sacs de choux et  1 sac de courge. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et effectue sa  vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est de participer aux foires de Konobougou et Loulouni.
texts.en:
Mrs. Louise (known as Yadègnè) D. is 45 years old, married and mother of six children. She lives in her husband’s extended family home, in the Sébougou neighborhood of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school in the 5th primary grade (Mali educational system), she began retail activities alongside her mother who sold grain cereals. Following years of apprenticeship she finally developed her own activity, opting for the retail commerce of food condiments. She has acquired a solid reputation with a large customer base. Wanting to increase her working capital, she approached Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After correctly reimbursing four group loans, she is now requesting her first individual loan. She will use it to buy one barrel of vegetable oil, two bags of cabbages and one bag of squash. She gets her supplies locally in Segou and sells against cash or credit to a customer base of both men and women. She hopes to reach monthly earnings of 80,000 FCFA thanks to this loan. The earnings will allow her to assist her husband and participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.). Her ambition is to do business at the Konobougou and Loulouni market fairs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Yenny Stand

texts.es:
Yenni V. S. tiene 31 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 7 años en  el barrio las Nieves, uno de los más tradicionales y populosos del suroriente de Barranquilla, en  casa de sus padres donde todo lo que se mueve es negocio:  por el lado de ella en su vitrina calentadora  vende semanalmente alimentos y  frituras como sopas, picadas, chorizos, chinchurria, cuajo y vende diariamente dulces y frutas como alegrías, masmelos, supercoco, mango, corozo, pera, papaya, por otro lado  su esposo trabaja  vendiendo pescado camarón y en general  productos del mar.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación y solicita un valor de $2.000.000  que quiere invertir en la compra de un Carricoche para transportar pasajeros, el cual  será conducido por su esposo y en él también ofrecerá sus productos alimentarios,  porque Yenni aspira a tener un ingreso diario mas constante y este es un medio que suele utilizarse en ese barrio para transportarse internamente y hacia otros sectores cercanos. 
Aprendió a negociar viendo a su madre desde que ella  era niña,  pues  tenia este mismo negocio y hace apenas unos 7 años se lo dejó a Yenni. Su crédito anterior le sirvió para surtir su negocio, pagar pasivos costosos que cobraban altos intereses. Su sueño y desafío actual es tener su propia casa y ver a sus hijos crecer y educarse para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Yenni V. S. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children, ages 1,3, and 7 years. They live in the Las Nieves neighborhood, one of the most traditional and heavily populated areas in the southeast part of Barranquilla. They live in her parent's home, where they also have their business. On her side, in a heated glass display case, she sells food and fried food such as soups, cold cuts, sausages, pork rinds, and rennet on a weekly basis, and on a daily basis she sells sweets and fruits, including sweets made of chocolate, marshmallow, coconut, and fruits such as mango, corozo, pears, and papaya. On the other side her husband works selling fish, shrimp and other seafood. This is their second loan with the Fundación and they request an amount of 2,000,000 Colombian pesos that they want to invest in the purchase of a light vehicle to transport passengers. Her husband will drive this vehicle, and they will also use it to offer their food products for sale, because Yenni wants to have a daily income that is more reliable. This is a medium that is often used for transportation over short distances and to other nearby neighborhoods. She learned to sell watching her mother from the time she was a child. Now she has this same business, which was left to Yenni 7 years ago. Her previous loan was used to restock her store and to pay off other debts that were charging a high rate of interest. Her dream and current challenge is to have her own house and to see her children grow and become educated for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a light vehicle to transport food products and passengers

loans.name: Miriam Edith

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Castilla, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar el negocio debido a que necesitaba de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales pudiera sacar adelante a su menor hijo. Ella trata de mantener el negocio con mucho esfuerzo, ofreciendo productos de calidad y un buen trato a los clientes que frecuentan su establecimiento.

Miriam desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas bebidas de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, la ciudad de Piura es caracterizada por presentar altas temperaturas durante la mayoría de meses del año, por lo que las bebidas constituyen un producto indispensable en toda bodega y que siempre gozan de buena acogida. Para lograr su objetivo Miriam se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Miriam es una mujer bastante luchadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para otorgarle a su menor hijo y a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen Miriam aparece junto a su menor hijo, su motivación para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Miriam is 36 years old and the single mother of a four year-old son. She lives with her parents in the Castilla district, which is located in the province of Piura. Piura is located about 2 ½ hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past year, she has dedicated herself to selling basic needs products and groceries in a small bodega she set up in her home. She tells us that she had to start the business in order to have a more stable source of income with which to support her young son. She works very hard to maintain the business, offering good-quality products and excellent customer service to those who frequent her establishment. Miriam would like to expand her business by buying beverages, in order to better satisfy her customers’ needs. The city of Piura is known for high temperatures during most of the year, which is why beverages constitute an indispensable product in every bodega. To reach her goal, Miriam finds herself having to make her first request of Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles. Miriam is a fighter and very much devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to provide a better life for them. The picture shows Miriam with her son, who is the reason she keeps fighting to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages to expand her business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata S. sells clothing and cosmetics for both men and women in a rented shop. She has two years experience in business and she is also a student in a polytechnic college. She is married to a businessman and has four dependents. 

She is hardworking and dedicated to her business and she needs a loan to buy more men's and women's clothing and cosmetics. She hope to use the proceeds from the loan to educate her dependents and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Rahimboy

texts.en:
Rahimboy K. is married and has four children. He runs a business selling coal at the market. Rahimboy has been in business for over 13 years. He has his own car and brings his goods from the neighboring town himself. Rahimboy is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure the rapid growth and success of his business. Rahimboy is requesting a loan for 13000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Rahimboy's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing inventory of coal

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima son D. la Comunidad D. La Merced, Provincia Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y la preparación D. chancaca D. cabuya.
Delia es socia hace mucho tiempo, es casada, tiene 4 hijos carones, Delia se dedica a la Compra  y venta D. animales menores, fruta, verdura y chancaca. Su negocio empezó con el  trueque, compraba D. Huanta   frutas y verduras; los  llevaba a las  diferentes comunidades D.  churcampa para  canjearlos  con  cereales pero era  demasiado el peso D. los  cereales que tenia  que  cargar a la carretera  D. las diferentes casas. Hoy  en  día  solo los  venD.  en las  zonas donD. hay facilidad con la  movilidad. Sus productos los compra en Huanta y  los  venD.  en las ferias y en Churcampa. Compra animales menores D. churcampa y los  venD.  en Huanta. Actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. animales menores que los engordara para luego comercializarlos.
Delia desea que  sus  hijos sean profesionales, y  ahorrar hasta noviembre para pagar el viaje D. estudios  D. su segundo hijo que  esta  en la promoción del colegio.
texts.en:
The members of the Virgen D. Fátima Communal Bank are from the La Merced community in the Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The main activities in the community are agriculture, livestock, and preparing "chancaca D. cabuya" (brown sugarloaf maD. from sugarcane and agave). Delia has been a member for a long time. She is married and has four sons. Delia buys and sells small animals, fruit, vegetables and chancaca. Her business started as an exchange. She bought fruits and vegetables from Huanta. She took them to the different communities in Churcampa in order to traD. them for basic grains. But, the grains were too heavy to take to different houses on the road. Now she only sells them in areas that she can get to easily. She buys her products in Huanta and sells them at the fairs in Churcampa. She buys small animals in Churcampa and sells them in Huanta. She does this with help from her husband and sons. The loan will be used to buy small animals to fatten and then sell. Delia wishes for her sons to become professionals. She also wishes to save until November in order to pay for the class trip for her second son. He is graduating from high school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa
texts.en: Blanca Rosa

loans.use: Raw materials like flour, sugar, and leavening, etc.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of different products such as coffee, sugar, salt, shampoo, diapers, noodles and so on in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $25 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov Y.,age 27, married woman and is a villager who lives in Phngeas village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr.Nob Thou, are farmer who own 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Pov Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide to cultivate rice and to buy piglets for breeding. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. Aside from farmer,Mr.Nob Thou is also cow middleman who is able to earn a small income to hold up his family. This couple has two children, who all are too young and are not yet in school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide to cultivate rice and to buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 42 años es un hombre laborioso, que está separado desde hace10 años, tiene dos hijos, a quienes ve los fines de semana, vive solo en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años trabaja de operario en chacras ajenas, ganando por día S/. 20.00 soles, al ver que era rentable la comercialización de productos naturales, decidió emprender este negocio,  es así que luego de 4 años, decidido cultivar plátano en terrenos arrendados, y a las que cuida con esmero y dedicación, puesto que le generan los ingresos económicos que le permite obtener mayores oportunidades y bienes, que mejoraran su calidad de vida. Lo que más le gusta es retirar la malezas de sus chacras, de esa manera le facilita el crecimiento de sus plantas. En adelante, quiere comprar terrenos con los ahorros que tiene para que pueda sembrar frutos que naturalmente crecen en la zona selva en la que se encuentra, asimismo desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta satisfecho de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde las personas son muy colaboradores en cada actividad que desarrolla cada socio. Piensa invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir sobre sus plantaciones para nivelar su producción, además comprará plantas de plátano para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 42 years old and an industrious gentleman who has been separated from his spouse for ten years. He lives alone in his own home and has two children who visit him on the weekends. For more than six years Roberto has worked as a laborer on other farms, earning 20 PEN each day. When he found out that selling natural products could be profitable, he decided to start a business. He now has been growing bananas on rented land for four years and looks after his crops with great care and dedication. This has helped him generate income for pursuing more opportunities and acquiring assets, thereby improving his quality of life. What he enjoys most is removing weeds from his fields because it helps facilitate the growth of his plants. In the future, he wants to use his savings to buy land for growing fruits that are normally found in the jungle. Robert also wants to open a grocery store in his home.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Roberto is pleased to be working with his Communal Bank group because the people have been very supportive of developing the individual business activities of each member. He plans to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to help even out production. In addition, he will buy banana seedlings to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers & banana seedlings

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhon;  El tiene 35 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es proveedor de quesos en diferentes  hoteles y restaurantes,  también trabaja prestando servicio de lavandería.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de quesos al por mayor.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Manos Juntas (Hands Together) communal bank. This bank is located in Huanchac District, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Jhon. He is 35 years old, single, and works in retail sales. The member sells cheeses to different hotels and restaurants. He also works offering laundry services.
