He is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing cheese in bulk. The member is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and he promises to be careful about making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mariana del Carmen García A. de 51 años de edad es dueña de un bar cafetín, inició dicho negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo fritanga, luego con ayuda de su yerno y de los créditos que le habían otorgados logro comprar activos fijos como mesas, sillas e incluso entechó y embaldosó una parte del local, ahora con el nuevo préstamo piensa terminar de embaldosar e invertir en más productos.
texts.en:
Mariana del Carmen García A., 51, owns a snack bar. She started the business about 6 years ago selling fried snacks. Then, with help from her son-in-law and loans she had gotten, she bought fixed assets like tables and chairs. She even roofed and tiled part of the locale. She plans to use the new loan to finish tiling and to buy more products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Kaja

texts.en: Kaja A. is currently in the business of selling beans, groundnuts and 'simsim' (sesame seeds)  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Kaja is 30 years old and is widowed.   She has four children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy chickens to be reared at home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur saliou G. est âgé de 40 ans il est commerçant de produits alimentaires tels que le riz, l'huile et autres produits divers à Thiadiaye .Sa boutique constitue son gagne pain pour cela il vient solliciter ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités .Également le sieur G. espère avec ce crédit disposer plus de revenus pour subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes et à l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en: Mr. Saliou G. is 40 years old and sells food products such as rice, oil and various other products in Thiadiaye. His shop is his livelihood and for this reason he is requesting this loan in order to strengthen his business. Mr. G. is also hoping to increase his disposable income in order to provide for his daily expenses and his children's education.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita B., 45, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando B., a technician, and is mother to a young working adult and a simple stay-at-home who manages the household while she attends to her business.

Teresita operates a photocopying business. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demands increase. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need her photocopier for documents, form replication and other similar needs. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a second hand Xerox machine, bond paper, toners, ink, and other supplies for her business. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy spare parts and repair fees for the photocopying machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Teresita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy secong hand Xerox machine, bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun K., age 31, sells used clothes at the busy local market in the province of Battambang. From that she is able to earn about $5 a day to support her family. She has been married for many years to Mr. Loerk Sarat, 37, a motor taxi driver, and they have four children, all of whom are single and still living under their roof. 

Recently Mrs. Moeun K. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock, but she lacks capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita M. is 53 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Purok Ipil-ipil, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Teresita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could purchase materials for fishing. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shaadiinsa's Group

texts.en:
Shaadiinsa B. is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married.  Shaadiinsa is the resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works as a power engineer. Together they are raising two sons and three daughters. Their two older daughters work in Russia and the other children are students. Shadiinsa works as a school teacher. She also breeds, raises, and sells cattle, from which she earns 3000 soms per month. With money that she receives from this loan, she wants to purchase a calf to breed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy A. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Jovy is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jovy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and canned goods in the local community. Jovy has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jovy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jovy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and junk foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Jovy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for six years, Abduvahob was born in 1975 in Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and is responsible for four people consisting of his wife and three children. Very dynamic, serious and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from within 20 km of his village. With this goal in mind, Abduvahob is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.   
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida D. is from the town of Trinidad.  She is 28 years old.  Arnida is married and has 3 children ages 9, 7 and 4 years old.  To make a living, Arnida owns and operates a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market.  Arnida wishes for her business to grow.

Arnida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Arnida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Arnida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita L. is from the village of Sibugon. She is 60 years old. Esterlita is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a new clothing business. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Uvaldo

texts.es:
Uvaldo tiene 54 años de edad, tiene seis hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Uvaldo se dedica a la venta de repuestos de moto en una pequeña tienda, él también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad de Pisaq. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a la brindar servicios de transporte en su propio mototaxi y le ha ido muy bien. En esta oportunidad Uvaldo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo llantas y muchas cosas que falta en la tienda.   
     
Uvaldo pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Uvaldo is 54 years old, has six children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

He has a small shop where he sells motorcycle parts. In addition, Uvaldo provides urban transportation services in the city of Pisaq. He has been providing transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi for six years and has done very well. Uvaldo is taking this opportunity to buy parts such as tires and other items that his store is lacking.

Uvaldo belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Angelica, La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad, la socia trabaja como promotora de una institución pública, la socia también elabora todo tipo de mermeladas y manjares y los vende a sus compañeros en su institución según sea el pedido que le hagan. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de mermeladas y manjares.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the “HACIA EL TRIUNFO” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Huanchac, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

She is called Señora Angelica and she is 42 years old, married, with one child who is 15 years old. She works as a marketer in a public institution. She also makes all kinds of delicacies and jams, which she sells to order to her co-workers at the institution. Señora Angelica is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making the jams and delicacies.

She is happy to be receiving this loan and committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make jams and other delicacies

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie, 30 years old, married, and blessed with school-aged children, is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, where she manages her grocery store business. She is also engaged in vulcanizing and is able to earn a monthly net income of 3500.00.

In 2008, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9,000.00 PHP from PMPC that was used to expand the business, she is requesting her sixth loan for 8,000 PHP to help renovate her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 46-year-old man, married to two ladies and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. 

Using his 12 years of experience in trading and business, Mohammad decided to start his own business by renting a shop to sell frozen goods two years ago. He has been successfully running it since then. 

Mohammad applied for a loan to expand his business; he will be using the loan to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods to cover the needs of the people in his area.

loans.use: to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods

loans.name: Merly Esther

texts.es: Merly tiene 23 años de edad. Es madre soltera de una hija. Vive en casa de padres con su hija en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Merly se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo. Sus clientes hacen sus pedidos y Merly reparten la mercadería cada semana. Ella cuenta con clientes fidelizados en este negocio. Tiene una experiencia de más de 02 años en esta actividad. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi propia que alquila a un familiar, el cual le genera ingresos de forma diaria. Con los ingresos de estas actividades, Merly puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Desea aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Walther is 46 years old, married, and has four dependent children.  He lives in his own home in the rural part of La Victoria district, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than two years, Walther has been earning a living providing a transport service through a taxi company in his community.  He currently uses a vehicle which he hires by the day.

Walther would like to use part of the loan that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa to enrol in a specialization course which will help him in his work and help him to increase his income.  He would like to use the rest of his loan to cover his children's school expenses now that the school year has begun in Peru.

Walther is very hard working and would like to continue improving in his field so that he can continue making a good income.  His biggest wish is to provide his children with a good-quality education.

loans.use: aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú

loans.name: Stellaphine

texts.en:
Stellaphine M., 39, is married to Steven Kitui, a 40-year-old businessman, and they have four children: Irene, 14 years old in class seven, Evans, 9 years old in class four, Mercy, 3, and Meshack, who is a year old. They live in Lukenya where Stellaphine has run a quarry business for 10 years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.5,000.

Introduced to Kadet Ltd by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office, Stellaphine is requesting her first loan for 50,000 to purchase another quarry. If the loan boosts her income, she will buy a piece of land upon which to build a house to live in with her family.

Stellaphine describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a prominent business lady.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a young woman from Palestine, married and a mother of one daughter and one son. Both her children are school students. Safa's husband has a laundry shop that serves a good number of clients in the city where Safa and her family live. Safa's husband needs a steam iron to improve the services offered by his shop. Since he can't afford to buy it from the shop's income and keep running the house and shop, Safa took out a loan from FATEN to buy the Iron.

Safa's husband appears in the picture here in the laundry shop where he works instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a clothes iron for the laundry shop

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 24 years old and a single mother to a 3 year old child. She is a tailor in Kiganjo. She has been running her business for a period of about 2 years, with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is her first loan with KADET, after being introduced to Kadet by a friend. She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics for her shop and materials to make clothes, which she will later sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land and develop it in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her shop and material to make clothes.

loans.name: Willian

texts.en: Willian lives in a small village in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his four small children. He has been operating a small convenience store out of his home for the past 15 years, getting up at 5:00 a.m. every morning to attend to customers.  Willian is a returning client and is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to buy more general merchandise for his store. In his free time on weekends, he likes to attend church.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Florecita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florecita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Argentina  de 40 años, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Ella se  dedica a la realización de cepillos para lavar pachas desde hace 14 años. Este negocio lo aprendió de su hermano el cual trabajaba en ello y poco a poco toda la familia se involucró.
Ella invertirá en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc. y su meta es iniciar otro negocio que sería el comercio de ropa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Maricela del Carmen de 35 años quien vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo, y María Isabel quien realiza cepillos de lavar ropa y cepillos de lustrar.
texts.en:
The Florecita ("Little Flower") group is composed of three hard-working, enterprising, women. 

One of them is Señora Rosa Argentina. She is 40 years old, and has 5 children, 2 of whom are of school age. For the past 14 years, she has dedicated her time to making brushes for washing baby bottles. She learned her business from her brother, who did the same work and who little by little got the whole family involved. She will invest in the necessary materials (nylon, wire, wood, etc.) and her goal is to start up another business, selling clothes. 

The other members of the group are Maricela del Carmen, age 35, who sells refried beans and nacatamales - a local dish based on cornmeal and pork - and María Isabel, who makes brushes for cleaning clothes and polishing shoes.

loans.use: en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. She is married and a mother of one son. Riham took out a loan of $1,000 to purchase new home furniture instead of the old ones she has. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, helped her buy better furniture. Getting this loan will make Riham and her family live in better home conditions.

Riham is a religious woman as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, es un artesano de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18, más dos chiquitines, su principal fuente de ingreso es la fabricación y venta de loza de barro, es un trabajo de familia, tienen  muchos años de estar en esta actividad, sus hijos trabajan junto a él, unos fabricando y otros quemando lo fabricado, luego los llevan a comercializar, su dificultad es que no disponen de suficiente capital para comprar materia prima.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales barro, nacazcol y leña, teniendo este material ellos podrán aumentar la producción y por lo mismo tener más oportunidades de vender.
Él ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos, su sueño es dejarlos preparados para que puedan tener su propio hogar, en una condición estable y que crezcan en el negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 51-year-old artisan.  He lives with his wife and six children who are 25, 22, 20 and 18 years old plus two little ones.  His main source of income is the manufacture and sale of clayware.  It is a family business.  They’ve been doing it for many years.  His children work with him, come of them forming and other firing what’s made.  Then, they take them to be sold.  His difficulty is that he lacks enough capital to buy raw materials.

Currently, he’s asking for a loan to buy clay, nacazcol (a black dye) and firewood.  By having these materials on hand he can increase production and have more opportunities to sell.

He has always supported his children and his dream is to leave them well prepared to be able to have their own homes in stable conditions and that they will be able to grow with the business.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol (dye) and firewood to make clay crafts.

loans.name: Rubén Edgardo

texts.es: Rubén Edgardo de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad donde residen porque venden el pan más exquisito y a los mejores precios, el tiene muchos años de ser un artesano del pan, como él mismo se llama; además Rubén les da el mejor servicio, siempre está a la orden del cliente; él es un hombre lleno de metas por alcanzar y una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio él piensa que aquel que ama a su trabajo también se ama a sí mismo  y sus sueños es por eso que muy decidido le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como harina, levadura, azúcar, bandejas entre otros. Rubén Edgardo tiene la esperanza que su humilde trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en: Ruben Edgardo is thirty-six years old and he lives with his life-partner and their children. He has a well-known bakery in the community where he lives. He sells the most exquisite breads and at the best prices. He has been a bread artisan for many years, matching his name. Ruben also provides the best service and he is always ready to serve his clients. His is a man who has many goals to attain and one of them is to see his business grow. He thinks that those who love their work also love themselves and their dreams. It is the reason why he has requested a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, baking trays, etc. Ruben Edgardo hopes that his humble work will permit him to provide his family with financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, sugar, and baking trays.

loans.name: Dora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Dora, es originaria de la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de 4 hijos. Ella estudio contabilidad pero es dueña de una pulpería. Ella inicio su actividad de comercio hace 25 años cuando puso la pulpería este ha sido su segundo negocio. Anteriormente tenia un puesto de sodas donde distribuía al por mayor y al detalle el negocio lo administraba su esposa mientras ella trabajaba en una empresa agrícola ella se desempañada en el área de contabilidad pero la despidieron y con el pago de su liquidación puso su negocio de pulpería en la que actualmente vende productos varios tales como granos básicos, sodas, leche, huevo, verduras, jugos enlatados.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar pollo y carnes al por mayor. Ya que estos productos son muy demandados por su clientes y generan buena ganancia. En sus planes futuros ella quiere comprar un vehículo para entregar productos comestible que ella vende a domicilio con esto daría mas rotación a su inventario. Posteriormente le gustaría convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Dora, a native of León, is married and the mother of 4 children.  She studied accounting but is the owner of a general store. She started this business 25 years ago when she established the store beside her second business.  Previously she had a soda stand where she sold wholesale and her husband ran the business and handled the finances while she worked for an agricultural company.  She worked in the accounting department but they let her go.  She used the severance pay to open the general store where she currently sells various products such as basic grains, milk, eggs, vegetables and canned juices.

She needs the loan to buy chicken and meat wholesale since these products have a big demand from her customers and generate good earnings.  In her future plans she wants to buy a vehicle to deliver her products, fuel that she will sell to homes, and these will give her more inventory rotation.  Later she would like to convert her general store into a food distribution center.

loans.use: To buy chicken and meat wholesale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her one lovely child. Seng is a farmer who grows a rice crop. From this business, she earns a low income per day. To assist her revenue, her husband runs a business as a motor taxi driver and he earns approximately $3 per day. 

Since her husband’s motorbike is broken, she would like to purchase a motorbike but lacks money so she has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva to buy a new motorbike for servicing clients. She hopes that this fund will change her family’s situation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike .

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  
La socia Norma; La socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 4  hijos; La socia se dedica  a la atención de sus vacas, ella tiene ganados vacunos, la socia trabaja vendiendo leche, ella reparte la leche a sus amistades y cuando se le acumula la lleva a la feria en los poblados aledaños a Tambo Real; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados, ella tiene 20 vacas lecheras y 3 toros, la socia también tiene animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Norma, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.
Norma is 43 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She breeds cows and tends to them. She sells milk, distributing a part of it to her friends, and taking the exceeding quantities to the fair in the neighboring villages in Tambo Real. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals. She has 20 dairy cows and 3 bulls, and she also keeps small animals. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals.
She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy mineral salts for her cattle.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en: Chernor is a small-scale businessman in the northern city of Makeni. The 38-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is a husband and father of two children. His wife is a nurse and one of his children is attending primary school. Chernor sells medicines and has been running this business for the past three years. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 SLL from Kiva field partner SMT, in order to improve his pharmacy. He will use this loan to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy

loans.name: Estefania Lilibeth

texts.es:
Estefanía de 21 años, una mujer trabajadora y honrada que ha sabido como ganarse la vida honradamente.
Su negocio es un salón de belleza ubicado en la parte delantera de su vivienda, empezó esta actividad realizando varios cursos.

Es madre soltera, tiene un niño de 5  años de edad, su dificultad es el polvo ya que por donde ella vive  su calle no esta pavimentada, ya que esto le afecta mucho a la clientela.

Ella solicita este préstamo para ampliar y mejorar e incrementar su negocio el dinero restante lo quiere para comprar accesorios para su  negocio    como: tijeras, tinte para el cabello, sillas, etc.

El sueño de ella es que su calle sea pavimentada y que su hijo pueda terminar su carrera escolar.
texts.en: Estefanía, 21, is a hardworking, honest woman who has known how to earn her living honorably.  Her business is a beauty salon located in the front part of her house.  She started this activity taking several courses.  She’s a single mother of a five-year-old son.  Her difficulty is dust because in the area where she lives the street is unpaved and this affects her clientele quite a bit.  She asks for the loan to expand, improve and enlarge the business.  She will use any money left over to buy supplies for the business like scissors, hair color, chairs, etc.  Her dream is that her street is paved and that her son can finish his schooling.

loans.use: to buy furniture, scissors and hair color.

loans.name: Manua

texts.en:
Manua is 27 years of age and married with one child. Manua owns & operates a business venture, driving a taxi.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Manua needs a loan of WST $1500 to renew vehicle license.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Manua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Manua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is a loving husband and father of three. He lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His two oldest children live independently and the youngest one is a school student. 

Gantulga started his business making wooden furniture at home in 2002. His furniture is well known for its quality and design. His wife sells his furniture in the market. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I have done everything I can to support my children. Now that they are old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.use: to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живет и трудится в Каменке. Он занимается сельским хозяйством и, в частности, выращивает ранние овощи: помидоры и редис на продажу. У Александра есть два участка земли: на одном – большая теплица, на втором – две построенных и еще одну строит. Каждый год Александр садит 5 000 высокорослых помидор. В сельскохозяйственном бизнесе он уже 9 год. На данный момент Александр уже вложил в хозяйство 65 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 30 000 гривен. 

Александр планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закончить строительство дополнительной теплицы, купить пленку и установить отопление в уже существующих теплицах. Недавно купив участок в 10 соток, Александр планирует развиваться за счет него и строить там новые дополнительные теплицы. Это позволит ему расширить хозяйство и увеличить доход.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Alexander lives and works in Kamenka.  He is involved in agriculture and grows various vegetables, such as tomatoes and radishes, for sale.  Alexander has two plots of land, one of which has a large greenhouse and the other has two completed and one unfinished greenhouse.  He plants 5,000 tall tomatoes every year.  He has been in the agricultural business for the ninth year now.  Alexander invested 65,000 hryvnia into his business to-date.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic is 30,000 hryvnia.  Alexander plans to use the Kiva loan of 15,000 hryvnia to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses.  Having recently bought a land plot of 10 sotkas, Alexander plans to grow there and build additional greenhouses.  This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 19 years. Ignacia earns 6000 PHP each month doing this farming. She does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

Ignacia requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ignacia hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en:
Faavale is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Asau Vaovai. She is married and has no chlidren. Faavale owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community.  Faavale has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Faavale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faavale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which was used to invest in expanding the business.  Faavale is now requesting her second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Faavale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is 40 year-old a married woman with two children. one of them is in school.  She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Besta is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan is 48 years old and a loving mother of three single children. She resides in the Prey Chor district of the Kompong Cham province. She is in two businesses: cultivating rice and recycling used materials. After she has just finished the bustle of her farming work, Kan intends to invest her time in collecting the recycled materials from place to place around her commune.

However, she doesn't own a motorcycle for long distance travelling. To solve that problem, she decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to make good progress in her recycling business. She'll keep the remaining funds as capital to buy recycled materials. She hopes that her business will grow and make her a good income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 35 years old and married. She has four children and two of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Edina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges, avocados, kale, tomatoes, pineapples, plums, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a resident of Birere, in Isingiro District, with four biological children all in school. She started a small retail shop some 20 years back but could not yield anything because of limited capital. That is when she got to know about Ugafode Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which helped increase her retail business's growth, and because of her hard work she continued expanding and eventually made enough money and started building a residential house for her children. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy construction materials to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Boyaba Group

texts.fr: Latifatou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle aussi âgée de 32 ans. Elle est dans le tricotage des layettes pour bébé à base de laine chez elle à la maison et cela fait 2 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 1 balle de file de qualité appelé Maroc à 60 000 francs et 12 paquets de file de marque appelé Étalon à 60 000 Francs et le reste 30 000 francs pour achat des accessoires, afin de tricoté des habits d'enfants et vendre. Elle applique un prix bas que les autres, le tissage est bien fait avec de jolie motifs et modèle ce qui fait que la vente de ses habits marche bien et en plus de cela elle utilise la qualité de file  marque Nigérian et Étalon. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser à la bonne date à ACFIME.

loans.use: Acheter 1 balle de file  à 60 000 francs et 12 paquets de file à 60 000 Francs et le reste 30 000 francs pour achat des accessoires.

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.en:
Karina is an engaging and hard working woman with two small children aged 5 and 2 years. She found herself needing to start her own business to support her family and provide them with the basic necessities. Karina sells used clothing and she has been doing so for more thna a year now, a business she opes to expand with the income she earns.

She requires a loan of $200 to buy more used clothing and to increase the variety of items she has for sale. Karina hopes that this will help her increase her sales and allow her to expand her business. She is grateful for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora tiene dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 2 años, ella se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio para apoyar a su propia familia de tal forma que desea tener un mayor ingreso para cubrir con las necesidades básicas de la familia. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene más de un año en este negocio, por lo que ella espera que crezca y que día con día sus ingresos aumenten.

Ella requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía como ropa usada para aumentar la variedad de artículos que tiene a la venta, ya que Karina espera que de esta forma sus ventas se incrementen y su negocio vaya a crecer. Ella espera de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village.
5 years ago Ilgar decided to start cattle breeding .
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves and improve his business. 
His business success will allow him to cover his family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Ellsie

texts.en: Ellsie is a mother of two children.  She is twenty-nine years old.  She admits that the income from her business determines whether her children have enough to eat and can stay in school or not and that this creates a lot of pressure for her to be a successful businesswoman.  Ellsie buys handicrafts and clothing handmade by local villagers and resells their products at the larger market in town.  She says that her business is suffering from competition because there are so many nearby stalls that sell similar goods.  Ellsie is thus applying for a loan from SPBD.  Her plan is to use loan funds in order to purchase merchandise that can differentiate her product line from her nearby competitors.  SPBD is confident that loan funds combined with Ellsie’s ingenuity will ensure that the income stream from her stall remains healthy.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her flea market stall

loans.name: Maria Sanjuana

texts.es:
Maria is originally from the town of Escobedo, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She's married and has two children, ages 16 and 25. Her husband is a teacher at a local school, but his salary isn't sufficient for them to afford the children's education. Out of necessity, five years ago Maria started selling used clothing, and little by little she has increased her supplies and her sales. Now she has posts in three local markets.

In order to keep her business growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to buy more clothing for resale. This will allow her to offer a wider selection to her customers. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in improving the quality of life for Maria and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como profesor en una escuela de la localidad pero su salario no era suficiente para poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad, desde hace cinco años Maria inició con la venta de ropa usada, poco a poco fue surtiendo más mercancía e incrementando sus ventas, ahora ya se instala en tres mercados rodantes.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale
